7:15.race_name: Join Us To Walk As One Handicap
7:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Billyb
runners.comment: Course winner who didn't get much luck when favourite at Beverley latest; dangerous
runners.spotlight: Course winner, who is on a workable mark and he didn't get much luck when favourite at Beverley (7.4f, good) 13 days ago; should get a good tow into this race and has claims if he gets the breaks this time; cheekpieces reapplied.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Billyb was quite keen when we got him. He's settled down quite a lot and he's done that well - Craig Lidster, trainer.

runners.name: Lerwick
runners.comment: Losing run is up to 11 and was well held at Beverley last time; down the list
runners.spotlight: Both wins were for his former yard and latest was at Beverley (8.4f) last summer; showed signs of a revival when close fifth at Kempton last month but he was well below that form at Beverley two weeks ago; blinkers now return but losing run is up to 11 and others are preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He showed plenty of promise last year in three runs over a mile, finishing second twice. First time out this year at Haydock, he was probably a bit fresh and finished fourth of the 14 runners over a mile, but he's much better than that. I would suggest readers keep on the right side of him as I think he's on a very decent mark. He's fine over a mile but I can see him doing all right over 1m2f. 01-06-23

runners.name: Master Richard
runners.owner: T S Ingham & Mrs Liz Ingham
runners.comment: Well treated on old form but he's been well held in both runs this season; opposable
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who is well treated on his old form but last win was over two years ago and he's returned after wind surgery with two tame efforts this spring; down the list.

runners.name: King Of Charm
runners.comment: Dual winner but he's not been at best in last two runs and needs to rediscover his spark
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-7 when landing a Sandown handicap (7f, good) last August but he ended last season on a low note and was quiet on his Nottingham (8.3f) reappearance last month; still unexposed at this trip but he needs to rediscover his spark.

runners.name: Mudamer
runners.comment: Last win was in 2023 and his form has gone the wrong way in three runs this season
runners.spotlight: Acts on good to firm and good to soft; started this season with a close call off this mark at Ripon (1m, good) but he's taken two backward steps since; now goes back up in trip but he's not won since August 2023 and others are more convincing; cheekpieces return.

quotes.race: Jill Willows Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Mudamer would have won before now - he's very talented. I think the cheekpieces have helped him a lot because he hit the front at York and then just shut down. It's just made him focus. He's made hard work of it on what he does at home. I have a horse, Scottish Summit, rated 91 and this fella will kick him into touch without even coming off the bridle - Geoff Harker, trainer.

runners.name: Dembe
runners.comment: AW specialist but he's unexposed on turf and is on a dangerous mark back in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Recorded his eighth AW win when completing a double at Newcastle (1m) in March; came up short at Lingfield last time but that was another good effort in a valuable handicap on Good Friday; now returns to turf but he's still lightly raced in this sphere and is 11lb lower than last time; not ruled out.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Handicap
quotes.quote: Dembe missed the break and ran out a bit and got behind off a strong pace. I wasn't confident until the last 100 yards but he could come back here on Good Friday - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

runners.name: Viennoise
runners.comment: Best form has been on AW and was only fifth of six at Carlisle (1m) last month
runners.spotlight: Won a Polytrack maiden (7f) last April but has mixed record since and was only fifth of six at Carlisle (1m, good to firm) last month; record now stands at 1-10 and her turf form lags some way behind her best AW efforts.

runners.name: Bass Player
runners.comment: Ended last year with two AW wins but he's been out of sorts back on turf this season
runners.spotlight: Ended last year with two Wolverhampton wins (8.6f) but he's struggled at Yarmouth and Thirsk in his two runs this season; has won here in the past but he needs a big turnaround back at this track.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Bass Player retains plenty of ability but has his quirks. We had sweetened him up a little and my daughter Lauren rode him in some amateur races. I'm hopeful there could be a bit more to come - he has the ability to travel well through a race which does help on the all-weather - Kevin Frost, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A really lovely horse who ran well last year without winning before undergoing a wind operation over Christmas. He has had three runs since and there were some very positive signs on his penultimate run at Goodwood. When everything falls into place I feel he can pick up a good race. 06-07-23

runners.name: Eligible
runners.comment: Won at Southwell in December but diminishing returns since and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Won off 2lb higher at Southwell (1m, AW) in December but he's had diminishing returns since and was beaten 10l at York last month; now goes back up in trip but he's not won on turf for a long time and others are preferred.

quotes.race: Yorkshire Equine Practice Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a great ride.The instructions were to drop Eligible in and fill him with confidence, he loves passing horses - David Easterby, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Makeen
runners.comment: Well treated on Beverley win last spring and was close third on AW last month; respected
runners.spotlight: Four-time turf winner who is versatile ground-wise; his last success was off 3lb higher at Beverley last May and he returned from a break with close third at Newcastle (1m) last month; this is tougher back up in grade but he could have a big role to play.

runners.name: Project Geofin
runners.comment: Both wins have been at shorter trips on AW and he's been below form in last three runs
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been at Newcastle (6f/7f) but he's been below form at that track in his last three runs; looks worth another try at this trip but he's still above his last winning mark and has bit to prove on this return to turf.

runners.name: Chuzzlewit

prev_owners.owner: J C G Chua And Partner

runners.comment: Losing run is mounting up but was placed on AW latest and he's not ruled out for new yard
runners.spotlight: His last win was at Newcastle (1m) last March; 0-16 since then but he's dropped a long way in the weights and was a creditable third at Newcastle last month; left Kevin Ryan since but he needs a close look back on turf for new yard.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I think the world of Chuzzlewit. He relaxed lovely today but he was still green and backward and there is more to come. He shows speed at home but he'll have no problem staying a mile next year. He won't run again until next year, he'll keep progressing and I don't know how good he could be - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He travelled very strongly through the Lincoln but just got a bit lost when he was let down on the testing ground. It was a better run than his finishing position suggests and we know now not to run in such testing conditions again. He's another who could be competitive in some of those decent 7f-mile handicaps in the summer. 04-04-24

I really like what I have seen from this colt who is a half-brother to triple Group 1 winner Advertise out of a particularly good Cheveley Park mare. He is doing everything nicely at home although I am not pressing too many buttons too soon, so he will be ready hopefully by the middle of next month, but definitely one to look out for. 15-06-22

runners.name: Timetobenice
runners.comment: Sole win was in November 2023 and has struggled in his last two runs; passed over
runners.spotlight: Sole win was in a Kempton maiden (1m) in November 2023; some creditable efforts on AW this year but he's struggled in last two runs including on his stable debut at Ripon (66-1) last month; passed over.

8:25.race_name: Help WPCC Fund New MRI Scanner Handicap
8:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Trefor
runners.owner: Julie Martin & David R Martin & Partner
runners.comment: Triple 6f winner and was close up behind Buccabay at Windsor last month; dangerous
runners.spotlight: Three 6f wins on good to firm and latest was at Newmarket last June; has some ups and downs in his 12-race record but he returned to form with a close fourth behind Buccabay at Windsor (5-2 favourite) last month and has claims if he can back that up.

quotes.race: Packhorse Moulton Supports Racing Welfare Handicap
quotes.quote: Trefor is an improving horse who enjoyed the quick ground - Rab Havlin, rider.

runners.name: Buccabay
runners.comment: Made it 4-15 on turf when scoring on Windsor reappearance last month; respected up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Improved his turf record to 4-15 when scoring on Windsor reappearance (6f, good to firm) last month; that was a surprise at 22-1 but he hit a personal best with that success and is only 2lb higher here; respected.

quotes.race: Betfred 'Join Our Sports Club' Reverence Handicap
quotes.quote: Buccabay gets hammered by the handicapper because he's so consistent. I made an error and ran him back way too quickly last time. He always runs his race. He's got a lovely turn of foot but it doesn't last very long so you have to be brave and wait for as long as possible - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

quotes.race: Interex Group British EBF Crocker Bulteel Maiden Stakes (Not Run More Than Once) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: I'm thrilled with Buccabay. Who knows what the form is but I've always liked him, he just needs a bit of educating. He was very green at Newbury and I was quite worried he was going to be weak. I looked at him today in the paddock and he was so up behind, I don't know where it came from, it's just happened in the past week, so I think he'll probably need a bit of time now to let his front come up to his back. Everything went wrong at Newbury. He got mullered coming out of the stalls and knocked about here, there and everywhere but it taught him, you can see he has a great mind. He settled very well, picked up and I think these Saxon Warriors have a lovely turn of foot - Eve Johnston Houghton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won the second of his two runs as a 2yo when taking an Ascot maiden in mid-summer. Unfortunately, the handicapper was more impressed than he should have been and really punished Buccabay for that win giving him an opening mark of 87. This term he has had four runs without looking like adding to that one win and has dropped down to a mark of 81. Hopefully, we can run him in calmer waters now and give him a chance again. 11-07-23

runners.name: Mythical Phoenix
runners.comment: Plenty of good runs last season and he's still on workable mark; one to keep an eye on
runners.spotlight: 0-8 last season but produced a series of good performances (5f/6f, various ground), including a near-miss on his reappearance last May; returns after wind surgery and every chance he'll be bang there; withdrawn after bolting to post at Redcar last Monday.

runners.name: Vicario
runners.comment: Well below form in her last three runs and needs a major revival back in trip
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when winning a four-runner Haydock handicap (6f, good to firm) last August; tough assignments in Listed events in next two runs but she struggled again when returned to a handicap at Newmarket last month; that was at 7f after an absence but she needs a major revival back in trip.

stable_tour.quote: She was an underachiever last year but is in great nick and I have big hopes for her this season. She ran in a Listed race on her final start of 2024 and she'll probably start back in that company. She's run well at 6f but I think 7f will be her bag. 16-04-25

runners.name: Gressington
runners.comment: All turf runs on good or quicker; close third over C&D latest and he's on unchanged mark
runners.spotlight: All turf runs have been on good or quicker ground; won in blinkers at Redcar last September and he got back near that level when a close third over C&D (first-time visor) last month; on unchanged mark and he's a player if he can repeat that latest form.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study Restricted Novice Stakes (No More Than 3 Runs) (Bands B-D) (GBB)(Div II)
quotes.quote: Gressington was green in the preliminaries and he will improve a bundle. It was a nice debut he can improve from and I feel there were some smart types in the race, so hopefully the form has a bit of substance to it - Ed Bethell, trainer.

runners.name: Nazron
runners.comment: Both wins at 5f and he's not been easy to predict since his last success; down the list
runners.spotlight: Dual 5f winner and latest was at Windsor (good to firm) last August; only 1lb higher than for that success but has mixed record since and was out the back at York last month; now drops back in grade but he has something to prove back up in trip.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Job done I think for Nazron. He's ran consistent all year. He's a nice horse and it was nice to get his head in front, so hopefully that will give him a bit of confidence going forward - David Egan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Kats Bob
runners.comment: 4-6 for current yard and he didn't get any luck when third at Carlisle latest; in the mix
runners.spotlight: A big success story for this yard, winning his first four starts over 6f (AW/turf); held in last two runs but he didn't get any luck when third at Carlisle last month; remains on a career-high mark but he's versatile ground-wise and could be a big factor if things go more to plan this time.

stable_tour.quote: He arrived here in February in good nick from Iain Jardine's stable looking for a change of scenery having been in the same yard since he was a yearling. He proceeded to rattle off three on the spin at Newcastle twice and then at Southwell by two lengths. His trip is 6f and he likes some give in theound. I'm looking at Thirsk in May next, but things will be more difficult for him off an all-time high mark. Also entered at Newcastle and Thirsk this week. 09-04-25

runners.name: Brazen Bolt
runners.comment: Useful in his prime but he's lost his way and has plenty to prove; stablemate of Kats Bob
runners.spotlight: Useful for the Quinns in his prime but last win was in Bahrain 17 months ago and he's struggled since returning to Britain; mark is tumbling but he failed to beat a rival on stable debut at Thirsk last month and has plenty to prove; yard also runs Kats Bob.

quotes.race: Great Prices On bresbet.com Handicap
quotes.quote: It was fairly easy, I just jumped out of the stalls and sat with him. Brazen Bolt was happy there and we didn't complicate it. He's an older horse and knows what he's doing - Gianluca Sanna, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's another new addition who could be exciting if I can find the key to him. He spent many years with John Quinn but, just before he came here, he spent a few months in Bahrain, so he's well travelled. We're good at sweetening up newcomers here. He's going to have all the time he needs and is a long-term project. 09-04-25

runners.name: Smart Vision
runners.owner: J E Abbey And New Vision Bloodstock
runners.comment: On last winning mark and was good third over C&D on penultimate run; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Prominent-racer who has won three times over 7f and latest was at Thirsk (good) last August; didn't fire at Ascot last month but that was after a good third over C&D and he's now back on last winning mark; not ruled out.

7:50.race_name: WPCC See It. Treat It. Appeal Handicap
7:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Philanthropist
runners.comment: Dual AW winner; creditable fourth in good Ascot handicap when back on turf last month
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner, latterly when leading close home on seasonal/handicap debut at Southwell (7f) in April; kept on well for creditable fourth in good-quality Ascot handicap (7f, good to firm) when back on turf last month and commands respect in this lower grade.

runners.name: Eves Boy
runners.comment: Persistently denied clear run before keeping on at York on seasonal debut; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Safely held on nursery debut in the autumn but is likely to have entered several notebooks after last month's reappearance at York (7f, good to firm), where he was persistently denied a clear run before keeping on well from the rear to finish sixth of 14; shortlisted.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Eve's Boy is a lovely horse who ran really well first time. You can put a line through his second run because he got a bit anxious in the gate, but he's shown there what we thought he could do. He'll be a nice horse next year, a winter on his back will do him good - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

runners.name: Territorial Knight
runners.comment: Back from winter break with pretty good third on handicap debut at Beverley; considered
runners.spotlight: Cut little ice in valuable races on final two 2yo starts but, following gelding and wind operations, returned with pretty good third of five on handicap debut at Beverley (7.4f, good) in April; considered.

runners.name: Native Instinct
runners.comment: Cleacut novice winner in October but has fitness to prove on this handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Delivered on earlier promise when drawing clear for ready success in Redcar novice (6f, soft) in October; open to further progress in handicaps this year but has fitness to prove here and may not be as well suited by the forecast faster ground.

runners.name: Mr Fantastic
runners.comment: Well down the field on seasonal/handicap debut (6f); has a point to prove
runners.spotlight: Came good with 7f Tapeta novice win in September, his fourth start; well down the field when dropped back to 6f on that surface for seasonal/handicap debut in April, though, and arrives here with a point to prove.

runners.name: Up The Pace
runners.comment: Suited by well-run 6f when causing 33-1 surprise at Ascot last month; back up in trip here
runners.spotlight: Gained his 2yo win over 7f but was evidently suited by a well-run 6f when keeping on well to cause 33-1 surprise on seasonal reappearance at Ascot (good to firm) four weeks ago; back up in trip here; may improve again.

quotes.race: Motivator 20th Derby Anniversary Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely delighted. Up The Pace is best on softer ground but he seemed to handle the quicker surface so that opens up a few more options. He was probably only 80 per cent fit so there's a bit to work on still - Edward Smyth-Osborne, trainer.

runners.name: Griselda
runners.comment: Won three 6f nurseries last summer but both runs this spring have been disappointing
runners.spotlight: Started off in nurseries with three 6f wins last summer but both runs this spring (6f/7f) have been disappointing and she needs to get her career back on track; cheekpieces removed after one use.

stable_tour.quote: She's tall, imposing and covers a lot of ground, she looks a really smart prospect for the yard. It's hard to know quite when she'll get started but she's showing us enough at home to suggest she'll be able to run over six furlongs. 29-03-24

runners.name: Vocal Legend
runners.comment: Dual 6f AW winner this year; needs to find something extra on this return to 7f
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f AW winner this year, latterly in valuable Lingfield handicap in April; didn't run badly when back on turf at Ascot last month (race won by Up The Pace) but needs to find something extra on this return to 7f.

runners.name: Shazani
runners.comment: 1-9 as a 2yo for Charlie Johnston; others in this line-up may have much greater potential
runners.spotlight: 1-9 as a 2yo for Charlie Johnston; sold for Â£25,000 after finishing third in a 6f nursery in October and was gelded during subsequent 242-day break; others in this line-up probably have much greater potential.

runners.name: Stardancer
runners.comment: Second in two 6f Southwell (AW) novice races during the winter; new trip for h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two 6f Southwell (AW) novice races during the winter, latterly behind a subsequent Listed winner; makes handicap debut after a five-month break but could have untapped potential over 7f.

5:34.race_name: Support Weston Park Cancer Charity "Confined" Apprentice Handicap (No Win Since 2024 Flat Season)
5:34.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Leagle Aid
runners.comment: Clear second behind an improver at Southwell; 2lb well in off same mark and he's respected
runners.spotlight: Acts on good to firm and good to soft; bolted up in Catterick novice (1m4f) last August and he's found more progress back in handicaps since; was no match for the winner at Southwell (1m6f, AW) last Saturday but he pulled 5l clear of the third and is 2lb well in off same mark here; respected back in trip.

runners.name: My Chiquita
runners.comment: May have needed her reappearance run at Bath and has claims if she can get back near best
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner, with first two on the Flat and last three over hurdles; went close off this mark here (14.5f, good) last summer and she may have needed her reappearance run at Bath (1m2f) last month; now goes back up in trip and has claims if she can get back near best.

quotes.race: Alfred Brown Worsted Mills Ltd Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: My Chiquita travelled a lot better today. We'll probably put her away as she wants better ground and we could wait for the mares' meeting at Cheltenham in April - Ben Brookhouse, trainer.

quotes.race: JTC Pizzalicious Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: My Chiquita is still a big baby, but it's great we could win with her as we lost her half-brother. We originally were going to put her away as we thought the ground would be wrong, but when we saw it was like it was we schooled the hell out of her - Ben Brookhouse, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's 2-2 for us over hurdles and is having a break as she wants better ground. She won well at Sedgefield and Wetherby and we'll get her ready for the mares' meeting at Cheltenham in April. She'll have a couple of options there, either a handicap hurdle or Listed novice hurdle. It's all about building a pedigree with her to go on as a broodmare. 30-11-23

runners.name: Endless Whisper
runners.comment: Handicap newcomer and she needs checking in market on this step up to 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 5yo; showed some promise in AW novice events late last year, with her best effort a 2l fifth at Southwell (1m); returns after six months off but she has stamina on dam's side and needs checking in market upped to 1m4f on handicap debut.

runners.name: Haliphon

prev_owners.owner: Hermitage Racing, Ecurie De Montlahuc & Laurent Benoit

runners.comment: Runner-up at Leicester last month but he's hard to predict and is an infrequent winner
runners.spotlight: Back to form after a short break when runner-up behind an improver at Leicester (1m4f, good to firm) last month; has possibilities if he can back that up but he's not easy to predict and has managed only one win from his last 30 starts.

quotes.race: 100% Racing TV Profits Back To Racing Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Haliphon has probably got an opportunity to turn around at Epsom on Thursday in the Jump Jockeys Derby at a track he has really enjoyed in the past. Charlie Todd will probably ride not too dissimilar to how Bella has today - Ian Williams, trainer.

runners.name: V Twelve
runners.breeder: C Weld, R Kavanagh & D Hannigan

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mr J D Gordon

runners.comment: Back on the Flat with good front-running second over C&D last month; respected
runners.spotlight: Effective on fast and soft ground; dual-purpose performer, who won at Hamilton (1m3f, good) last July and he returned to the Flat with a front-running second over C&D last month; on unchanged mark and another bold bid could be on the cards.

quotes.race: Bosch Home Appliances At Maxwell's Northallerton Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: V Twelve is a nice, big horse and I hope he'll progress - William Maggs, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He had a flirtation with hurdling and showed ability at it. I've never hadajumps winner but my assistant Jack is mad keen on it, and it was a good idea as he's got a future in that code. He ran poorly on his return to the Flat at Bath - we'll give him another run but he's been on the go for a long time and may be due a break. 27-04-23

runners.name: Dibble Dabble
runners.comment: Had a near-miss at Windsor last time and she's a big player again off 2lb higher
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on two of her three starts this year, including a near-miss at Windsor (11.4f, good to firm) last time; up 2lb but she remains feasibly treated and seems versatile ground-wise; big player for in-form yard.

runners.name: Steps In Time
runners.comment: Still unexposed but he needs to find something extra at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Has finished placed in four of his five starts including when runner-up in a Haydock handicap (1m2f, good to firm) two weeks ago; still unexposed but he's not really progressed so far and needs to find something extra at this new trip.

runners.name: Star Start
runners.comment: Has lost his way again in last three runs and needs a major revival back on turf
runners.spotlight: Returned to form when scoring at Ripon (1m3f) last August but he's struggled under trailblazing tactics in last three starts; probably did too much too soon on Chelmsford reappearance (first run after wind op) last month but he needs a major revival back on turf.

stable_tour.quote: A Ripon winner last year off a mark of 58, he has recently had a wind operation and won't be back until June. He's one for apprentices and amateurs, in particular our very own Charli Parker, who was on board at Ripon. He's versatile as regards trip andound. 09-04-25

9:00.race_name: Weston Park Cancer Support On 01145533330 Handicap
9:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Belgravian
runners.comment: Unexposed gelding and he needs a close look on his handicap debut; cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Held at 100-30 or shorter in his four runs, with his best effort a second at Catterick (1m4f maiden) on his penultimate run in April; didn't fire at Kempton last month but it's still early days and he needs a close look on this switch to a handicap; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Analogical
runners.comment: Win and close second since switched to handicaps and he's a big player again
runners.spotlight: Big improvement upped to 1m4f on handicap/seasonal debut when landing the odds at Beverley (good to firm) last month; came up a bit short under a penalty at Redcar (1m6f; cheekpieces added) six days later but he pulled 4l clear with the winner; up another 4lb but he's open to more progress back in trip and is a big player again.

runners.name: Neoma
runners.owner: Mrs S Russell & A M Russell
runners.comment: Handicap newcomer but she's been disappointing in last three runs and has bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in fillies' maidens (7f/7.4f) in first two starts but she's been disappointing in her last three runs; has plenty of stamina in pedigree and now goes handicapping at this new trip but she needs to turn things around.

runners.name: Ice Jet
runners.comment: Two promising efforts in handicaps this spring and he still has potential; dangerous
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden but he was a close third on handicap debut at Navan (1m2f, good) in April and he had an excuse when hampered at Killarney (fourth of eight) last month; still has potential and he could be a big factor with cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Blue Tempus
runners.owner: Helen Loggin, A Gemmell & A Stennett
runners.comment: Shown promise in handicaps this term and has shaped as though this new trip could suit
runners.spotlight: Back after a gelding operation when runner-up on handicap debut at Beverley (1m2f, good) in April; was beaten 5l in that race and was similar story at Newbury (fourth of 14) next time but he's still unexposed and has shaped as though this new trip could suit; possibilities.

runners.name: Justenzia
runners.comment: Better effort when runner-up at Chepstow last week and she's respected back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Well held in first four runs but she got much closer to the target when runner-up in a Chepstow handicap (1m2f, good) last Friday; kept on well behind an all-the-way winner in that race and she's respected back up in trip.

runners.name: Radical Design
runners.comment: Struggled in his three qualifying runs and needs a transformation on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Struggled in two AW runs (1m2f/1m3f) for Andrew Balding late last year and was tailed off on stable debut at Windsor (1m; first run since gelded) last month; now goes handicapping but he needs a transformation back up in trip.

6:05.race_name: Napoleons Casino & Restaurant Supports WPCC Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
6:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Daiquiri Bay
runners.owner: A Stennett, G Kennington & C Hodgson
runners.comment: Emphatic win at Chester and he sets a high standard under a penalty for that success
runners.spotlight: 62,000gns breeze-up 2yo; shaped with promise when 33-1 third behind an impressive winner on Newbury debut (1m, heavy) in October; well backed into 11-4 on reappearance at Chester (10.3f, good) last month and he came from off the pace again to score by 5l; sets a high standard under a penalty for that success and he's open to more progress; key player.

runners.name: Regal Ulixes
runners.comment: Won at Newbury in September and he's respected under a penalty on his return; hood added
runners.spotlight: Made a promising start when third at Goodwood (1m, good) in September and he built on that when scoring at Newbury (1m, soft) 17 days later; that was a four-runner race but he beat the favourite with something in hand and he looks a useful prospect for middle distances this season; respected with hood added on his return.

quotes.race: Haynes, Hanson & Clark Novice Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Regal Ulixes is potentially quite good and we've always liked him at home. It was a bit of a muddling race, but he got the job done and has a future. He should go on next year so we'll likely keep him back for then - trainer Andrew Balding speaking on Sky Sports Racing:

runners.name: Antrim
runners.comment: Hasn't lived up to market expectations in two runs this spring; cheekpieces are now added
runners.spotlight: By Dubawi and out of a close relative to Enable; 5-4 favourite at Yarmouth (1m2f, good) in April but was never involved after a slow start and he was well held again when 2-1 at Haydock three weeks later; in good hands and still early days but he needs plenty of progress with cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Lightning Tiger
runners.comment: Has lots to find on this switch to turf and handicaps are an option after this
runners.spotlight: Well-held fifth on Wolverhampton debut (9.4f, Tapeta) in March and same outcome at Chelmsford (1m2f, Polytrack) last month; has lots to find on this switch to turf and handicaps are an option after this.

runners.name: Scotland
runners.owner: Qatar Bs, China Horse Club & D Howden
runners.comment: Has a striking pedigree but he didn't show much on Newmarket debut in April
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt who cost 190,000euros as a yearling and is a half-brother to seven winners; market springer into 6-1 on Newmarket debut (1m2f, good) in April but he was always behind after a slow start and finished a tailed-off last of nine.

runners.name: Singing In Paris
runners.comment: Never involved at Leicester and he may need more time and distance
runners.spotlight: 50,000euros 2yo; refused to enter the stalls in two intended outings this year; got his career started at Leicester (1m2f, good to firm) 11 days ago but he missed the break and was a never-dangerous fourth of six; this looks another tough assignment and he may need more time and distance.

runners.name: Yaa Min
runners.comment: Ran green on Newcastle debut (1m) in November and he needs major improvement on return
runners.spotlight: 370,000gns foal; 7-2 for Newcastle debut (1m, AW) in November but he ran green and finished a well-held seventh of 12; should know much more on this step up in trip but he needs major improvement after seven months off.

6:40.race_name: Hits Radio Proudly Supports WPCC Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
6:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Mudbir
runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford on recent return and he looks a useful prospect; respected under penalty
runners.spotlight: Kingman colt who is a sibling to some smart horses for these connections; made a promising start when runner-up at Newmarket (7f, soft) in October and he landed the odds with a comfortable win at Chelmsford (1m, AW) on his recent return; has a penalty but he looks a useful prospect and is strongly respected back on turf.

runners.name: Sea The Light
runners.comment: Won on Newcastle debut last month and he's open to progress upped in trip; in the mix
runners.spotlight: 15-2 when getting up late to win by a short head on debut in a small field at Newcastle (7f, AW) five weeks ago; carries a 7lb penalty today and others have more substance to their form but this Sea The Stars colt is open to plenty of improvement on this step up in trip; in the mix.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sea The Light's work was quite nice at home and we were quite confident coming here. He's only a baby - he's only a May foal - and we'll sit tight and give him a bit of time to mature but he'll be a nice horse in time - John Butler, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Broker Charlie
runners.comment: Regressive form in his three starts and can only be watched on this drop to 1m
runners.spotlight: Well held in two runs (1m2f/1m4f) for Ralph Beckett during the winter and was a tailed-off last on stable debut at Beverley (1m4f, good) last month; has lots to prove now dropped to 1m and can only be watched.

runners.name: Draupnir
runners.comment: Didn't show much at 40-1 on York debut (7f) last summer; best watched on comeback
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much on 7f York debut (good to firm; 40-1) last summer; that was a hot maiden but he's been gelded since and is best watched on return.

runners.name: Hard Endeavor
runners.comment: Promising third when favourite in Wood Ditton and he should know more this time; respected
runners.spotlight: 150,000euros yearling; 11-4 favourite in the Wood Ditton at Newmarket (1m, good) in April and and he made some promising late headway to finish third of 15; that form puts him firmly in the picture and he should be more streetwise this time; interesting contender.

runners.name: High Degree
runners.comment: Clear second when joint-favourite on Nottingham debut last month and he's respected
runners.spotlight: Ran green when joint-favourite on Nottingham debut (8.3f, good to firm) last month but he kept on well in the closing stages to finish a clear second; this is a deeper race but he should know much more this time and yard has been firing in winners recently; respected.

runners.name: Kings Charter
runners.comment: Two promising frame efforts last summer and he's a key player on his return; been gelded
runners.spotlight: 550,000euros foal, 650,000euros yearling; has a striking pedigree and he showed plenty of promise when reaching the frame at Sandown (7f) and Newbury (1m) last summer; been gelded since but his form has plenty of substance and he sets the standard on his return; key player.

runners.name: Lone Warrior
runners.comment: 150,000gns foal; makes plenty of appeal on paper and needs watching in market on debut
runners.spotlight: 150,000gns foal; third foal; half-brother to 7f/1m 2yo winner Ghostwriter (including Group 2; RPR 120); dam Listed-placed 1m4f AW winner (98), half-sister to useful 7f/1m winner Marching Time, out of sister to 2,000 Guineas winner Zafonic; hood is applied on debut but he makes plenty of appeal on paper and needs watching in market.

runners.name: Nicator
runners.comment: 54,000euros yearling; has useful target to aim at on debut and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: 54,000euros yearling; gelded half-brother to French Group-placed 9.5f/1m2f winner Chartwell (RPR 105); dam French 9.5f winner (86), half-sister to 5f Group 3 winner Ideal Beauty; has useful target to aim at on debut and is best watched unless market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: R P Mcmurphy
runners.comment: Made low-key start at a big price here last month; probably one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: Well-related colt but he made a low-key start at a big price here (7f, good to firm) last month; was beaten 13l in that race and he's probably one for further down the line.

runners.name: Sir Wootton
runners.comment: Well held in both runs (1m) this spring, with RPRs in the 50s on both occasions
runners.spotlight: Well held in two runs (1m) this spring, with RPRs in the 50s on both occasions; stablemate of Sea The Light and he remains best watched for now.

runners.name: Kittens Gift
runners.comment: 100-1 and she finished tailed-off last on Kempton debut (7f, AW) last month
runners.spotlight: 100-1 and she finished tailed-off last on Kempton debut (7f, AW) last month.

runners.name: Nightsinwhitesatin
runners.owner: David Kilburn, Mrs Corbett, Chris Wright
runners.comment: Modest form at Newcastle in October and has stacks to find in this useful race
runners.spotlight: Missed the break and was never involved when sixth of seven at Newcastle (7f, AW) in the autumn; goes up in trip on her return but she has stacks to find in this useful race and others are preferred.

runners.name: Rajinoora
runners.comment: Still early days for this well-bred filly but she needs a transformation back on turf
runners.spotlight: 78,000gns yearling; well-bred filly but she didn't live up to market expectations at Newbury in April and was well held again at Wolverhampton (8.6f) last month; still early days but she needs a transformation back on turf.

runners.name: Special Breeze
runners.breeder: M H Sly & Mrs P M Sly
runners.owner: Michael H Sly Dr T Davies Mrs Pam Sly
runners.comment: Half-sister to three winners but this looks a tough starting point and is best watched
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to winners Eileendover (smart bumper; 1m6f Flat, RPR 101), John Clare (7f; 77) and Special Mayson (6f/7f; 73); dam 1m winner (79), half-sister to 1m/1m2f winner Wintercrack, out of 1,000 Guineas winner Speciosa; this looks a tough starting point and is probably best watched.

runners.name: Tardaff
runners.comment: Has useful standard to aim at on debut and she could be a longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; sister to 6f winner Belated Breath (RPR 97), half-sister to five winners including Quickthorn (1m3f-2m including Group 1; 119) and City Streak (9.4f-1m4f; 98); dam 7f-1m2f winner (74); has useful standard to aim at on debut and she could be a longer-term prospect.

4:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places

runners.name: Desert Flower
runners.comment: Unbeaten in five races; sure to stay beyond 1m after Guineas win but 1m4f is big question
runners.spotlight: Unbeaten in four races as 2yo, by an aggregate of almost 17l and culminating in Group 1 Fillies' Mile (good to soft; unraced on softer); evens when she reappeared for the 1,000 Guineas back at Newmarket (1m, good to firm) and she made all, strongly challenged but pulling 1l clear; shapes as if sure to stay beyond 1m, even though she's by the miler Night Of Thunder and her smart dam looked best up to 1m1f; the proven class act in this field but with stamina for 1m4f the big question.

quotes.race: Betfred 1000 Guineas Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Desert Flower is incredible. We looked at the race beforehand and we thought we'd have to make our own running and she showed what a versatile filly she is. She's very uncomplicated and she keeps galloping. She's all class. I think she could be an Oaks filly. I think that was the way everyone was thinking beforehand  - William  Buick, jockey.It's been amazing. It took long enough to win a Guineas with the colts and the fillies have been hard to come by. With the fillies, it's not a page I often look at in the conditions book as we haven't had many. So, when people ask me is Desert Flower the best filly we've had, she is by far, yes. I see no reason why she can't potentially stretch up to the mile and a half. She does all her best work in the last furlong and she settles well. So, it's just a nice conversation to have. The filly herself is the one who deserves the plaudits. She's an unbeaten filly and we came here with a lot of confidence as everyone knows and she's gone and delivered. She's always looked pretty special so we were confident. At one point, if you were watching it, you'd think we had a battle on our hands but I just knew that as soon as she hits that rising ground she will find another gear. It's what she does at home - she trains on a hill every day, so hills don't worry her. I wasn't surprised or too worried watching the race. We saw it in the Fillies' Mile and in the May Hill, she just goes through those gears and at one point she just looks a little bit sticky and with 'the Dip' here, as we know, especially with this quicker ground today. I said to Will [Buick] if you can get her into her rhythm because if you're sat there comfortably at the top of the 'the Dip' and then all of a sudden you're putting them on their head to go into 'the Dip' that's when they just start to stumble a little bit or to find their feet. We'll make a plan now, whether it's Ascot or whether we decide whether she's capable of stepping up a bit further - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Fillies' Mile (Group 1)
quotes.quote: I see no reason not to do that [go straight to 1,000 Guineas], as Desert Flower won't take much to get fit. She's a scopey filly but you'd love to see her put a few kilos on during the winter. We probably haven't had the fillies for a little while, but she's always pleased us. We were confident with her in her maiden and she's just kept pleasing us all the way throughout. She's not an exciting filly in the morning, but the way she does stuff and pulls up at the end of her gallop, it's like she hasn't done anything. She paraded very well and she's got a head that means hopefully she'll have something to think about over the winter. She'll be a more mature filly in the spring - Charlie Appleby, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Betfred May Hill Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: That was very pleasing. Desert Flower has done everything right so far and she's a nice big filly with plenty of scope for next year. I was always happy, she felt like she was handling the ground well. She was just having a look when she got to the front which you excuse in an inexperienced two-year-old. I was delighted with her. She came into the race very easily, that's the sign of a quality horse. She confirmed what she's shown us at home and on the racecourse on her previous starts - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Rossdales British EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: All credit to the team back home as only a couple of weeks ago Desert Flower took an age to go into the stalls and then wouldn't come out of them. William (Buick, jockey) sat on her recently and wasn't sure if she would win first time, but he came back just now and said he was surprised how she travelled into the race. She's a filly we could step up to a mile and work back from something like the May Hill - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

runners.name: Elwateen
runners.comment: This is 1m4f but going up to at least 1m2f should suit after Guineas 4th on second start
runners.spotlight: By Dubawi out of very smart mare who was unraced beyond 1m2f; justified 4-6 favouritism in novice at Kempton (7f, AW) last August; that was her solitary race until 1,000 Guineas at Newmarket (1m, good to firm) in which she was a weak 22-1 but always prominent to finish fourth of ten, just over 2l behind Desert Flower; this is 1m4f but going up to at least 1m2f should suit and, after just two races, she should still have significant potential.

quotes.race: Betfred 1000 Guineas Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Elwateen needs further and we could now look at the Oaks as an option. We will see how she comes out of today but she is a tough filly and it was only the second race of her life today. The further she goes, it will be better for her. She works with Tornado Alert [yesterday's 2,000 Guineas fourth] in the mornings and shows her class every time she works so that's why she ran today. She will improve a lot for this race and it will be better going further for her. I think she would go straight to Epsom as the Musidora would be too close. A bit more give in the ground would suit her - Saeed Bin Suroor, trainer.

runners.name: Giselle

prev_owners.owner: P M Brant & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: While weak Lingfield Oaks Trial was a satisfactory comeback, this demands great deal more
runners.spotlight: By Frankel out of US 1m Grade 1 winner; won a maiden at the Curragh before close third to Whirl in Group 3 there (1m, soft) later in October; Lingfield Oaks Trial (11.6f, good to firm) was almost a non-event in terms of the opposition and she was pushed/nudged out to go 9l clear in the last 2f, having been held up last of three in a first-time hood (retained); while that was a satisfactory comeback, and she's reported to have improved a lot at home since, this race will demand a great deal more.

quotes.race: William Hill Oaks Trial Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Giselle has done it well and three-runner races when the pace is slow are never easy. Ryan [Moore, jockey] said she's a top-class filly and she's going the right way. She's a beautiful stamp of a horse. She was keen but you'll see a more relaxed filly in a better race. We've got runners tomorrow and next week at York so we're going to learn a lot over the next few days, and then we can take stock and see what happens. She's in the mix for Epsom for sure - Paul Smith, representing owners Coolmore.

quotes.race: Staffordstown Stud Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Giselle was a bit babyish and still a bit green. He tried to teach her, which was the right thing to do. He was delighted with her. He felt that she isn't there yet. She got there and got a little bit tired. She had a big hold up in the middle of the season and I ran her because I wanted to get Ryan over to sit on her again and he was very happy with her. The experience will do her a world of good when it comes to next year. She's a very good filly - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Giselle is a smashing filly with a lot of class. She is a smashing big filly and hopefully she will be rocking up in all the big fillies' races next season - Chris Armstrong, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She had a few little hold-ups but we're looking at her as an Oaks filly with a trial before. She's headstrong and always trying to do a little more than you want her to, but she's a big filly, powerful and strong. 07-04-25

runners.name: Go Go Boots
runners.comment: May be able to improve again but Whirl left her nearly 6l behind in the Musidora at York
runners.spotlight: By Night Of Thunder out of a Lingfield Oaks Trial winner; winning novice events at Lingfield (1m/1m2f, AW) on first two starts showed plenty of promise, which she followed with third of six in the Group 3 Musidora at York (10.3f, good to firm; weak 9-1) 23 days ago; may be able to improve again but Whirl left her nearly 6l behind at York.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Musidora Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: We're delighted and Go Go Boots ran a great race. She had a little bit of trouble getting out of a pocket, but she's run very nicely and learnt a lot as that was her first time racing on grass. She's done two pieces of work on the grass this year and that's it as we haven't had it to work on. We're probably pointing more towards the Ribblesdale at this stage as that'll be the logical thing to do. She has a great attitude - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM/EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Go Go Boots doesn't even know she's had a run. She's missed the kick and she was very raw and green but she made up a lot of ground from the three [furlong pole] to the one. She looks a good mile and a quarter or mile and a half filly for next year - Kieran O'Neill, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Minnie Hauk
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Lots to find on form but won the Cheshire Oaks (11.5f, good) with more in the tank
runners.spotlight: By Frankel out of half-sister to Kingman and cost 1,850,000euros as a yearling; favourite for two Irish maidens over 1m last October, 2-5 and always front rank when winning at Leopardstown (soft); 13-8 favourite when reappearing in the Listed Cheshire Oaks at Chester (11.5f, good) one month ago and scored in similar style, not by far but clearly in charge from 2f out; that form is not a patch on Desert Flower's but this filly has reportedly "come on loads" since, she's the Aidan O'Brien number one on jockey bookings and an assured stayer who has more in the tank.

quotes.race: Weatherbys ePassport Cheshire Oaks (Listed Race) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: That [the Oaks] is the plan. Aidan always thought Minnie Hauk would improve a lot for this run. She's a very kind, uncomplicated filly with a great attitude. The step up in trip obviously helped and you'd be thinking of the Oaks. Ryan was niggling away just to get her interested, but she's kind and always answers to the jockey and she just kept on finding. Ryan was quite sweet on her - Paul Smith, representative of Coolmore, owners.

stable_tour.quote: She's improved a lot and done really well physically. She ran twice last season, finishing second at Cork and winning well at Leopardstown. She's a mile-and-a-half filly and is one for an Oaks trial. 07-04-25

runners.name: Qilin Queen
runners.comment: Made all to win Listed race at Newbury (1m2f, good to firm) by a short head from Revoir
runners.spotlight: By Pinatubo out of a 1m4f winner from classy family; unraced on softer than good; won second start as 2yo; placed in Listed events on next two outings before making all at that level in a ten-runner race at Newbury (1m2f, good to firm; raced freely) three weeks ago, hanging on by a short head from Revoir; faces another 2f here and keeping Revoir at bay may prove tricky, let alone finding the improvement she needs to beat all the rest as well.

quotes.race: Childwickbury Stud Fillies' Trial Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was really disappointed at Newmarket. We wanted to roll forward but Falakeyah was just too quick for us and Qilin Queen didn't come down the Dip too well either. I told Hollie Doyle to be bold today because she keeps galloping and she nailed it. She wasn't very good in the prelims before her last run but she was much better today. She was still a bit buzzy but that's just her and not something I'd worry about. If all is well we'll probably roll the dice at Epsom. She's very game, athletic and will stay well - Ed Walker, trainer.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Â£40,000 EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Qilin Queen is a nice filly going forward. She made a pleasing debut at Newbury but was quite green that day. It was noticeable how professional she was today and she's a tall, leggy filly who'll strengthen and improve for the year. I've no doubt she'll  train on and make a nice 3yo too - Ross Coakley, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

stable_tour.quote: I'm excited about her and I've entered her in the Oaks. I'll run her in a trial, probably the Pretty Polly - she needs fast ground and that race should suit her. She progressed with every run last year. 16-04-25

runners.name: Revoir
runners.comment: Narrowly failed to reel in Qilin Queen in 1m2f Listed race on just her second outing
runners.spotlight: By Study Of Man from a fine family for these connections, that of the 2008 Oaks winner Look Here; this filly has a strikingly similar profile to her, having won sole start as 2yo (1m on heavy) and come second in Listed race on reappearance; the latter race was at Newbury (1m2f, good to firm; 10-1) three weeks ago when getting to grips with Qilin Queen took some time but there was just a short head between them at the line; while her own dam was soundly beaten at 40-1 in her 2014 Oaks, this filly should find improvement over the extra 2f; it's very much needed but she is promising.

stable_tour.quote: We're not sure about whether she'll stay on her pedigree, but I'm keen to try her in a trial with the option of going to Epsom. 28-04-25

runners.name: Wemightakedlongway
runners.comment: Clearcut win in Group 3 at Navan (1m2f, soft) latest, making all and keeping on strongly
runners.spotlight: Made most to win 1m Cork maiden last October; three Group 3 contests since, against the males on first two occasions but then finding marked improvement against her own sex to win eight-runner race at Navan (1m2f, soft) on latest, making all and keeping on strongly to do it in clearcut style; she's by Derby winner Australia and there's a good chance she too will be suited by this trip; could ask the market leaders some serious questions.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Salsabil Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Wemightakedlongway is a good filly and I thought her last run, finishing behind Delacroix, was really good for a first run back. We were looking at going to Chester but when the drop of rain came, we decided to come here and she has won impressively. I have campaigned her aggressively and she ran against colts on both of her last two runs. She's a smart filly. The Pretty Polly at the Curragh is the race we're really building towards. She's out of a No Nay Never mare, so she just wouldn't be guaranteed to go a mile and a half. We'll see whether we look at Epsom or whether we look at something else before the Pretty Polly - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We thought it was a real good run when fifth in the Ballysax on her return, and she'll go to either Chester or to Navan for the Salsabil on Saturday. Hopefully she can be a real smart filly for the year. 24-04-25

runners.name: Whirl
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Shapes as if she will stay after winning 10.3f Musidora in style; has big each-way chance
runners.spotlight: By Wootton Bassett; progressed nicely last year, on final start making most and rallying splendidly to take a 1m Group 3 at the Curragh (1m, soft) with Giselle among those on her heels; never seriously involved on reappearance and started joint-third favourite of six for the Group 3 Musidora at York (10.3f) a month later but she led over 3f out and ran on strongly to win in style; dam 1m winner but dam's sister Hydrangea won Group 1s over 1m and 1m4f; shapes as if she will stay and has big each-way chance.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Musidora Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: As Ryan [Moore, jockey] said to me before the race, that was the plan to bump Whirl out, get a good position and if they caught her then sobeit. I don't think anybody expected that particularly. But Aidan [O'Brien, trainer] seems to be able to do that, as we know. I don't think that Whirl is an Oaks filly, I think she'd probably get a mile and a half but a mile and a quarter in something like the Prix Diane would be more suitable, I think. But I haven't discussed it with Derrick or John or Aidan. That's just my thinking - Michael Tabor, part-owner.

quotes.race: Staffordstown Stud Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Whirl just had that bit more experience and she got a lovely ride from Wayne. He went his pace and he was left alone to do it, and she was tough. She is another massive filly, these Wootton Bassetts are unbelievable - and they're just getting better - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Coopers Marquees EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Aidan [O'Brien, trainer] thought Whirl would improve and she has. She has a lovely temperament and plenty of size and scope for next year - Kevin Buckley, owners' UK representative.

stable_tour.quote: She won her last two runs last year, including a Group 3 at the Curragh, and has done very well. She could start in a Guineas trial or go to the Oaks trial at Navan. She's working well and we're very happy with her. 07-04-25

2:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places

runners.name: Ancient Wisdom
runners.comment: Group 1 winner as a 2yo; ran well in Group 3 last time; this demands a career best
runners.spotlight: Smart colt whose record of 3-5 on ground softer than good features a Group 1 success as a 2yo; ran well in Group 3 on good going at Sandown (1m2f) most recently; stays 1m5f; underfoot conditions aside, needs a career-best performance to land this prize.

quotes.race: Bahrain Trophy Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We were quietly confident as Ancient Wisdom was the class horse in the race and was racing on ground that we know he relishes. The plan from here is to head to the Voltigeur if the ground is right and plan our way to the St Leger. He is an autumn horse and we won't jeopardise that by running him on unsuitable ground - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Dante Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: We're happy and most importantly, Will [Buick, jockey] said Ancient Wisdom handled the ground. We were confident we'd handle it, but when you bring extreme conditions he excels in it. Trip-wise he's crying out to step up in trip and he'll come forward for this - he's having a good heave for one of ours. We'll let it all settle down as it's only two and a bit weeks and see how much he progresses from this. He'll come forward a good bit and a mile and a half is definitely his trip. A galloping track [at the Curragh] will be his. We feel a more sterner test suits, whereas Epsom you can be a mile and a quarter horse and win, because you have to be able to travel. This horse will come on a lot and allowed himself more time in the spring than Arabian Crown did - he's still coming in his coat - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Kameko Futurity Trophy Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: That was worth the wait. You don't want anything like that to happen but Aidan's horse looked like he got up okay, that's the main thing. We couldn't be more delighted. We thought Aidan's other horse was going to go forward and when he wasn't there Will (Buick) did his own thing. We know Ancient Wisdom stays and the plan was always to be handy. Charlie always had this race slightly in the back of his mind but he wanted to see how the horse was, and he's been pleasing him and we know he handles soft ground so we gave it a shot. He's very exciting. I think he'll be a horse who's going to want a trip next year. We've obviously got a very good one to beat in the Guineas so we'll see how he progresses over the winter and see how we go - Alex Merriam, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Emirates Autumn Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We were disappointed that we were beat at Ascot, but that race worked out so well you couldn't really be disappointed. I've probably mismanaged Ancient Wisdom running him back at Newmarket. Next year, I do feel a mile and a quarter will be within his compass and I think he will appreciate going a mile and a half. He is a Dubawi and as we know with those middle-distance type Dubawi's you can't force them too much in the spring of their three year old career so therefore something like a Dante might be a target for him. Whether we take a run before the Dante we will just see where we are in the spring, but we have a long winter ahead of us now. It is nice to be able to put these horses to bed on the back of an impressive victory - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They went no pace so I thought I'd teach Ancient Wisdom something and he finished off well - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: GPW Recruitment Carl Foster Memorial EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were expecting Ancient Wisdom to run a very good race and he's done that and a bit more. He went to sleep a little round the turn but once we straightened up I asked him to show a bit of interest and he jumped into the bridle and showed a good kick, hitting the line good. I'd say it was everything you would look for in a debut of a potentially smart horse - James Doyle, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Bellum Justum
runners.comment: Took well to first-time cheekpieces in Group 2 at Newmarket; harder task but could go well
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly on good/firmer; took well to first-time cheekpieces in small-field Group 2 at Newmarket (1m4f) most recently; faces a stiffer assignment at this level but he's the only course winner in the line-up and could go well in the retained headgear.

quotes.race: Betfred Jockey Club Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Bellum Justum is a high-class horse and had got some good form from last year. Obviously, the second is a very good horse as well. I am delighted because he was a big disappointment in the John Porter and it's just nice to see him back on track. I think the cheekpieces helped and it was an excellent performance. He has had a hard enough race today and I think we will probably wait for the Hardwicke now. It will nice to have runners with a chance for King Power at the Royal meeting - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: DK Horse Nashville Derby Invitational Stakes (Grade 3) (3yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Bellum Justum absolutely flubbed the start. I was way too far back, but lucky Jamie [Spencer, on pacesetting Navy Seal] was so fast. On the back straight, I was able to make good improvement to get a slot, because I knew he would stay very well. I knew he'd gallop out to the line because he stays a mile and a half - Frankie Dettori, rider.

quotes.race: Betfred Blue Riband Trial (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Bellum Justum showed some promise last year but had a little setback about a month ago. I think he is bound to come on for the run and we thought that whatever happened today, we would go to the Dante Stakes next and see where we are with him. Obviously, I need to talk it over with the owners but if all goes well there then the Derby would be the plan - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Colts And Geldings)
quotes.quote: Bellum Justum was very professional and it's great to have a winner for King Power. He'll probably have another run this year in something like the Autumn Stakes here next month - Sam Geake, trainer's assistant.

runners.name: Calandagan
runners.breeder: Haras De Son Altesse L'Aga Khan Scea
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Talented French gelding; good second in last year's International; top on ratings
runners.spotlight: Acts on any ground; talented French gelding whose 3yo form featured an emphatic win at Royal Ascot (1m4f Group 2) and good second to City Of Troy in the International; shaped well off steady pace in the Dubai Sheema Classic in sole run this term; top on ratings.

quotes.race: Longines Dubai Sheema Classic (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Calandagan was slow out of the stalls and he takes so much time to get into his rhythm. Mickael [Brazalona] said during the race he was happy they weren't going faster because he needed to get going. I don't have any excuses. In the straight we were following the winner and he had the first kick. He came really fast at the end. It was a very good start of the season for him. The plan is to go to Epsom for the Coronation Cup with him, but we'll see how he comes back from Dubai. It's a very good run and Mickael will know him more for the future, too - Francis Graffard, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco Champion Stakes (British Champions Middle Distance) (Group 1)
quotes.quote: I thought the race was over when Calandagan took the lead and to be fair I didn't see the winner coming. He ran a great race and well done to the winning connections. He was slow away and he [Stephane Pasquier] tried to put him in the race then he travelled nicely. He had his chance to win but the winner beat us on the line - Francis Graffard, trainer, speaking to ITV.

quotes.race: Juddmonte International Stakes (British Champions Series) (Group 1)
quotes.quote: It was a fantastic run, but the odds were right. The stride Calandagan showed in the straight was fantastic to watch. I shouted as we thought we were coming to get him, but he could only keep pushing a champion in City Of Troy. I'm very proud of the horse. We didn't have any Group 1 form before and there were lots of question marks, but the way he accelerated was fantastic. He can come back to Ascot in the Champion Stakes, but we'll discuss it. He gave a lot of heart on the track today - Francis Graffard, trainer.

quotes.race: King Edward VII Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Everything was easy. Calandagan can be a naughty boy sometimes, and we have to ask him gently. Today he wanted to do everything - when he's like this, he is a fantastic horse. I didn't do anything, I just asked him to do it by himself - Stephane Pasquier, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: His form has worked out quite well but it will obviously be a different proposition at Ascot. He's a proper horse who has done everything very easily this year, while he's indifferent to the ground. He's very easy actioned and covers a lot of ground so I don't think the mile and a half will be a problem. 13-06-24

runners.name: Continuous
runners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg
runners.comment: Has become inconsistent; possibly in here as pacemaker for Jan Brueghel
runners.spotlight: Ended his 2023 campaign with a success in the St Leger and good effort in the Arc; modest strike-rate since and has become inconsistent too; possibly in here as pacemaker for stablemate Jan Brueghel.

quotes.race: Longines Red Sea Turf Handicap (Group 2) (3yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Continuous ran very well. It was his first run back, so happy with him - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Shoda Market Cafe Royal Whip Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Continuous has loads of options. He could go to the Irish Champion Stakes or the Irish St Leger. He could run in the Irish Champion with a view to going to the Arc. He could go to the Japan Cup He is a very versatile horse and a great one to have. Dropping him back to this trip was not a worry. We decided we would take a lead today if we could. He could have popped out in front and done it all himself. He's a classy horse and an unusual type of horse and a very genuine horse. He can do it from 1m2f and possibly up to 2m - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: Qatar Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe (Group 1) (3yo+ No Geldings) (Grande) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I was very happy. We made the decision to take our time and relax, and Continuous dropped in lovely. The pace was very slow so they sprinted in the last two or three furlongs. He was coming through, but obviously the winner quickened up on the outside. He's probably best over a strongly run mile and a half. He could go to Japan, Hong Kong, America or Dubai. All those things are open to him. He's a ready-made four-year-old and we think the best is yet to come - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: You would say looking at him at York, he was nailed on for this race and he had form on soft ground. Continuous didn't have any problem with the trip. He's got a lot of class, you could see it in his work every day. We're over the moon. The lads will think about the Arc, I'd say, he handles soft ground and gets a mile and a half very well and has class. He has all the things that could work in an Arc. It's just whether the two-week turnback is too tight or not. He has a great constitution as well - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Great Voltigeur Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Continuous came here in the Dante and he needed the run badly and ran a massive race. I said to Ryan before the race would any of the other horses have run as well in Dante as he did and he said they wouldn't. A little bit of class usually outs, especially if the pace is even. We thought he handles an ease very well because he has a little bit of a round action but that was fast ground today and he didn't seem to have any problem with it. He bends his knee but obviously that's his best performance so you have to say he's very comfortable on it. I asked Ryan and he said he doesn't need a mile and six but you wouldn't rule him out - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV For Just 12 Euro A Month At racingtv.com Now Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Continuous is still a baby. He seems to stay well and he quickened up quite well. He's in the Beresford Stakes and that's a possibility for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won the St Leger in 2023 and we've stepped him up in trip this year. He ran in the Dubai Gold Cup on Saturday but couldn't get into it from off the pace. 07-04-25

runners.name: Giavellotto
runners.owner: Scuderia La Tesa Limited & Vaibhav Shah

prev_owners.owner: Scuderia La Tesa Limited & Vaibhav Shah

runners.comment: Finished behind Calandagan last time but isn't fully exposed over this trip
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly at 1m6f-2m; took his form to a new level in two attempts over 1m4f last year, winning Group 2 at Newmarket (good to soft) and Group 1 at Sha Tin (good); behind Calandagan in the Sheema Classic two months ago but isn't fully exposed at this trip.

quotes.race: Longines Dubai Sheema Classic (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I was too far back. Giavellotto was in great shape and he's run a very solid race, but it was hard to make ground on those leaders - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Vase (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was all very comfortable until I got to the turn and I had to wait. When I got some racing room Giavellotto was explosive. I was really able to enjoy the last furlong which is a really difficult thing to do in a top-level Group 1. Marco thought a mile and a half was fine and I think as he's getting older, he's getting a bit sharper and faster - Oisin Murphy, rider.

quotes.race: Princess Of Wales's Stakes (Sponsored By The Kingdom Of Bahrain) (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Giavellotto is in the form of his life and is a much stronger horse this year. We weren't too worried about dropping back to a mile and a half, especially on a stiff course. He travelled so well into the race and Oisin said it was only a matter of having to press the button and the horse picked up straight away and ran strongly to the line. We know he stays well and the ground has dried out enough to be on the easy side of good. I don't think he wants it too soft but is versatile at the same time - he has also won on really fast ground. He is a big horse and very strong so the weight was not an issue. I thought it was a good performance and he showed he is definitely at his best this year. The Irish St Leger has always been the plan and I think today was a stepping stone towards that as long as the ground doesn't go too soft - heavy ground would be a concern and it can happen in September at the Curragh. I'm looking forward to it - Marco Botti, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Yorkshire Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Giavellotto loves the track and has always shown his best form at York. He acts on fast ground and we've been lucky to avoid the rain. We've tried two miles several times and I'm not saying he doesn't stay as he ran well in Saudi, but it does stretch him a little bit and I think the Gold Cup trip [2m4f] is too far for him. I know the Irish St Leger is not until September and sometimes the ground gets softer, but it's a race we considered last year and didn't go and I would say that could be the target - Marco Botti, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Yorkshire Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Giavellotto came here in very good order and we thought he would run a big race. We've always thought he is a proper stayer. The Gold Cup wouldn't be the race for him as he needs a galloping track. He stays two miles without a doubt so we'll sit down with the owner and map out a plan. The Melbourne Cup might be on the agenda - Marco Botti, trainer.

quotes.race: Cazoo St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: We're very pleased with Giavelletto, he ran a big race. He stays well and I wish we had a clear run. There's a Listed race at Ascot but we'll probably keep him for next year - Marco Botti, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He made the headlines on his debut when winning at odds of 100-1 at Kempton the week before Christmas from a useful Godolphin horse. There were three fancied runners in the betting and ours was pushed out to those ridiculous odds and a I know a few of the lads who ride him had small each-way wagers on him. I even had Â£5 each-way myself as I thought the odds were so generous. Although we never expect him to win first time out, I was expecting a good run. He backed that up at Newcastle over 1m2f next time out and earned a mark of 88. Last month at Sandown on his turf debut I was disappointed that he finished fourth, and yet the second and third each won next time out so possibly it was a hot handicap. He was quite immature as he kept changing his legs and just did not know which leg to put in front. Don't lose faith in him as he is a nice type and a mark of 88 is not harsh. 25-05-22

runners.name: Jan Brueghel
runners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
runners.comment: Looked a difficult ride on reappearance; unbeaten previously; won the 2024 St Leger
runners.spotlight: Unbeaten in his first season last year, winning the St Leger on final outing; bubble was burst in Curragh Group 3 (over 1m2f) on reappearance, having got into a sweat and looked a difficult ride (carried head awkwardly); progress may be resumed, provided he's in the right frame of mind.

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: We knew the track would suit and the trip would suit. I think Jan Brueghel showed he's successful going that extra distance and I think he's a Gold Cup horse in the making. Don't be surprised if he steps up a bit next year, But he has a bit of class and he's done that really well - Sean Levey, rider.

quotes.race: John Pearce Racing Gordon Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Jan Brueghel was very green. I didn't really want to make the running because he was a bit raw. The horse in front stopped and I was kind of left there and he was waiting. It was a difficult track for him and he's carried a penalty too, so you'd have to be happy with what he's done. He'll get better still. There's definitely more class in there, you've just got to get it out of him - Ryan Moore, rider.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai International Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We were worried about the ground for Jan Brueghel. We knew he had improved a lot from the last day and that he'd stay further but we weren't sure about the ground. You could see him changing legs when he turned in. He will stay much further and will be very happy going a mile and a half. We were thinking of coming here and then on to Goodwood and then going to the Leger - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: McDonnells Bar Newbridge Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Jan Brueghel just wasn't straightforward to train, he took a bit of time, he's a big horse. He's probably a fair horse - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a very good three-year-old campaign, winning all of his four starts including the St Leger. He's very well and working very well but he's going to have to stand in line behind Kyprios this season I'd imagine. He could have a run before the Hardwicke at Royal Ascot because if Kyprios is there in the Gold Cup there's probably no point in any of ours running against him. He's definitely a mile-and-a-half-plus horse, even though he won a Group race over a mile and a quarter. 07-04-25

runners.name: You Got To Me
runners.comment: Irish Oaks winner; may have more to offer back at 1m4f; interesting on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Absent since compromising her chance by pulling hard over 14.5f in the St Leger; progressive otherwise and landed the Irish Oaks prior to running well in the Yorkshire version; may have more to offer back at 1m4f and looks interesting on reappearance.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Yorkshire Oaks (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I thought it was a terrific effort. I couldn't believe the winner has won being that keen, but we've been beaten fair and square. You Got To Me is getting better from every race and is an improving filly. The next obvious race is the fillies and mares one on British Champions Day. She's always had an improving profile, but she's now a thorough professional - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

quotes.race: Juddmonte Irish Oaks (Group 1) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: A tongue strap on today probably helped, it just gave You Got To Me something else to think about. Hector [Crouch] said he had to barge through everywhere to get a position and to keep his position. She's a very brave filly - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Oaks Trial Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: You Got To Me has a lot of talent. I was a passenger for the first six furlongs, she likes to get in a fight and you have to try and not argue back with her. Her class showed in the last furlong. She's overcome a lot there and she'll be more relaxed for getting a run under her belt. There's plenty of improvement to come from her - Hector Crouch, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I hope she'll be our flagbearer and, on pedigree, there's realistic hope she'll be better this year. She's training well and the plan is to go for the Coronation Cup. I wonder whether she bounced in last year's Oaks.
