She travelled and handled the track really well, but then didn't finish off and it looked like her exertions in winning the Lingfield Oaks Trial took their toll. She was great in the Irish Oaks and then ran well in the Yorkshire Oaks, which will be a good race for her again. There's also the Prix Vermeille, although those races are closer together this year, which makes it more difficult. We might look at the King George as well. 28-04-25

3:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places

runners.name: Botanical
runners.comment: Cheekpieces first time; big shout if returning to form he showed last season
runners.spotlight: Moved from Roger Varian (same owner) before last three starts, in which he's had a tongue-tie enlisted; below form in his two this season but three of his four runs last term, including his second in a top 1m2f handicap at York, give him a big shout and there won't be any problems if there's been lots of rain; wears cheekpieces first time.

quotes.race: Knights Solicitors Handicap
quotes.quote: Botanical was in super nick today. The worry was the drying ground as he was so dominant on quite soft ground at Hamilton, but he showed he copes with it. He was pretty dominant there and while he'll get a bit of a clobbering for that, he's a smart horse - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Hampton By Hilton Hamilton Park Handicap
quotes.quote: Botanical won it really well and he should be a nice horse next year. The handicapper will have his say and will know whether it's a strong race but hopefully he's not too hard on us. He seems like a Class 2 horse and we'll see if he can climb the ladder a bit next year. I think ground is quite important to him, he was beaten on a sounder surface at Ascot the time before. I'm not sure if we'd run again this season - Roger Varian, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He would have liked the ground much slower at Doncaster but I think he ran well back at a mile. We'll be careful where we go with him but he could be flying the flag in plenty of stakes races and we could get the passport out for some slower ground in France or further afield. He might run in the Earl of Sefton in a few weeks if the rain comes. 07-04-25

runners.name: Mutaawid
runners.comment: Made most to score by 6l in a six-runner race at Newmarket (1m2f, good to firm); up 10lb
runners.spotlight: Came up shy in his first three handicaps but, with blinkers reinstated, he made most to score by 6l in a six-runner race at Newmarket (1m2f, good to firm) on latest; more to prove on softer ground and given he's 10lb higher in a much stronger race.

quotes.race: Unibet Zero% Mission/British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mutaawid is beautifully bred but it's taken a while for the penny to drop, with the blinkers clearly having been a big help here. I like him, I think he's a smart horse and liked the surface -  Jim Crowley, winning jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Ecureuil Secret
runners.breeder: S E P Ecurie De L'Aure
runners.comment: Minor honours in two Group 3s and three Listed races since a winning debut; been gelded
runners.spotlight: Won Leopardstown maiden (1m, heavy) last April on debut for Edward O'Grady; minor honours in his two Group 3s and three Listed events, on last two occasions bang there on testing ground over about 1m4f in France (stable debut latest); starts new season gelded and needs a second look.

quotes.race: Flat Is Back At Leopardstown (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Joseph [O'Brien] very kindly let Ecureuil Secret work with his horses in Naas after their last meeting and he worked practically to the ounce with the same horse (Thequietman). I'd say they are two very nice horses - Edward O'Grady, trainer, taking to RTV.

runners.name: Defiance
runners.breeder: Seven Hills B'Sk &torres Strait B'Sk Ltd
runners.comment: Went the wrong way last term, absent since Royal Ascot Group 2; one to note though
runners.spotlight: Won debut as 2yo and his four races since were Group 2 or Listed; C&D second (good) was a good start to last season, followed however by seventh in Lingfield Derby trial and tailed off in 1m4f Group 2 at Royal Ascot; gelded not long afterwards and not seen since; needs overall improvement but catches the eye on handicap debut for trainer who won this in 2018, 2019 and 2022.

stable_tour.quote: His first run last season in the Blue Riband Trial at Epsom was very good but I think he got jarred up on his next start in the Lingfield Derby Trial. I thought I had him back in good form for Royal Ascot but it was quick ground again and he didn't let himself down. I never really got him back after that last season but I still believe he's a good horse. He's been gelded and had a three-month winter holiday, so he isn't going to be ready until May, but the way the weather is looking it's not as though we're missing an opportunity on juicy ground. I think he'll start in handicaps and I've every belief he'll bounce back. 11-04-25

runners.name: Flying Finn
runners.comment: Both 1m2f runs were heavy defeats, admittedly stiff tasks; easily best results in the mud
runners.spotlight: Had a mixed 2024 but it included three 1m handicap wins and she shaped better than the result suggests in hot race at the Curragh on return this March; probably stays 1m1f but her two runs over 1m2f (last June) were heavy defeats, admittedly facing stiff tasks; easily best results in the mud.

runners.name: Simply Sondheim
runners.comment: Big 2024 highlight was last-to-first win over C&D in September; best on softer than good
runners.spotlight: An underwhelming campaign for new yard was swept aside when he came from last to first in a nine-runner race over C&D (heavy; his only visit here) last September, scoring in tidy fashion with first-time cheekpieces and never better; pulled up lame off this 5lb higher mark in the November Handicap on sole run since; good soft-ground record before that and won sole run on good to soft; considered if he gets that ground.

quotes.race: Betfred Nifty 50 Handicap
quotes.quote: There has been a lot of trainer error with this horse. We took Simply Sondheim to Bahrain and he didn't bounce off that quick ground. It's been tough feeling our way through this year but I know he's a good horse. Today was pretty much a bit of an acid test as we've always thought soft ground is what he needed and cheekpieces were on to polarize the mind. Patsy [Cosgrave, jockey] said to go a bit further next time and he may be one for the November Handicap if we could sneak in off a nice, low weight - George Baker, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Britain's Biggest Independent Bookmaker Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Simply Sondheim won't run here tomorrow but we could look at something like the Old Rowley Cup for him next - George Boughey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Notched up a six-timer for owner Susan Roy over the past 12 months, successes which saw his mark rise from 56 to 87. He added a seventh win first time out this season at Kempton in April. He was slightly short of work at Newmarket last time when he finished well held. His best form has been on slower ground, so we're giving him a nice break now. He is by Pivotal and, as we all know, his progeny love to get their toe in. He will be back when the ground eases. 14-06-23

runners.name: Ashariba
runners.breeder: S C E A J L C , S C E A De L' Al
runners.comment: Won five of eight races; it's hard to rule out further improvement if she returns on song
runners.spotlight: All turf starts have been on ground softer than good; won five of her eight races, including 1m2f/1m3f handicaps on four of her last five; highly versatile regarding tactics (made all to score by a neck at Newmarket in October when last seen) and, although she's gone up another 6lb, it's hard to rule out further improvement if she returns on song.

stable_tour.quote: She was meant to go to Nottingham last week, but unfortunately that was cancelled, so we'll wait for Yarmouth this month, where she won last year. She gives us the feeling that she's on the right side of the handicapper at the moment and could be one to have some fun with. 11-04-24

runners.name: Have Secret

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mary, Lady Manton

runners.comment: Chester 2nds; won at Ripon (1m2f, good) in April; good placed efforts on both starts since
runners.spotlight: Threatened last season to break his losing run and it finally happened at Ripon (1m2f, good) this April; good placed efforts on both starts since and he's been runner-up in his two appearances at Chester, suggesting he may well adapt to this track; each-way chance again.

quotes.race: Coral Kincsem Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret has run a cracking race, which he has done all season. He's a horse who is getting better with racing, but he keeps just finding one or two. But we are delighted with him - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret tends to race behind the bridle but keeps finding. The step up in trip helped him and he handled the ground. Oisin Orr, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret deserved that after he ran well at Chester last week on a course that didn't suit him. He was going to go up the ratings so we thought we'd come here and he's going to go up even further now. He'll make a nice 3yo next year - Robin O'Ryan, assistant to trainer Richard Fahey.

runners.name: Akecheta
runners.comment: No win since debut but she's running well and this step back up in trip can suit her
runners.spotlight: Usually held up; debut win at Tipperary (7f, soft to heavy) last May; model of consistency in defeat in her eight starts since, over 1m on last three occasions but she figured at up to 1m4f last term and it's easy to think that this step back up in trip will suit her; interesting for Irish trainer who's had a second, third and fourth from his three runners at Epsom, the first two of those at this meeting.

runners.name: Westerton
runners.comment: 2024 was pretty disappointing but some late headway on both starts (1m2f; 25-1) this term
runners.spotlight: Sole win (19 races) remains a maiden on good to firm in 2023 and last year was pretty disappointing, on Flat and over hurdles; made some late headway on both starts (1m2f; 25-1) this term and he's edging back down the weights, so there could be cause for some renewed hope.

quotes.race: Darley British EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were looking at the 1m1f handicap on this card for Westerton but we thought we'd be brave and go for this race where the prize-money is excellent. I left it to Ryan Moore and it worked out great. That's my 2,000th winner and it's great to do it for wonderful owners who have flown down from Aberdeen this morning. They're a delight to train for - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I was initially disappointed by his hurdles debut at Stratford, but Tom Cannon said he blew up. He murders everything at home so we can't really stretch him and he'll come on plenty for that run. He loves jumping and I hope he'll progress well, probably kept to the sharper tracks for the time being. 25-10-24
I was very disappointed with his effort at Huntington when he didn't look keen under pressure. He may switch back to the Flat for the time being. 07-11-24

runners.name: Warda Jamila
runners.comment: C&D reappearance looked promising, followed by rather a shocker when favourite at Chester
runners.spotlight: Had 1m2f wins last May and September, latterly having to bide her time when she scored in last-gasp fashion at Haydock (good to soft; acts on good to firm) and she's 3lb higher today; C&D reappearance looked promising in April, followed by rather a shocker when favourite at Chester four weeks ago but it's too early to forget the previous encouragement.

quotes.race: British EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Warda Jamila has done nothing wrong there and was professional on her second start. She has a great mind and it will be interesting to see where she ends up distance-wise as she is related to Coltrane and by Calyx. She's a nice type - Jason Watson, jockey.

runners.name: Rathgar
runners.comment: Versatile with ground and trip; reliable sort including last two starts (C&D and Chester)
runners.spotlight: Versatile with ground and trip, a reliable sort who went close over C&D (Warda Jamila close up) on penultimate start and ran much better than her when they clashed again at Chester latest; probably not far away.

quotes.race: Weekly Rewards With tote Stayers Club Racing League Race 7 Handicap (Trainers Reg' To Racing League)
quotes.quote: It took us a while to really figure Rathgar out. I think his future lies over this kind of trip. He was relentless really, he jumped a lot better and he was able to keep the revs up from a long way out and responded well for pressure - David Probert, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Son Of Man
runners.comment: Knocking on the door on AW this spring but he may be vulnerable in this high a grade
runners.spotlight: 0-13 since his 2yo debut win but knocking on the door on AW this spring, beaten a nose at Lingfield (1m2f) last time, seven weeks ago; peak turf ratings were a little better but he may be vulnerable in this high a grade.

4:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places

runners.name: Flight Plan
runners.owner: Fine Clarets Racing, Tp Watson & C Wood

prev_owners.owner: Fine Claret Racing,Mrs Burke & C Wood

runners.comment: Made all in the Thirsk Hunt Cup last month and remains well treated on his old form
runners.spotlight: Underwhelming in the main over the last 12 months but back on song to make all in the Thirsk Hunt Cup last month (1m, good; his first handicap); off this 3lb higher mark he remains well treated on his old form (Group 2 winner in 2023); has run well on good to soft; can make another bold bid.

stable_tour.quote: His season fell apart last term but he's had an operation to remove one of his testicles and is moving much better as a result. He's definitely working like he's back to his best and I'm confident he can bounce back. If the ground is decent, he'll probably go to Thirsk on Saturday for a seven-furlong conditions race and then maybe something like the Royal Hunt Cup. 11-04-25

He's a lovely colt who won on the second of his two runs last year at Newcastle in November. He strengthened up nicely over the winter and I was happy enough with his run back, again at Gosforth Park when a neck second a Listed race over a mile. He goes to the 2,000 Guineas on Saturday where the bare form is not good enough. However, he will step forward hugely for having that run under his belt as he lost 15kg last time out which is a big amount for any race. He worked very well under Danny Tudhope last week and he will go well. 07-05-23

runners.name: Two Tempting
runners.comment: Capitalised on rail draw at Chester last time; won this 12 months ago and he's respected
runners.spotlight: Added to last year's five wins when scoring at Chester (7.5f, good) four weeks ago; he had the rail draw that day at a track where he is now 2-2, and he's up 5lb to a career-high mark today, but this progressive 6yo won this 12 months ago in a bigger field (good to soft) and warrants respect.

quotes.race: CAA Stellar Earl Grosvenor Handicap
quotes.quote: Two Tempting is very uncomplicated and really tries hard. He had a fantastic year last year when he kept on winning and is lovely for the owners. We felt like he was coming back to himself now. He's operating at a career-high at the moment and that isn't in handicaps. Jonny [Portman, trainer] found a nice opportunity today and let's hope he can build on it - Rob Hornby, jockey.

quotes.race: Listen To BetMGM On talkSPORT Handicap
quotes.quote: Two Tempting never ceases to amaze me, he's just a very tough horse. He goes on any ground but I didn't want too much rain. It was on the easy side at Epsom and definitely on the easy side here, and he's shown he goes on any ground - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't think we'd got it on the line but I'd have been happy with second. I thought Two Tempting ran a blinder. He ran well here last year but we didn't expect to win. The jockey had him in the right place at the right time. He's not in the Hunt Cup - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

runners.name: Ebts Guard
runners.comment: Won the Spring Cup in April and good third back at Newbury last time; could be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Often ran well last season (wins on good to firm and soft) and, having been gelded, he returned with a career best to win the Spring Cup at Newbury (1m, good) in April; bounced back from lesser run in the Victoria Cup with good third at Newbury (1m, good to firm) last time; could be thereabouts.

quotes.race: OLBG Spring Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: It's great to be back and it's our first runner on grass [this year]. I didn't know how fit they all were but Ebt's Guard has been working extremely well. - William Muir, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ebt's Guard has been slightly unlucky in his runs. First time out he got beat half a length and then last time we had to go the long way round - William Muir, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Julia Augusta
runners.breeder: Denniff Farms & Cheveley Park Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Tame end to last season but on a competitive mark on best Group-race form; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: 0-13 since winning her first two starts and below par in Listed races on final two outings last season; however, she's on a competitive mark judged on last summer's Group-race form (good to soft-good to firm), including a creditable fourth in the Princess Elizabeth over C&D; not ruled out.

runners.name: Bopedro
runners.comment: On a long losing sequence but frequently runs well and has an each-way shout
runners.spotlight: 9yo who has been beaten on his last 20 starts going back to August 2023 but he frequently runs well and has finished second at Newmarket the last twice (bumped into much improved winner when beaten 6l last time); didn't enjoy a clear run when fair seventh in this last year; has an each-way shout.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Handicap
quotes.quote: Ours were needing the run and the Lincoln run might have just put Bopedro right. Lee Bond (owner) told me to leave the visor off as it might just freshen him up so I have to give him the credit for it. He had good form for Jessie Harrington and there is a good programme for these milers - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: We had Bopedro at the end of last year and had a good run at Leopardstown. He won well for Mr Bolger here in the past so we were hoping the track would bring about some improvement in him. He's a bit of a boyo and is a good lead horse at home, he's been leading Lucky Vega for the last while - Shane Foley, rider

quotes.race: Barry's Tea Supporting Marymount Hospice Handicap
quotes.quote: Myself and Kevin were just saying beforehand that we couldn't believe the horse was 40-1. He has good form in France and was winning around Fontainebleau and running well at Vichy for his previous connections. They're no backwards tracks, just a drop down from Parisian courses. We haven't had the horse for long and took a chance with him. Kevin said he handled the track and ground well, I'd say slower ground would be no problem to him either. He's a lovely-looking horse who is great to deal with, uncomplicated, and it's nice to get our first winner for Mr Zhang and Yulong, having hit the crossbar with one or two before. We have about a half dozen for him - Ger Flynn, representative for Jim Bolger, trainer of Bopedro

stable_tour.quote: He could go for the mile handicap at Newmarket on Thursday as he likes the track there. He's done a good bit of work and has been in good form, so we're looking forward to starting him back. 14-04-25

runners.name: Mr Professor
runners.comment: Won the Lincoln last term but unable to threaten on his four starts since
runners.spotlight: Won the Lincoln Handicap (1m, soft) in March 2024 off 2lb lower; his claims would be boosted by lots of rain but he's been unable to threaten on his four starts since that prestigious win at Doncaster.

quotes.race: William Hill Lincoln (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: It was a great performance, Mr Professor travelled supremely well through the race and loved the ground. David was frightened about kicking too soon but when he asked him he quickened nicely and he kept going. If it's soft at Newbury, you'd have to have a look at the Spring Cup. But will it be as testing? Who knows - Dominic Ffrench Davis, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Silver Tankard Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Mr Professor has kept on improving this year. The straight track at Newmarket is where he's let us down but he just didn't settle there. He comes out of his races so well, we weigh ours every Monday and he'd put 8kg on since his last run. The ground was an unknown today but he battled to the line, though he wasn't doing an awful lot in front. He's in the sales next week and he is going to go, we'll see what money there is for him - Alice Haynes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running well. He probably prefers time between his races and we may have made the mistake of running him too quickly at Goodwood the other day. Owen Lewis gets on very well with him at home, felt the ground was a bit soft and he didn't really like it. We'll freshen him up and he'll be out again in about a fortnight. 21-09-23

runners.name: Alpha Crucis
runners.comment: Two wins on heavy last autumn; could be a contender if getting his preferred slow ground
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row on heavy ground at Goodwood (1m1f/1m) last autumn and reappeared with a respectable eighth in the Lincoln at Doncaster (1m, good to soft) in March; he may have improved for that outing and could be a contender if getting his preferred slow ground (the softer the better).

runners.name: Mr Baloo
runners.comment: Prolific on AW this year and good third when back on turf at Newmarket; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Four AW wins in February/March (7f-9.4f) and returned to turf with creditable third of 14 at Newmarket (1m, good) last month; also effective here and has shown promise on slow ground; latest form reads well; one to consider.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a revelation through the winter and I was really proud of the way he fought back when two horses went by him at Lingfield on Friday. He's won eight races now and he's not finished yet. 22-04-25

runners.name: Mirsky
runners.comment: Narrow win in lower grade at Thirsk three weeks ago; just 2lb higher here & not discounted
runners.spotlight: Won at Thirsk (1m, good to firm) three weeks ago; that was a first win in Britain at the 11th attempt and he had just a head to spare in a lower grade than today, but back up just 2lb he remains well treated on last season's best efforts; seems versatile ground-wise; not discounted.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Extra Places Handicap
quotes.quote: Mirsky was second in the Clipper Logistics at the Ebor meeting last year but that's his first win for us. It was a long enough last furlong, he's a strong traveller and seems best ridden prominently - David O'Meara, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran some good races last year without winning and will do all the same races again. On his work at home, he looks like he'll take a step forward. 14-04-25

runners.name: Obelix
runners.comment: A couple of fair runs at Thirsk this spring but needs something extra now back up in grade
runners.spotlight: Won off 2lb lower at Haydock (1m, good) last September; a couple of fair efforts at Thirsk this spring (fourth to Mirsky last time) but he's back up in grade today and needs something extra to return to winning ways.

runners.name: Tribal Rhythm
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who won over C&D on reappearance and could have more left in the tank
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who showed improved form to win by a length and a half over C&D (good) in April on his reappearance; from out of the handicap he's 7lb higher today but his pedigree provides optimism that he'll have more left in the tank, and he's in calculations.

5:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places

runners.name: Samuel Colt

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Group 3 runner-up for Aidan O'Brien but well beaten in Listed race on sole stable start
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 4yo who went close for Aidan O'Brien in a 7f Group 3 at Leopardstown in April 2024; however, after changing hands for 60,000gns he was well beaten on his stable debut in a Listed race at Kempton (1m, AW) in December, and has something to prove on this first outing since.

quotes.race: SP Or Better Guaranteed With Tote Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Samuel Colt is a lovely colt. He wasn't in love with the ground but his class got him through it. He could be an exciting colt for next year all being well - Chris Armstrong, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Golden Mind
runners.comment: Won off this mark at Kempton in February but mixed form across his three starts since
runners.spotlight: Won off this mark in a first-time tongue-tie (retained since) at Kempton (6f, AW) in February and he's also effective at 7f and on turf; however, his form has been mixed on his last three starts; has to raise his game.

quotes.race: Free Bet With Unibet's Betbuilder Rebound Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: There didn't seem to be much pace so when Golden Mind broke well I was able to get across and went fairly steady, getting the race my own way to be honest, and he's quickened up and done it well in the end. He gets 7f and I could see him going up in trip again - Oisin Orr, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Rhoscolyn

prev_owners.owner: Julie Martin & David R Martin & Partner

runners.comment: Won this last year and following same route as 12 months ago; has to be high on the list
runners.spotlight: Ran okay when sixth at Chester (7f, good) last Saturday and he filled the identical position in the same race last year before going on to win this (good to soft); also won this in 2021; has to be high on the list.

quotes.race: William Hill Handicap
quotes.quote: Rhoscolyn lost his mojo a bit, but he likes Goodwood and likes that ground - Dominic McFadden, part-owner.

quotes.race: World Pool Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought it went perfectly. We'd had a bit of a look at the race earlier and thought that you would want him a little bit handier round here normally, but there looked to be a good bit of pace on. I think it's really important that Rhoscolyn gets a well-run race and he got one today. David has always been adamant that you get him in a good rhythm and more often than not, that is sitting a little bit further back, because he is a bit too keen and strong in his races. But today, he has relaxed. He jumped better than he did at Beverley when the blindfold came off a bit late, but he's a lot better if the blindfold is off before the last horse goes in. And that was my fault for not reminding the jockey last time out, to be honest. It went to plan today and I couldn't be happier - Chris Dixon, of The Horse Watchers.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com EBF Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Rhoscolyn is very smart to do that from stall ten. He's got a good temperament, he's laid back and you would imagine there would be more to come from him next year - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He bounced back last year, having paid the price for a good first year with us. Soft ground and seven furlongs brings out the best in him, particularly at Goodwood. He won three races from August onwards, so again he'll be starting this year with his mark right up there. He'll start back in a conditions race at Thirsk on Saturday. 19-04-24

He's been a flagbearer for us over the last three years. We bought him for a cutdown 23,000gns during Covid and he's been a revelation. He's won big races at Epsom twice, has a great record at Goodwood and has been placed at Royal Ascot. He's a top-end handicapper. Nowadays, soft ground is imperative to him having a good chance. He hasn't been running so well on ground that's been too quick for him, but he's shown time and again he can come back and win another race. He goes to Goodwood on Wednesday, provided the ground is on the soft side. He won the race last year and he's still got all his ability. 26-09-24

runners.name: Miss Information
runners.comment: C&D winner who was back on the scoresheet last time; in good hands to continue to progress
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row last July (7f, good/good to soft; including C&D) and returned to winning ways at Newmarket (7f, good) last month; had just five rivals to beat last time and she's 4lb higher in a tougher race today, but she's in good hands to continue to progress and warrants respect.

quotes.race: Betfred "Nifty 50" Handicap
quotes.quote: Miss Information had come forward from her reappearance and toughed it out well. She could be a Victoria Cup type - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: Events At Ascot Christmas Parties British EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands A/B/C/D) (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Miss Information ran good races on her last two starts and we thought this stiffer track might suit her. She's done that really nicely and she's got a smashing temperament. She's not the biggest, but has a big heart and a really good way of galloping. I'll speak to owners about plans, but she could run again this season - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.name: Alzahir
runners.owner: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd

prev_owners.owner: Al Wasmiyah Stud, G Bailey, N Wrigley

runners.comment: Two wins in first half of spring; unplaced three times since but not discounted back at 7f
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row in the first half of spring (7f, good) and he seems versatile ground-wise; unplaced on his last three starts but shaped at York (1m, good to firm) last time, when a 4l seventh of 14, as though he would benefit from this drop back in distance; not discounted.

stable_tour.quote: A half-brother to Suedois who had a couple of runs for us last year and I think he could do well. He wants fast ground over seven furlongs or an easy mile. He's had a nice break and has come back working well. 19-04-24

He was purchased at the horses in training sale for 20,000gns. He runs on December 7 at Wolverhampton in a 0-85 and with luck in running he should go close. He was unlucky last time and probably would have been a lot closer had he got out, but he's dropping in grade at Wolverhampton and I think he should win. 05-12-24

runners.name: Darkness
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Et Al
runners.comment: Second in this race in 2023 and back to form to win at Thirsk last time; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Having dropped below his last winning mark he returned to form to win readily at Thirsk (7f, good to firm) three weeks ago; won on soft last year; could take a 4lb rise in his stride now he's back on song, and he finished second in this race in 2023; one to consider.

quotes.race: Winners Wear Cavani Handicap
quotes.quote: Darkness enjoyed the change of tactics and he's got plenty of ability, it's just getting it out of him. It was a decent enough run today, he just got tired close home - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a law unto himself. Last year he won at Newmarket and then ran well in the Golden Mile at Goodwood, but he can throw a bad run and doesn't win as often as he should. He likes to be ridden forward, but when he gets behind he has his own ideas. 19-04-24

runners.name: Persuasion
runners.comment: Won at Musselburgh in April but hasn't performed to the same level on his two runs since
runners.spotlight: 8yo who won at Musselburgh (7f, good to soft) in April but hasn't performed to the same level on his two runs since; needs a bigger effort here.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Silver Arrow Handicap
quotes.quote: We had the perfect trip, a good draw and a nice position. Persuasion went well throughout the race and toughed it out all the way to the line. He's been a consistent horse in defeat and he'd won off this mark at Haydock last year and we were fairly hopeful -  Callum Rodriguez, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He really pleased me on his only start this season when beating stablemate Dulas at Haydock over seven furlongs. The form of that race is working out well and on a new mark of 96 he should have a nice weight in the Buckingham Palace. I'd like to think he has a very good chance. - 10-06-21

runners.name: Local Hero
runners.comment: Went close at Kempton in March; a couple of fair efforts on turf since but needs extra
runners.spotlight: Went close at Kempton (7f, AW) in March and now 2lb lower; lightly raced on turf and he produced a couple of fair efforts on grass last month, but he needs something extra today to post a first win on this surface.

stable_tour.quote: He was right back to his best at Kempton last time, and although I'm sure we'll try him on the turf again at some stage, we'll find some proper opportunities for him on the sand in the meantime. 22-04-25

runners.name: Legal Reform
runners.comment: Has improved on AW this year; C&D second on heavy last September; lots of rain would help
runners.spotlight: 7-21 on AW as opposed to 2-21 on turf; he needs to transfer this year's AW improvement back to grass but he has some good turf form and was runner-up over C&D on heavy ground last September; lots of rain would be a plus.

stable_tour.quote: He is a nice horse who has not done a great deal wrong. He won at Southwell in the spring and was a little unfortunate not to win at Chester in the summer when a head second to Praxeology. He is a genuine horse who likes the all-weather surfaces and appreciates cut underfoot. There are several races coming up in the next few weeks but I am waiting for the softer ground. The only all-weather track I will try and avoid with him is Kempton as he did not appear to enjoy his run around there last month. I am sure he will pick up a race or two this winter 23-09-21

runners.name: Stanage
runners.comment: Won at Doncaster in March and ran pretty well at York last time; could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Won on reappearance at Doncaster (7f, good) in March and unlucky third at Newmarket (7f, good) next time; bounced back from below-par run with close sixth of 14 at York (1m, good to firm) three weeks ago; could be in the mix.

runners.name: Partisan Hero
runners.comment: Runner-up at Chester latest; continues to climb weights but he's progressive and respected
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won at Kempton (1m, AW) in February and followed up at Pontefract (1m, good); his good form has continued, finishing second at Chester (7.5f, good) most recently; ran well on yielding ground in Ireland; continues to climb the weights but this progressive 5yo is respected.

quotes.race: Societies Welcome At Gowran Park Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't use my whip much as I was fairly confident Partisan Hero was doing enough the whole way up the straight. His last furlong was probably his best so he will be able to go up in trip. There should be improvement in him - Jake Coen, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: A horse I bought out of Dermot Weld's, he had his first start for us at Windsor this month and just got done in second when he was probably unlucky. He was an expensive horse [72,000gns] for what he's rated [68], but I like him a lot and think he'll be a lovely horse. We got him in October and he's taken time to get right. It was quick enough at Windsor and he probably wants a bit of cut in the ground. I hope he could end up being a Saturday horse. 30-05-24

runners.name: Majestic Wave
runners.comment: Encouraging fourth on stable debut in February but two lesser runs have followed
runners.spotlight: Won Navan maiden (6f, good to yielding) last October on final 2yo start and kept on for encouraging fourth on stable debut at Lingfield (6f, AW) in February; however, two lesser runs have followed; improvement needed.

quotes.race: Arkle Bar Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: I thought Majestic Wave ran lovely at Naas. I didn't know if he was a 6f or 7f horse, he's probably somewhere in the middle. I think the stiff just shy of six suited him today and a little bit of ease in the ground - John O'Donoghue, trainer.

runners.name: Marlay Park
runners.comment: Without a win since September 2023 but likes it here and he went close on his reappearance
runners.spotlight: Beaten on his last 13 starts going back to September 2023 and he's 2lb out of the handicap today; however, he was higher in the weights when making the frame in this in each of the last two seasons, and he went close at Leicester on his reappearance; this four-time course winner could be a player.

1:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places

runners.name: The Waco Kid
runners.comment: Useful as a 2yo but has a question mark over current form; cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Capable of useful form as a 2yo, notably soft-ground Group 3 win; has failed to reproduce it this season, folding tamely (lost his action, eased) last time; chance partly depends on how well he responds to first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Stakes (Registered As The Somerville Tattersall Stakes) (Group 3) (Colts And Geldings)
quotes.quote: Oisin Murphy just got off and said, 'Is he in the Dewhurst?'. But I expect I've made the most terrible balls [up] of it. The Waco Kid did have an entry but I think after he was only third at Listed level I took him out of the Dewhurst and the Lagardere. There's the Criterium International, so we might go there as he handles soft ground but we'll see. The Breeders' Cup is also an option as well. What's so lovely about this horse is that with every run he's got better - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't changed a vast amount physically from two to three but his work has been pleasing and he'll be ready early. I'd imagine he'll start in the Craven, because he's shown a liking for Newmarket. He's in the 2,000 Guineas, as well as the French and German Guineas. He strikes me as more of a solid Group 3 horse than a potential Group 1 horse at this stage. 09-04-25

runners.name: Diego Ventura
runners.comment: Took well to first-time cheekpieces in similar event at Longchamp three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Took well to first-time cheekpieces in similar event at Longchamp (7f, good to soft) three weeks ago, building on his reappearance effort and taking form figures to 112231; acts on soft; solid operator who commands respect in the retained headgear.

quotes.race: Juddmonte British EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands A, B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Diego Ventura shouldn't really have won given the way things unfolded. He had to make up a lot of ground and I had to switch him out to the middle of the track to get a clear run. We then got a bit of a bump from the second, but the fact he has won giving weight away has to be positive - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Diego Ventura is one we liked. He goes very well at home and he was still a bit green here. We'll take him home and make a plan - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

runners.name: Rebels Gamble
runners.comment: Very progressive on AW; disappointing on turf last time but can't be written off
runners.spotlight: Unraced at two; very progressive on AW this year, winning Listed event at Lingfield (sole 7f attempt) the final time; disappointing favourite at Ascot (6f Group 3) on the switch to turf but can't be written off; may still have more to offer.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Gamble was really more professional today. The first day at Southwell he was very green and babyish, and today he's sharpened up a lot from that first run. He picked up and put the race to bed pretty quick - Clifford Lee, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a little break since winning the Listed Spring Cup at Lingfield and we're preparing him for the Pavilion Stakes at Ascot at the end of the month. That will tell us if he wants six or seven furlongs on turf but I think he's plenty quick enough for a stiff six like Ascot. He's going to be an exciting horse for later in the season. 11-04-25

runners.name: Franciscos Piece
runners.owner: Keatley Racing Owners Group & D Moore
runners.comment: Useful sprinter last term; goes into unknown territory over 7f on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Suited by soft/heavy; useful sprinter during a 2yo campaign that went from May to October; however, goes into unknown territory over 7f on reappearance and takes on mostly race-fit rivals who are already proven at this distance.

quotes.race: Prix la Fleche (Listed Race) (2yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Francisco's Piece is a good horse and this is a massive step forward. We're delighted to get that win under his belt. He's going to improve loads as he's still a little bit behind in his coat and is still a little bit underdeveloped. He could come back for the Prix Robert Papin. Everybody want's to go to Royal Ascot, but I don't mind if this fella stays at home in his box. Everything is still on the table, and we'll see how he is come Tuesday or Wednesday - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

quotes.race: Northern Commercials New Buy From Stock EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Qual) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: We've liked Francisco's Piece for a long time and he's still very backward, in his coat and a little bit physically. When this fellow comes to himself and puts on a little bit more weight and really matured he's going to turn into a fine horse. I couldn't get my head away from him when I saw him at the sales. I hope he'll turn into a really good horse. I'm not in a mad hurry, the more time he gets he'll mature and get stronger - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

runners.name: Hallasan
runners.comment: Likely player on peak form, namely wins at Doncaster (sales race) and Meydan
runners.spotlight: Peak RPRs when winning a sales race at Doncaster (6.5f, good; narrowly beat the subsequent French Derby winner) last September and conditions event at Meydan (1m, good to firm) in January; player provided he returns to that form.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Scientific Â£300,000 2-Y-O Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Will (Buick, jockey) was very pleased with Hallasan and he's toughed it out well. He's a small horse, and we thought he was going to be an early one, but actually he's taken a little while to come to himself. I spoke to the trainer (Charlie Appleby) just now and he thought he might be one to take over to Dubai and see how he goes over there - Alex Merriam, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Charge Up Your Summer With Rhino.Bet EBF Maiden Stakes (Gbb Race)
quotes.quote: Hallasan is still a little bit gassy and I think there'll be a bit more improvement to come when he steps into handicap company. He tries hard, so he probably over-tried for the first furlong. Once he relaxed after half a furlong, he found his breathing and rhythm and away he went. I probably could have won hands and heels. He's still learning and this was his second run after becoming a gelding. If there is improvement, I think you'll see it from here on in - Dougie Costello, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Glamis Road
runners.comment: It remains to be seen whether she can transfer her French form back to home soil
runners.spotlight: Campaigned in France since October, non-stayer over 10.5f most recently; bagged Listed honours at Saint-Cloud (7f, heavy) three starts ago but it remains to be seen whether she can transfer the form back to home soil.

quotes.race: Prix Herod (Listed Race) (2yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: They didn't go fast enough for her the last day in my opinion, so I was eager to take the bull by the horns and make it a test of stamina, as was the owner and the trainer. Glamis Road was a little bit unlucky not to be third that day and this was a good performance, she likes that ground - Sam James, jockey.

runners.name: Formal
runners.comment: Well bred and may still do better; switches to Listed grade after two Group runs
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-3 last year for Sir Michael Stoute; only midfield in the Fred Darling (wore hood) on reappearance but nicely bred and may still do better; switches to Listed grade after two Group attempts and can't be ruled out.

quotes.race: British EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: \BFormal\P was impressive and Ryan was very taken with her. Her class was certainly in evidence and there's much to look forward to - Chris Richardson, Cheveley Park managing director, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Saqqara Sands
runners.comment: Ran well in Listed grade when last seen and looks open to further improvement
runners.spotlight: Solid record (over 7f) last term comprised a success at Newmarket (soft) flanked by two second-place finishes, latest in Listed grade at Newbury (heavy); looks interesting on seasonal debut, with further improvement plausible.

2:05.race_name: Betfred British EBF Woodcote Stakes (Conditions Race) (GBB Race)
2:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places

runners.name: Havana Hurricane
runners.comment: Won going away at Goodwood and the form has substance; yard landed this prize in 2023
runners.spotlight: Justified market support with a solid win at Goodwood (5f, good) where he beat Logi Bear by 2l going away, with another subsequent scorer back in third; yard landed this prize in 2023; strong credentials.

runners.name: Logi Bear
runners.owner: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr
runners.comment: Second to Havana Hurricane at Goodwood; clearcut win at Newmarket since
runners.spotlight: Second to Havana Hurricane at Goodwood; registered a clearcut success under Jamie Spencer at Newmarket (6f, good) since, taking form figures to 321; improving colt who is shortlist material.

runners.name: Maximized
runners.comment: Â£720,000 breeze-up purchase; won with something to spare at Haydock; useful prospect
runners.spotlight: Mehmas colt who is a Â£720,000 breeze-up purchase; turned over a shorter-priced stablemate (pair clear) with something to spare in Haydock contest (6f, good to firm) and looks a useful prospect; respected.

quotes.race: Betfred "Follow Us On X" EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Maximized was the first one in the gates and it was just a case of getting some experience into him but he jumped sharply. He was impressive over the last two furlongs, he quickened up really well and he's got plenty of speed. I'm sure Charlie [Appleby, trainer] will have a lot of fun with him - David Probert, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Normans Cay
runners.comment: Absent since narrowly justifying favouritism in the Brocklesby; open to progress
runners.spotlight: Absent since narrowly justifying favouritism in the Brocklesby at Doncaster (5f, good to soft) ten weeks ago; not many winners have come out of that race since but he's open to progress all the same.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee EBF Brocklesby Stakes (A Novice Stakes) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Norman's Cay is a nice colt, he's always found things quite easy and he's there in his coat, which a lot of mine aren't. I like the way he ran on - some horses you bring that you think are Brocklesby horses go flat out and fall in a heap. He'll get better and it looks like he wants six furlongs, I thought he was beat there. I don't know where he'll end up, it's a Class 2 which is not ideal because you have go somewhere quite loud next time or carry a big penalty. It's a nice inconvenience to have, you've been well paid for it. At least it's good prize-money, quite often to win this sort of prize-money you have to win four two-year-old races - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Won the Brocklesby, having not done a load of work, and could end up being better than just an early two-year-old. He was whinnying in the first furlong and again afterwards, suggesting the race didn't take a lot out of him. 22-04-25

runners.name: Raakeb
runners.comment: Won at Ripon then ran well at Beverley; hard to dismiss on bare figures
runners.spotlight: One of three runners for Richard Hannon; sent north for his two starts, both over 5f on good ground, winning at Ripon then running well in Beverley conditions race; hard to dismiss on bare figures.

runners.name: Rising Empire
runners.comment: Sire was a smart performer for this yard; won last time and may improve further
runners.spotlight: From the first crop of a sire who was a smart performer for this yard; didn't have much to spare at Windsor (6f, good to firm) last time but may build on that success and show further improvement.

runners.name: Anaisa
runners.comment: Has shown progressive form in the north; faces a tougher task in this field
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced filly who has shown progressive form (on good ground) in the north, running well under a penalty at Ripon (6f) most recently; faces a tougher assignment in this field.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes 'Gaffer Of All Accas' Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C & D) (GBB/IRE Incentive) (Div I)
quotes.quote: ANAISA\P ran okay first time, she ran very green here and she'll improve a fair bit - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Too Darn Good
runners.owner: K Hunter, D Leon And Hunscote Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Showed ability at Bath but this seems a difficult assignment in second run
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability with his fourth-place finish in small field at Bath (5f, firm) and may win races at the right level; however, this seems a difficult task in his second outing.

runners.name: Trinculo
runners.comment: Caravaggio colt; represents an Epsom stable and looks an intriguing newcomer
runners.spotlight: Caravaggio colt; dam 8.6f AW winner (RPR 85), half-sister to two Group 3 scorers; the only runner who lacks experience but represents an Epsom stable and looks an intriguing debutant.

runners.name: Alfa Duplicate
runners.comment: Not helped by a slipped saddle at Haydock but likely lacks enough potential
runners.spotlight: Brings easily the worst bare form, having been soundly beaten at Haydock (6f); not helped by a slipped saddle that day but she was the rank outsider and likely lacks enough potential.

5:59.race_name: BetGoodwin Top UK Online Bookie Apprentice Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B/C/D) (GBB)

runners.name: Alerta Maxima
runners.comment: 6f course winner who should stay this far; market confidence welcomed after a year out
runners.spotlight: Last year's two runs were here and she fulfilled the promise of her debut effort when beating 12 rivals over 6f in June (good to soft); runner-up is now rated 80; should stay this far; market confidence would be welcomed after a year out.

runners.name: Callisto Dream
runners.comment: 6f debut winner who possibly needed the race on the AW last month
runners.spotlight: Made a winning start on soft ground at Carlisle (6f) in September and possibly needed the run when a weakener at Wolverhampton last month (8.6f); trainer doesn't have many runners here.

quotes.race: Hoover Supporting Andersons Autumn Sale EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: We haven't done a whole lot at home with Callisto Dream. We knew she was okay, but we haven't pressed a lot of buttons, so for her to come and do that first time out, there's plenty of improvement left - P J McDonald, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Emily Court
runners.comment: Eighth foal; half-sister to Uncle Dick who runs in the opener; dam 1m2f winner (78)
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; half-sister to Uncle Dick who runs in the opener; dam 1m2f winner (78), half-sister to 1m2f Listed winner/Oaks second Something Exciting; probably best watched on this belated debut.

runners.name: Bella Bianca
runners.comment: 200-1 when never remotely dangerous at Kempton in December (7f); hard to warm to
runners.spotlight: 200-1 when never remotely dangerous at Kempton in December (7f); hard to warm to after that.

runners.name: Lilac Wine
runners.comment: Beaten 10l and 16l on two visits to Kempton (7f) and likely to find her level in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Beaten 10l and 16l on two visits to Kempton (7f) and likely to find her level in handicaps.

runners.name: Read All About It
runners.comment: Late headway into fourth in a 7f maiden at Kempton and should improve on that
runners.spotlight: Late headway into fourth in a 7f maiden at Kempton and should improve on that.

runners.name: Silent City
runners.comment: Cityscape filly and the dam is from the family of top-class miler Soviet Song
runners.spotlight: Cityscape filly and the dam is from the family of top-class miler Soviet Song; in a top yard so the market can guide.

runners.name: Aphrodite Spirit
runners.comment: Ulysses filly; third foal; half-sister to Qatari 5.5f 2yo winner Zoltan Star
runners.spotlight: Ulysses filly; third foal; half-sister to Qatari 5.5f 2yo winner Zoltan Star; dam US 8.5f dirt 2yo winner, half-sister to useful Japanese 6f-1m winner Fusaichi Hokutosei; would need to see some confidence behind her.

runners.name: Blazing Bobcat
runners.comment: Also had tongue tied at Chepstow where she was outpaced and finished tailed off (7f; 66-1)
runners.spotlight: Also had tongue tied at Chepstow where she was outpaced and finished tailed off (7f; 66-1).

runners.name: Mystical Mabel
runners.comment: Half-sister to four winners including Secret Sea (12.5f/1m5f Flat, RPR 75; 2m hurdle)
runners.spotlight: 14,000euros yearling; tenth foal; half-sister to four winners including Secret Sea (12.5f/1m5f Flat, RPR 75; 2m hurdle), Ruby Shoes (7.5f; 72) and Secret Rock (1m4f; 2m hurdle); dam placed 7f (56); hooded for this belated debut; best watched.

8:19.race_name: Three Friday Nights With Hot Chip Apprentice Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Zayina
runners.comment: In the handicapper's grip but cheekpieces go on and this is winnable; contender
runners.spotlight: Competitive off this sort of mark during a limited campaign last year without looking to have anything in hand; similar story over this trip on her comeback in early April and she took a step backwards at Brighton (1m2f, also good to firm) 25 days later; handicapper's not really budging but cheekpieces are enlisted and this is winnable.

runners.name: Rockit Tommy
runners.owner: Peregrine Racing & Sir Mark & Lady Todd
runners.comment: Beaten a combined 80l in two starts for this yard; impossible to recommend
runners.spotlight: Four-time AW winner for Sir Mark Todd (1m2f-1m4f) but he's been beaten a combined 80l in two starts for this yard and is impossible to recommend without market support.

runners.name: Big Bear Hug
runners.comment: Versatile ground-wise; goes well fresh and trip fine; big player on her stable debut
runners.spotlight: Three-time 1m/1m2f winner (on good-heavy) for Adam West but stays this trip too; progressive last year and signed off for that yard with a solid third at Nottingham (1m2f, soft) in November; can go well fresh and won't mind what the weather does so looks interesting on this stable debut.

runners.name: Kings Reign
runners.comment: 1m4f winner; still early days for a yard that's won this race for last two years
runners.spotlight: Cost 1,500,000gns as a yearling but scored only once (over this trip) in five attempts for Charlie Appleby and was sold for 30,000gns in January; no immediate encouragement on his stable debut but that came in a competitive race here (2m, good) a fortnight go; drops back down in distance and might do better for a yard that's won this race for the last two years.

runners.name: Isle Of Sark
runners.breeder: Kenneth L Ramsey & Sarah K Ramsey
runners.comment: Second nine times since winning on his debut; cheekpieces given a go; needs more
runners.spotlight: Won on his debut at Dundalk (7f, AW) in 2020 but he's 0-36 since, finishing second nine times; runner-up again at Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW; second start for this yard) last time and cheekpieces are now given a go (has tried a hood and blinkers unsuccessfully).

stable_tour.quote: We were pleased with his run in the Ballysax, which was his first run on turf, and he will have learned a lot from that. He seems to have come out of that race well and he'll probably go for another Derby trial. 19-04-21

runners.name: Marhaba Million
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in two handicaps and can only be of interest with market support
runners.spotlight: Two of his efforts in maidens last year read well but beaten a combined 104l in two subsequent handicaps, latterly on his stable debut at Chester (1m4f, good) in May having been gelded; difficult to fancy unless the market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Destinado

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: Respectable fifth at Hamilton last time and he's in fair form, which counts for a lot here
runners.spotlight: Returned to form to win under Mason Paetel at Doncaster (1m2f, good to soft) in March and went close at Lingfield (AW) the following month; flopped on his next start but took a step in the right direction when fifth of 13 at Hamilton (1m5f, good) last week; plausible contenders are thin on the ground and he's a player.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Destinado is a very tough horse who's been very consistent since he joined James. This is his trip, he broke well and travelled nicely throughout the race - Aidan Keeley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely little horse who helped to put us on the map. He went off the boil a bit but ran really well again when he was third at Southwell just before Christmas. Unfortunately, when he won at Lingfield a few starts back, he won by too far, so he shot up in the handicap and we're just having to fight that a little bit at the moment. 01-01-25

7:44.race_name: Goodwood Racehorse Owners' Group Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Arkhalia Flynn
runners.comment: Failed to settle on Sandown return and ran okay in the circumstances
runners.spotlight: Competitive last year in 7f/1m handicaps on ground ranging from heavy to good; failed to settle on Sandown return and ran okay in the circumstances; usually held up (can be slowly away) so always reliant upon having a good pace to chase.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a really good season, winning three times and being placed on four more occasions. He's had a progressive profile all year. He was unlucky at Epsom last time when he was slowly away but stayed on well to be second behind Marcella. He was probably the best horse in the race. We'll probably look for one more race for him as he loves soft ground. He'll be one who hopefully steps up into the Johan/Metal Merchant shoes next year and we can aim for races like the Lincoln, Spring Cup and Royal Hunt Cup. 10-10-24

runners.name: On The River
runners.comment: He's likely to be back on easier ground here and that's a big positive
runners.spotlight: Four wins on good to soft or slower last year; hasn't built on a likeable reappearance but he's likely to be back on easier ground here and that's a big positive.

quotes.race: Yorkshire Wonder Horse Race Is On Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: On The River won on this day last year. He's consistent. I was a bit worried about the ground over this trip but he toughed it out. He's got a good attitude - Ben Haslam, trainer.

runners.name: Pitney
runners.comment: Hasn't featured in either run for this yard and a tongue-tie now joins the visor
runners.spotlight: Won over a bit shorter at Chester for Hugo Palmer in September and then sold on for 8,000gns; hasn't featured in either run for this yard and a tongue-tie now joins the visor he's been wearing of late.

runners.name: Dutch Decoy
runners.comment: Below par so far this season but he's been twice placed in the Golden Mile over C&D
runners.spotlight: 10lb lower than when runner-up in the Golden Mile over C&D at last year's Glorious fixture (good to firm) and was placed in that same race the season before (on soft); a little below par so far this campaign but back here he commands plenty of attention.

quotes.race: Coral Golden Mile (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I'm a bit frustrated. I thought Dutch Decoy was the best chance we had in the race. Obviously the winner has come from stall 21, but you need the rub of the green from there and from two and a half to the furlong marker we were all dressed up with nowhere to go. I actually thought my two in front were setting it up perfectly for him because they went a strong gallop. We'll just have to make sure we're back here next year - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

quotes.race: Lettergold Handicap
quotes.quote: Dutch Decoy does prefer quicker ground and I thought when this rain came it might be too much for him, but we have probably got away with it. He ran at Goodwood last year [Golden Mile] and I think he will probably go back there - Jock Bennett, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Racehorse Lotto Handicap
quotes.quote: I feel a bit sorry for Dutch Decoy because he's been banging his head against a brick wall all spring. His time is coming - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Handicap
quotes.quote: Joe Fanning rides Dutch Decoy normally and he just told me to let the old boy do his thing and it paid off - Ben Curtis, jockey.

runners.name: Kitaro Kich
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.owner: J Machale, S Tucker & S Jewell
runners.comment: Has been having a ball on the AW this year but turf form is nothing like so convincing
runners.spotlight: Has been having a ball on the AW this year but turf form is nothing like so convincing and he was always out the back at Newbury three weeks ago.

runners.name: Mostawaa
runners.comment: Fair return in April and 1m2f too far last time; can go well, as all ground comes alike
runners.spotlight: 1m2f looks too far which would excuse his latest run, and his effort at Epsom the time before was passable; this mark looks a fair reflection of where he is right now but can see him going well, as all ground comes alike.

quotes.race: Stablemate By Agma Carlisle Bell Handicap
quotes.quote: Mostawaa has turned a corner in his old age. He won at Brighton two starts ago and then he went to York and toughed it out. I got a very easy lead that day and things fell right whereas today there was plenty of pace on paper, so you just never know. He stuck to it well on soft ground and I think we can investigate going up to ten furlongs now. Between the three and the two I didn't get much of a breather into him and we were going a good gallop. Myself and Pierre were kind of taking each other on but to be fair they both fought on well - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Ice Co Supporting Macmillan Handicap
quotes.quote: I was a bit worried because Mostawaa didn't have his headgear on today but he jumped well, settled, and got into a nice rhythm. The further he went the better, and he loved the ground - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Lunario
runners.owner: Michael Watt, Roy David, Christmas Party

prev_owners.owner: Christmas Party, M Watt & R David

runners.comment: Second at Newmarket on the drop back to 7f and this should be more his trip
runners.spotlight: Second at Newmarket on the drop back to 7f and that was his best run yet for current yard and in this headgear combination; this should be more his trip and he's on a workable mark.

runners.name: Billy Mill
runners.comment: Beat Serenity Dream at Kempton last month but he's a better horse on the AW
runners.spotlight: A better horse on the AW and he narrowly fended off Serenity Dream over Kempton's 7f on penultimate start; only fourth at Salisbury, though, and others appeal more.

stable_tour.quote: He's a horse we bought from Richard Hannon. He runs mostly on the all-weather because he wouldn't handle firm ground and he wouldn't go on heavy and we've been pretty successful with him. He loves Newcastle, it's just a shame that my yard is so far away from Newcastle! We've won three races with him up there. He's just a good old horse and very genuine. 11-07-24

runners.name: Robbo
runners.comment: Has only won the once but mark continues to fall and he'll pop up some day
runners.spotlight: No better than fifth in five runs for this yard but has run well enough to believe he retains some of his old ability; mark continues to fall and he'll pop up some day.

stable_tour.quote: He's been training nicely. He was placed over six furlongs last season but we'll look to run him over seven soon. He's definitely shown enough to think he can win races. 17-04-24

runners.name: Dramatic Effect
runners.comment: C&D winner and her AW reappearance was encouraging given she was slowly
runners.spotlight: Won her novice here over C&D last summer on good ground; 0-11 otherwise but lurks on a tempting mark and her AW reappearance was encouraging given she was slowly away which is unlike her; has no ground preferences.

runners.name: Serenity Dream
runners.comment: Bang there in both his runs for Tony Carroll, latterly over 1m at Windsor
runners.spotlight: AW novice winner who has had plenty of chances in handicaps but he's been bang there in both his runs for Tony Carroll, latterly over 1m at Windsor; seems fine on all ground.

runners.name: Saturnalia
runners.owner: Ms H N Pinniger And Partner
runners.comment: If he's going to snap his losing sequence it will probably be on the AW
runners.spotlight: Has only won twice and stuck on a losing run; if he's going to snap that sequence it will probably be on the AW.

stable_tour.quote: Having gelded him last summer he never made his racecourse debut until Lingfield in January when second over a mile. The drop back to 7f did the trick as next time out he won at Wolverhampton. He has run well in defeat since, notably when a neck second at Kempton. His last three runs, all on turf, have not been great but he is a solid horse and I am hoping that he can put those efforts behind him back at Newbury on Tuesday. I am looking for a nice run from him this week, but it could be that we have him wrong and he is a sprinter. 29-06-23

runners.name: Uncle Dick
runners.comment: Best at Brighton where he ran quite well last time; has respectable form here
runners.spotlight: Has never won away from Brighton on turf (seven wins there) but signs of rediscovering some form back there ten days ago; only beaten about 2l in two of his three runs here; goes on all ground.

quotes.race: Carlsberg Danish Pilsner Brighton Mile Challenge Handicap (For the Brighton Mile Challenge Trophy)
quotes.quote: Uncle Dick is an absolute legend. He's won for all my apprentices either this year or last and just loves it at Brighton, he's just a different horse there. He'll have to go again on Thursday. If I don't run him in that there's not another race he can run in at Brighton this year so we might as well give it a go. He's such a good horse to have and the Brighton Mile is an amazing race to win. He's usually winning 2,500GBP races so it's nice to win one worth four times more - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

runners.name: Etretat
runners.comment: Strike-rate of 3-32 and three of his last four runs have been forgettable; 0-14 on grass
runners.spotlight: Strike-rate of 3-32 and three of his last four runs have been fairly forgettable; 0-14 on the grass.

runners.name: Port Erin
runners.comment: Bounced back to form with a new success at Kempton in April (1m); stamina doubts
runners.spotlight: Bounced back to form with a narrow success at Kempton in April (1m; 3lb lower); lightly raced on turf but has won on good to soft and the main concern is stamina for this far.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I spoke to Jack Mitchell who has done a lot of work on Port Erin and he said 'he's just a galloper' so I was quite happy to go and do my own thing. He got into a nice rhythm on the front end and when I didn't get hassle for the first couple of furlongs, I knew he was going to take a lot of beating then - P J McDonald, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Countess Candy
runners.comment: Last six races on the AW and mostly consistent; softening ground a grey area
runners.spotlight: Confined to the AW since debut run at Yarmouth; 1m2f novice winner and mostly consistent; beaten under 3l at Lingfield last time and that was after three months off; had another break since, and wind surgery; softening ground a grey area.

runners.name: Foreseen
runners.comment: Only his fourth run for this yard when just missing out at Kempton (1m); stays okay
runners.spotlight: Heavy-ground winner in France; 0-10 in Britain but only his fourth run for this yard when just missing out at Kempton (1m); should appreciate this longer trip.

runners.name: Versatile
runners.comment: Recent Bath winner but modest next time and softening ground would create further doubts
runners.spotlight: Won a four-runner handicap at Bath (1m2f, firm; second run after wind surgery) but then ran disappointingly behind Pride Of Nepal at Brighton and 1m4f was no excuse; softening ground would create further doubts.

runners.name: Platinum Prince
runners.comment: Rarely looks straightforward under pressure and has new headgear here
runners.spotlight: Another fair run at Brighton ten days ago (1m2f, good to soft) but rarely looks straightforward under pressure and has new headgear here (replacing a visor).

runners.name: Alika Breeze
runners.comment: Very up and down in ten races for Richard Hughes but did win over Bath's 1m on soft ground
runners.spotlight: Very up and down in ten races for Richard Hughes but did win over Bath's 1m on soft ground in October (2lb lower); could go well back from a break with rain about.

stable_tour.quote: She really surprised me when she came to hand much earlier than you would expect for a daughter of Cracksman. Unfortunately, she had a little injury which put her back a few weeks, but she should be out August/September time. You would expect her to want a trip but she shows loads of pace and will start off over 6f or 7f. 29-06-23

runners.name: Pride Of Nepal
runners.comment: Previous winner of this race and latest run was encouraging; needs good or quicker ground
runners.spotlight: Won this three years ago off the very same mark and four further wins have followed, including two last year; signs of returning to form last time but needs the ground good or quicker to be at his best.

quotes.race: Ring20 Better Lives With Epilepsy Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Pride Of Nepal just seems to be in great form. He's been running thereabouts and was able to win last week. He takes his racing ever so well, and by the end of last week he was bouncing again. He's so straightforward, a jockey's dream. He's a pleasure to do everything with. There's a lot of amateur races out there and the next port of call will be the Cambridgeshire. The stiff mile [and] one [furlong] would probably suit him, and he won over that trip at Goodwood. That win should put us up a few pounds so he should get in - Sarah Bowen, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Latin

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Placed in both runs for James Owen but 0-22 overall and not one for maximum faith
runners.spotlight: Placed in both his runs for James Owen, latterly when visored at Southwell last weekend; now 0-22 overall and isn't one for maximum faith (short-priced favourite the last twice).

runners.name: Taskheer
runners.comment: Has won on AW and turf; has been running respectably over 1m on the AW; stays this far
runners.spotlight: Has won on AW and turf (effective on any surface); has been running respectably over 1m on the AW and he stays this far; holds some sort of chance.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Taskeer stays a mile so the strong pace here suited him. He tries very hard and the sharp track at Lingfield last time got him beat - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

6:34.race_name: BetGoodwin Best Odds Guaranteed Apprentice Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Cypriot Diaspora
runners.comment: Hasn't found her form this season and she's held by Momaer on their recent Windsor clash
runners.spotlight: Three-time turf winner but hasn't found her form this season and she's held by Momaer on their recent Windsor clash.

stable_tour.quote: She's tough little filly who won last time out at Goodwood, her second win of the season. She's a 6f filly and possibly a 7f one. She has no real ground preferences- she's a good regular runner and is still improving. She goes to Carlisle on Thursday for her next run. 11-07-24

runners.name: Momaer
runners.comment: Beaten fav at Windsor last time but had a tricky draw and endured a wide trip
runners.spotlight: Beaten favourite at Windsor recently (6f, good to firm), though had a tricky draw and endured a wide trip; all things considered, it was a solid run; won't mind rain, either.

quotes.race: Betfred Nifty 50 Handicap
quotes.quote: Momaer ran well at Windsor last time out on soft ground and she seems to love the ground like this. Josie (Gordon) knew what she was doing so I just left it to her. The mare had her ground and she just kept filling her up. When they went past the two pole I was quite happy with how she was going. This mare has held her form well all year - Mark Loughnane, trainer.

runners.name: Dapperling
runners.comment: Best form was at two; well down the field in both her runs this year
runners.spotlight: Best form was at two and only the occasional glimpses of that level since; well down the field in both her runs this year.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Super Sprint Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Dapperling ran a blinder and has plenty of speed and a great mentality. She's a nice, scopey filly who is going the right way - Sean Levey, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She ran a very good race when third the other day at Wolverhampton and travelled well. Physically she's done extremely well and will be a nice filly for the sprint handicaps. She might even get a bit of black type later on in the year. 29-04-24

runners.name: Gemini Star
runners.comment: Fair third on comeback run but then finished last at Doncaster
runners.spotlight: After dropping in the weights she reappeared with a respectable third of seven at Leicester (6f, good to firm) but then trailed home last at Doncaster; cheekpieces join the hood worn for her last four races.

stable_tour.quote: She is a lightly raced filly who has done precious little wrong in her four career starts. First time out she was caught out by inexperience, but she made up for that on her seasonal return at Thirsk in a 5f maiden. She then came second in a handicap at Nottingham where she hit every undulating piece of the course and still ran well to be beaten just three-quarters of a length. She has only run on soft and is better when getting her toe in, but it's not essential. She is a progressive type. 10-05-23

runners.name: Kensington Agent
runners.comment: Running well on the AW before collecting with a bit in hand at Bath two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Running well on the AW before collecting with a bit in hand at Bath two weeks ago (extended 5f; firm); likely to run well again off just 3lb higher and she has form with give underfoot.

runners.name: Cables Queen
runners.comment: Perhaps stretched by 7f when close up on last week's handicap debut back at Brighton
runners.spotlight: Only had the four races; went close in a 6f novice and perhaps stretched by 7f when close up on last week's handicap debut back at Brighton; likely to have some say, though is unraced on ground slower than good.

runners.name: Mammy
runners.comment: Didn't get the clearest of runs at Windsor when behind runner-up Momaer
runners.spotlight: Third at Salisbury and didn't get the clearest of runs at Windsor when behind runner-up Momaer; has a race in her off this mark.

runners.name: Little Miss Magic
runners.comment: Will need to run a lot better than at Salisbury when behind Mammy
runners.spotlight: Bath winner last August on stable debut; 0-7 in the meantime and will need to run a lot better than at Salisbury when behind Mammy.

runners.name: Unico
runners.comment: Dual winner; 0-10 for current yard; twice runner-up but quiet so far this season
runners.spotlight: Both wins were for Marco Botti over 6f; finished second in two of her ten races for current yard but has been beaten about 6l on both appearances this season.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Acca Bonus Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Unico is probably still a little bit green and a bit on her nerves. When she got to the front she was still a bit unsure about what to do but I think she did it nicely. We've had a little downpour which has probably helped - Josie Gordon, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Phoenix Moon
runners.comment: Not a bad last run at Ascot given the rise in grade and being 4lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Both wins on the AW; 0-4 on turf but didn't run too bad a race at Ascot last time (6f, good to firm) given the rise in grade and being 4lb out of the weights; would have it all to prove on softening ground.

runners.name: Firenze Rosa
runners.comment: Last season's slow-ground form would bring her into this should it get wet
runners.spotlight: 100-1 when last at Windsor 11 days ago on first run of the year; however, last season's slow-ground form would bring her into this should it get wet.

runners.name: Ashford Hill
runners.comment: Seems better on the AW and all her runs have been over further
runners.spotlight: 125-1 winner of 7f AW handicap during the winter; fair run last time at Chepstow but seems better on the AW and all her runs have been over further.

7:09.race_name: Derby Betting With World Pool Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Mahras Love
runners.owner: Sheikh Mana Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.comment: Handicap debutante from a top yard and now stepping up from 6f
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante from a top yard and now stepping up from 6f; bumped into a classy opponent in her second race and perhaps a little below that level at Yarmouth, though again ran well; both turf runs on good to firm; has to be of interest.

runners.name: Moostar
runners.comment: Nursery winner and ran okay on return; due to step up to 7f at Chelmsford last evening
runners.spotlight: Won a Thirsk nursery last September (6f, good to soft) and ran okay to be midfield on Windsor return (6f, good to firm) in April; due to step up to 7f at Chelmsford last evening (8.17).

quotes.race: Up To Â£25 Back With Bresbet Nursery Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Moostar was pretty good today. Speaking to Daryll [Holland, trainer] beforehand, he just said she is more of a galloper than a filly who quickens so I made use of that stride. She's still learning. I felt she wasn't doing a tap in front once I asked her a question and hopefully there's plenty more to come - Jason Watson, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Saxonia
