runners.comment: Consistent in handicaps; drawn wide, though significant rain would erase those concerns
runners.spotlight: Newcastle maiden winner earlier this year (1m, AW); thereabouts in three AW handicaps (7f/1m) before a fourth of eight at Newmarket where he tried to make all but faded; has a wide draw here, though significant rain would erase those concerns.

runners.name: Whizz By
runners.breeder: New England Stud & Mount Coote Stud
runners.comment: Has only won on the AW but a consistent run of form in handicaps includes a third on turf
runners.spotlight: Has only won on the AW but a consistent run of form in handicaps includes a third at Nottingham (good); looks handicapped about right but has each-way claims; fine at 7f or 1m.

runners.name: Pit Boss
runners.comment: Tried new headgear for stable/handicap debut but was well beaten at 20-1
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a 6f novice for George Boughey; tried this new headgear combination on handicap/stable debut at Windsor (6f, good to firm) but was weak in the market and well beaten; all runs on good or quicker ground.

runners.name: Mighty Ruler
runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Threatened for previous yard but now 0-7 and was 80-1 when behind Whizz By at Kempton; non-runner.

runners.name: Emporess
runners.comment: Nursery winner and second on only previous attempt at 7f which was here
runners.spotlight: Had plenty of racing at two, winning a nursery on heavy ground; consistent, though, and ran another sound race on stable debut at Wolverhampton (5f); runner-up here on only previous run over 7f; would appreciate any give underfoot; considered.

runners.name: Berkshire Smudge
runners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub
runners.comment: 0-7 and has yet to be overly competitive; hooded the last twice and now in blinkers
runners.spotlight: 0-7 and has yet to be overly competitive, even when third at Beverley two runs back where he was beaten 6l; hood worn for his last two races now replaced by blinkers; not easily warmed to.

runners.name: Sabrimento
runners.comment: Made it 0-6 for this yard when down the field at Newmarket; another headgear tweak
runners.spotlight: Took nine races to win for Brian Meehan (on soft at Bath); 0-6 for current yard and was kept to the AW until finishing well behind at Newmarket; now has a further tweak in his headgear.

runners.name: Up The Monk
runners.comment: Offered little in two handicaps; cheekpieces need to bring something to the party
runners.spotlight: His close fourth at Wolverhampton (7f) second time out is a bit of a standout and he's offered little in two handicaps since being gelded; cheekpieces need to bring something to the party.

runners.name: Letsbeatsepsis
runners.comment: Hasn't progressed at all and handicap form is very forgettable
runners.spotlight: Intial efforts were quite encouraging but he hasn't progressed at all and his handicap form is very forgettable; tried blinkers last time and now goes in cheekpieces.

runners.name: Unknown Journey
runners.comment: Seven-race maiden now on his third trainer and there's no great substance to his form
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who is now on his third trainer and there's no great substance to his form; tried over 1m4f the last twice.

runners.name: Time After Time
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D R Guest & Mr & Mrs Jpm Main
runners.comment: Beaten at least 13l in her four races, including handicap debut over 6f
runners.spotlight: Beaten at least 13l in her four races, including handicap debut over 6f (has raced over 8.6f); 6lb out of the weights.

2:15.race_name: Castle Mews Windows Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
2:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Baskerville
runners.comment: Kept on strongly to win quite comfortably by 12l on recent chase debut at Stratford
runners.spotlight: Just 1-8 over hurdles but took very well to fences at Stratford (2m6f, good) last month, keeping on strongly to win quite comfortably by 12l; subsequent 8lb rise might have been worse; leading contender.

stable_tour.quote: I was very pleased with his second at Hereford last month - he did everything right bar win under a good ride by Oscar Palmer. He wouldn't want deep ground but he should win again over hurdles this winter and could be quite an exciting novice chase prospect for the spring. He wants 2m3f to 2m5f at the moment. 07-11-24

runners.name: Full Monty
runners.comment: Clear season on last month's chasing debut; sports new headgear combination here
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner last summer; had to settle for second when well backed for recent chasing debut at Worcester (2m4f, good) but that was his first run for nearly seven months and he was nicely clear of the third; only 1lb higher here and will be hard to beat if combination of refitted tongue-tie and first-time cheekpieces has any positive effect.

runners.name: Lune De La Mer
runners.comment: Consistent over hurdles in recent months; headgear switched on chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Seemingly aided by cheekpieces over hurdles in recent months, making the frame four consecutive times on good ground (2m3f-3m); tries blinkers on this chase debut; can make his presence felt if he takes well to fences.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper and first time over hurdles at Aintree in May. He's coming back after a little injury and is set to run next month. Henry [Brooke] always thought he was one of our best horses, so we'd like to think he can progress. 21-11-24

runners.name: Sovereign Star
runners.comment: Placed over 2m1f here on chase/handicap debut in March; today's longer trip a likely plus
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced since he was placed in two Irish points in 2022 but made quite promising chase/handicap debut when third here (2m1f, good; first-time tongue-tie) in March; absent for 11 weeks since but ought to be suited by today's step up in trip.

2:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Sir Tivo
runners.comment: Gained hard-fought win from the front at Cartmel 11 days ago; now 10-33 over fences
runners.spotlight: Bounced back to form with hard-fought win from the front on recent reappearance outing at Cartmel (2m1f, good to soft) and is now 10-33 over fences; has 7lb penalty here (only due a 2lb rise) but remains well handicapped on form as recent as last summer and ought to be better suited by the forecast quicker ground here.

quotes.race: Heathcote Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sean (Bowen) thinks Sir Tivo might win with a penalty so we'll go for a novice hurdle and he needs two to three weeks between his races - Gary Hanmer, trainer

runners.name: Finest View
runners.comment: Came good over fences at Huntingdon last month; can remain competitive off 3lb higher mark
runners.spotlight: Five-time hurdle winner who opened her chasing account at the third attempt, in three-runner contest at Huntingdon (2m, good) last month; probably still on a workable mark after recent 3lb rise and this track also suits.

quotes.race: Flowfit Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Finest View has had so many entries this week I was praying I'd chosen the right race. I don't think we'll take up Cartmel but we'll keep going with her as she seems to be in the form of her life. We'll have a look at the programme book and see what there is. She doesn't do much when she hits the front, it's not ungenuine it's just her, but she's progressive. Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Finest View is progressive, but it's quite good that she has a little look when she gets in front. She did that before too, but it stops her overracing and charging a bit.  She was very free in her bumpers and she's now learning to relax and it's job done. I don't know whether we'll stop now, she's a novice until the end of October, so I'll have to see what's around but it could be a little break now. She doesn't want the ground soft but Tom said that was riding pretty quick today, so we'll see - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Join RacingTV Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Finest View took a little bit of time to race properly, she has been a bit keen, but settled beautifully today with a good pace and picked up well. There is not a lot of her and she's not a filly that you can run regularly. I would imagine she'd have one more run this spring - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She won on her debut in an all-weather bumper at Lingfield and then ran pretty well for a long way in the fillies' and mares' race at Aintree, where she was a bit gassy and was taking on five-year-olds, which is a huge disadvantage. She's decent and will probably start off in the Listed mares' bumper at Cheltenham before going hurdling. 19-10-21

She's been running quite consistently over hurdles, winning and then being second four times, but I've since schooled her over fences and she looks a natural. So she'll go down the mares' novice chase route and we could have quite a lot of fun with her, at 2m to 2m4f. 07-11-24

runners.name: Gods Own Getaway
runners.comment: Comes here after two respectable 2m4f thirds this spring and is edging down the weights
runners.spotlight: Not really firing on all cylinders since returning from a break in the autumn and has developed a tendency to finish rather weakly but comes here after two respectable 2m4f thirds this spring (cheekpieces added last time) and continues to edge down the weights.

quotes.race: Massaoke Race Night Friday 14th June Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: God's Own Country has taken time to mature but he's really stepped forward since going chasing, 2-3 now and a little unlucky at Warwick last time. He's on an upward curve and hopefully he'll continue that way being well-suited by the better ground at this time of year. Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Restandbethankful
runners.comment: Back on last winning mark but needs to raise game after some below-par efforts this spring
runners.spotlight: Now back on same mark as for last summer's win at Cartmel (2m1f, soft) and will be fine on the forecast faster ground here but needs to up his game after some below-par hurdle/chase runs this spring.

quotes.race: Breedon Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I'd love to say I gave him a peach of a ride, but Restandbethankful ran away with me. I rode him in work at home and he did exactly that, but you don't mind it when they're winning - Tommy Dowson, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran okay on his first start at Chepstow when he lacked experience. He works like he's on a decent mark and that run will have stood him in good stead. He's capable of winning on nice ground over hurdles. 21-10-21

He was a good winner over 2m at Huntingdon last time in a handicap hurdle and that form has received quite a boost with the runner-up, Zacony Rebel, bolting up last week at Ludlow by 12 lengths. There is a good handicap in two weeks' time at Musselburgh's big meeting that is his likely next assignment and off a 6lb higher mark he should continue to be competitive. 26-01-22

runners.name: Famoso

prev_owners.owner: P K Barber And P J Vogt

runners.comment: Six chase wins; back on a good mark now but safely held over C&D three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Six-time chase winner who is suited by good ground; back down to a good mark now but has rather mixed record this year and was safely held when sixth over C&D (good) three weeks ago.

quotes.race: Matt Sheppard Slow Two Miler Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was a career-best performance from Famoso and Stan [Sheppard] gave him a blinding ride. He's very well bred and probably has far more ability than he lets on, but he put it all together on the right day - Matt Sheppard, trainer.

quotes.race: NFU Mutual Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Famoso is a joy to train and he's very straightforward. He travelled into the race very strongly and I couldn't be happier with what he did. He'll be going to Ludlow as much as possible as he needs a sharp track. He disappointed at Exeter last time and Warwick too this season, which are galloping tracks, whereas his best runs have come here and at Stratford - Matt Shepherd, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He started 8-11 favourite for a Chepstow bumper but disappointed us. I think he'll leave that form well behind and I'm now going to get him going over hurdles because I think he wants a trip. 16-11-20

He's been in great form. He did us proud when winning the Matt Sheppard Slow Two-Miler Handicap Chase at Hereford on the day of my book launch. He won at Ludlow off 81 last November and his win at Hereford this November was off 97, so he's done really well. He then ran at Wincanton last Thursday, running and winning off a career-high mark of 102 under Richard Patrick. I was a bit worried that the ground might have been a bit soft for him but he's never failed to surprise me. Wincanton proved to me that the better the class of race, the better he might run, and he did it quite cosily in the end. He'll go to either Ludlow or Hereford on December 18 or 21, whichever one looks best at the time. He's a half-brother to the King George winner Tornado Flyer. 28-11-24

4:40.race_name: Ladies Day On Saturday 21st June Mares' Handicap Hurdle
4:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Heather Honey
runners.comment: 2-2 since upped to 2m7f, the latter win gained over C&D; commands respect
runners.spotlight: 2-2 since upped to 2m7f, the latter win gained over C&D (good) three weeks ago; not sure to be favoured by the forecast rain here but could still have more improvement to come and commands respect.

runners.name: Pour The Wine
runners.comment: Well beaten over C&D on stable debut in April; cheekpieces added today
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles in Ireland and, following a long absence, was soundly beaten over C&D on stable debut in April; sports first-time cheekpieces here; needs to have taken significant benefit from that recent outing.

runners.name: Chatshow Host
runners.comment: Placed here in new cheekpieces in April but not in same form last time;  others preferred
runners.spotlight: Seemingly boosted by first-time cheekpieces when keeping-on third over C&D (good to soft) in April but last month's Uttoxeter run was a backward step and she's now 0-9 over hurdles; others preferred.

runners.name: Killybegs Jet Lady
runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles but performed admirably in defeat over 2m7f on last two outings
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles but performed admirably in defeat over 2m7f (good/good to soft) on her last two runs this spring and there's a good chance she'll be right in the thick of things again here.

runners.name: Moonshine Girl
runners.comment: Irish raider; posted two good efforts when upped to 3m last month; likely contender
runners.spotlight: Irish raider; 0-7 over hurdles but shaped well before fading into fourth at Cork last month and held every chance before penultimate-flight fall at Southwell (also 3m, good) ten days later; likely contender.

runners.name: Newmill Getaway
runners.comment: Kept on well for second over 2m3f on stable debut; back up in trip today; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Unable to justify strong market support but stuck to her task very well when second on stable debut at Fontwell (2m3f, good) last month; that was her first run for nearly a year and today's move back up in trip looks the right move; must be considered.

runners.name: My Little Toni
runners.comment: Well beaten on stable debut in April and refused to race on latest appearance; too risky
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on stable debut in April (2m1f) and refused to race on her latest appearance; goes beyond 2m4f for first time under rules and sports first-time blinkers here; too risky

runners.name: Lakes Aventurine
runners.comment: Came good at Ludlow (2m5f) last month, her eighth hurdle run; up in trip here
runners.spotlight: Kept on well to beat Clover Pass and open account at Ludlow (2m5f, good) last month, her eighth start over hurdles; that form isn't anything to get too excited about but further progress is possible over the longer trip here.

runners.name: Clover Pass
runners.comment: Runner-up on last two of her eight hurdling starts but others here appeal more
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on the last two of her eight hurdling starts, more recently behind Lake's Aventurine in five-runner race at Ludlow (2m5f, good) last month; can give another good account here but others appeal more all the same.

runners.name: On We Go

prev_owners.owner: Kenny Johnson And Mrs K Elliott

runners.comment: Hinted at possible return to form two runs ago but safely held since
runners.spotlight: Five-time hurdle winner but not since February 2023; hinted at possible return to form when third at Carlisle (3m1f, good) in April but didn't build on that performance last time; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Nowyouvebinandunit
runners.comment: Good second at Stratford in March and next two runs better than bare form suggests
runners.spotlight: 0-13 over hurdles but hasn't been with Neil Mulholland long; creditable second at Stratford (2m6f, good to soft) in March and arguably ran better than bare form suggests on both subsequent outings; not out of this.

runners.name: Hello Marie
runners.comment: Ran well for long way in second of her three qualifying races; lowly mark for h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at triple-digit odds in three maiden/novice hurdles during the winter but ran well for a long way at Warwick (2m3f, good to soft) on second occasion and evidently has a modicum ability; makes handicap debut off a basement mark; upped in trip; no surprise if she features.

runners.name: Damekap
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Raoult Philippe
runners.comment: Showed no significant promise in three slow-ground 2m5f novice hurdles last season
runners.spotlight: Showed no significant promise in three slow-ground 2m5f novice hurdles last season and is 11lb out of the weights for this handicap debut; significant improvement required.

4:10.race_name: Clwyd Special Riding Centre Handicap Hurdle
4:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Whizz Kid
runners.comment: Absent since below-par chase run in November but reverts to hurdling on a tempting mark
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced over last couple of years and absent since well-held third over fences in November (didn't jump well enough); yet fully to convince stamina-wise over this sort of trip but switches back to hurdling on a tempting mark; dangerous to ignore.

quotes.race: Shropshire Homes Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We really like Whizz Kid and he's worked quite well at home. We got him from the Arqana sale in France and he was the most expensive horse Foxtrot Racing have ever bought. There's a nice race at Sandown on bet365 Gold Cup day [2m novice championship final] or a valuable handicap at Aintree which we might look to go to. There's a few options and it'll be interesting to see what the handicapper does as he hasn't beaten much - Dan Abraham, racing manager for Foxtrot Racing (Owners).

runners.name: Liverpool Knight
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: Consistent 7yo; dropped 1lb since close fourth at Worcester last month; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Consistent 7yo; yet to win after five starts for current stable but was beaten under 4l when fourth of 14 at Worcester (2m4f, good) last month and is 1lb lower here; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Gwash
runners.comment: Won a maiden in cheekpieces last spring; off since two lesser efforts in June/July
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who won a Warwick maiden (2m3f, good) in first-time cheekpieces last April; absent since two lesser efforts last June/July, though, and makes handicap debut with no headgear; very weak in betting at 33-1 when withdrawn from last month's intended reappearance (bolted before start); stablemate Liverpool Knight looks much safer.

runners.name: Al Sayah
runners.comment: Comes here in excellent form and is 3lb ahead of the handicapper; makes obvious appeal
runners.spotlight: 4-8 over hurdles; took form to whole new level last month, winning comfortably on consecutive outings at Newton Abbot (2m5f, good; cheekpieces refitted last time); 3lb ahead of the handicapper under penalty she carries for the latter success and makes obvious appeal in current mood.

runners.name: Lipa K

prev_owners.owner: P L Conway & T B P Cottrell Racing

runners.comment: Dual course winner over fences in 2024 and ran well over hurdles here last month
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner over fences last spring (2m1f/2m4f) and kept on for creditable second over hurdles here (2m, good) last month; back up in trip today; respected.

quotes.race: Dragonbet Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lipa K always ran well for his previous yard and we were lucky to get him pretty much ready to go. He jumped really well at home and while he was a little ponderous over his fences today I don't think he enjoyed the soft patches of ground. He actually did it a shade cosily at the end - Oliver Greenall, joint trainer.

quotes.race: Killarney Oils (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Lipa K is a good horse and I think he will be sold now, but hopefully to stay in the yard. I'd love to keep a horse like him in my yard - Eoin McCarthy, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's been a tricky horse to get right. He ran well when third at Stratford on his reappearance but it didn't help him when they took the hurdles out on the straight due to the low sun. I think there's plenty of room off his mark and he can win a decent race off a low weight. He wants a quickly run two miles with some cut in the ground, although he might stay a bit further. 02-11-23

runners.name: Speed Davis
runners.breeder: C Quellier, A Quellier & S Quellier
runners.comment: Yet to make any progress since maiden win in April 2024; off since pulled up in February
runners.spotlight: Yet to make any further progress since his maiden hurdle win at Musselburgh (2m1f, soft) in April 2024 and was pulled up in 2m4f handicap there when tried in blinkers (now removed) in February; needs four-month break to have done him good.

quotes.race: Blantyre Canter - Sponsored By Cleartech Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Speed Davis won a point-to-point, he won his bumper and he was second last time at Catterick. He was a bit novicey at times but he jumped well - Brian Hughes, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: His form has worked out well. We were a bit disappointed he didn't win over the summer and we've had his wind done. He'll make into a nice middle-distance novice hurdler/novice chaser. 12-11-24

3:30.race_name: Going Is Good Novices' Handicap Hurdle
3:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Regal Cavalier
runners.comment: Second at huge odds two starts ago but not in same form last time; handicap debut today
runners.spotlight: Won on the Flat in France last summer and left inauspicious stable/hurdle debut a long way behind when second at huge odds at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) in April; Worcester last month was underwhelming, though, and he'll need to up his game to defy top weight on this handicap debut.

runners.name: Blazer Two
runners.comment: Swallowed up after racing too freely in the lead on handicap hurdle debut in April
runners.spotlight: Lowly rated on the Flat nowadays; belied 80-1 odds when second in Kelso novice hurdle (2m, soft) in February but was swallowed up after racing too freely in the lead in Perth handicap (2m, good to soft) in April.

quotes.race: Hope Against Cancer Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Blazer Two hit the line nicely. He gave me a nice feel and Michael [Scudamore] gave me very straightforward instructions - Callum Hutchinson, rider.

quotes.race: Evening Racing @LeicesterRaces Wednesday 20th July Handicap
quotes.quote: I was pleased to get his head in front really. We had a string of five second places on the all-weather in the winter and then Blazer Two seemed to go off the boil. He had to show a good attitude at the end today, which we have often questioned. I don't know why he put in two moderate performances the last two times, but he's back on track now and hopefully there will be a bit more improvement - Michael Scudamore, trainer.

runners.name: Portcammon
runners.comment: Only fourth of six on recent handicap debut but remains unexposed
runners.spotlight: Only fourth of six on handicap debut at Uttoxeter (2m, good; first-time cheekpieces) three weeks ago but most of the flights were omitted in that unsatisfactory race and he remains unexposed; could have a say.

runners.name: Guillaume
runners.comment: Kept on well for close second off this mark at Kelso 12 days ago; obvious claims
runners.spotlight: Much better known as a chaser and has 0-5 strike-rate over hurdles but kept on well for close second at Kelso (2m2f, good) 12 day ago and has obvious claims if in similar form here.

runners.name: Miaswell
runners.comment: Fairly useful on the Flat but his hurdling form is underwhelming; improvement required
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful on the Flat for David O'Meara in 2024 (two wins) but last season's hurdling form for Donald McCain was underwhelming; ran better than eventual 13l defeat suggests when third of five on handicap debut at Sedgefield (2m1f, good) in April but has been well beaten on the Flat since; improvement required.

runners.name: Tropical Talent
runners.comment: Went close in C&D hurdle in September and in fairly good form over fences this spring
runners.spotlight: In fairly good form over fences this spring and now 3lb lower than when going close in C&D (good) hurdle race in September; cheekpieces didn't appear to help much when used once last year but they're given another whirl today; big player if all goes to plan.

runners.name: Blossom Tea
runners.comment: Showed only minor promise in her qualifying races but may fare better in handicaps.
runners.spotlight: Showed nothing more than glimmers of promise in her three qualifying races towards the end of last year but it won't be a surprise if she gets much more competitive in handicaps; watch the betting.

runners.name: Hope Hill
runners.comment: 0-6 over hurdles and 4lb wrong today but last summer's promise makes him of interest
runners.spotlight: Shaped well before fading into fifth in two Market Rasen handicaps (both 2m4f, good) last summer and may not have been suited by the soft ground when a disappointing favourite at Sedgefield in January; returns from another break and is 4lb wrong today but still considered.

1:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Ilostasock
runners.comment: Soundly beaten over C&D on hurdling debut three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Did not show a great deal in three bumpers last season and was soundly beaten over C&D on hurdling debut three weeks ago.

runners.name: Meetingofthewaters
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Unplaced in four Irish points this year, having completed only once; rules debut today
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in four Irish points this year, having completed only once; with good trainer for rules career but stable has much more obvious claims with Solent Gateway here.

runners.name: Ryebridge
runners.comment: Not disgraced in Irish points in spring 2024 but well beaten in a bumper in April
runners.spotlight: Out of a well-connected mare; not disgraced in three Irish points in spring 2024 but beaten about 49l when 80-1 for Perth bumper in April.

runners.name: Solent Gateway
runners.comment: Placed on last four hurdling starts and has another big role to play here
runners.spotlight: Four-time Flat winner who was placed on the last four of his five hurdling starts, most recently when close second in Sedgefield maiden (2m4f, good) last month; should be fine over today's shorter trip and has another big role to play; swaps usual cheekpieces for first-time blinkers.

quotes.race: Betfred TV Hell Nook Handicap
quotes.quote: I knew Solent Gateway quite well because I've ridden against him a few times and I just did what I was told by the boss. I got an easy lead. I cantered round in front, he was a relaxed horse and he was very push-button - Hollie Doyle, rider.

quotes.race: tote+ Chester Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Solent Gateway never relaxed but he needs to be held up really and you can't do it in a race like that. He'll learn - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a handful of runs for me when I first arrived before we decided he might benefit from wind surgery. It certainly didn't do him any harm as he has added victories at Wolverhampton and Haydock to his CV. Last time out at Newbury he ran another fine race when fourth to Sweet William, who more than franked the form at Glorious Goodwood. Solent Gateway now heads to York next week and the flat, galloping 2m will be ideal for him. He's a tough and consistent individual who always runs his race. The flipside to that honesty is that he's not particularly well handicapped. 17-08-23

runners.name: Herja
runners.comment: Good third at Newcaslte (2m1f) two starts ago; possibly stretched by 2m6f last time
runners.spotlight: No match for comfortable winner when second at Ffos Las (2m6f, good) last month but the form of her third at Newcastle (2m1f, good to soft) two starts ago looks pretty solid in this context and, now dropped back in trip, she's a leading contender.

runners.name: Shes A Woman
runners.comment: Well beaten at triple-digit odds in two good-ground bumpers this spring
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at triple-digit odds in two good-ground bumpers this spring; can't be recommended on rules debut.

runners.name: Top Tier Gossip
runners.comment: Raced a bit too freely when third over 2m4f on hurdling debut; may fare better back at 2m
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in soft-ground Stratford bumper in the autumn; raced too freely before weakening into third on recent hurdling debut at Worcester (2m4f, good) but significant positives can still be drawn from that performance, and she may benefit from today's drop back in trip.

stable_tour.quote: We were surprised at how green she was when finishing second at Stratford and she'll step forward a good deal when she reappears in a couple of weeks. 12-11-24

runners.name: Urban Rhythm
runners.comment: Third foal from a winning pointer; probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Third foal from a winning pointer; doesn't need to be anything special to get competitive on debut but probably best watched all the same.

6:20.race_name: Juddmonte EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands C/D) (EBF Restricted Qualifier) (GBB)
6:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Airside
runners.comment: 24,000gns yearling; yard likely holds better prospects with Coyy unless market disagrees
runners.spotlight: 24,000gns yearling by Ardad; fifth foal; half-brother to two winners including Percy's Lad (7.5f/1m including 2yo September debut for this yard; RPR 105); dam unraced half-sister to 7f winner/Ribblesdale second Eldalil; holds some big sales race entries; stable can ready one but likely holds better prospects with Coyy unlikes the market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Army Bugler
runners.comment: Respectable debut when fifth at Salisbury (Proof second); needs more but that's possible
runners.spotlight: Outpaced but it was a respectable debut when fifth of nine at Salisbury (5f, good to firm; Proof second) 13 days ago; needs more but he's open to improvement.

runners.name: Comic Hero
runners.comment: 28,000euros yearling; yard juveniles usually improve for debuts; worth a market check
runners.spotlight: 28,000euros yearling by Saxon Warrior; first foal; dam 7f winner (RPR 78), half-sister to winners Kings Joy (1m 2yo December debut) and Chortal (2m1f hurdle); stable's juveniles usually improve for their debuts but he's well worth a market check.

runners.name: Proof
runners.comment: Good debut second (Army Bugler fifth) and he's not far behind on the figures; considered
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to connections' prolific Spoof and he made a good introduction when second at Salisbury (5f, good to firm; Army Bugler fifth) 13 days ago; not far behind on the figures and he's open to progress.

runners.name: Secret Santa
runners.comment: Both races he's run in are working out, particularly Newbury last time; strong contender
runners.spotlight: Out of a Queen Mary winner for his connections; showed ability when fourth at Goodwood (5f; has produced winners) on debut and stepped up on that when third at Newbury (6f, also good) three weeks ago; latter race is working out strongly and he holds clear claims.

runners.name: Touchwoodnwhistle
runners.comment: Biggish prices when third in two starts here; bit of work to do with the principals
runners.spotlight: Biggish prices when third in two starts here, latterly beaten just over 5l at this trip (firm) 23 days ago; bit of work to do with the principals.

runners.name: Coyy
runners.comment: Good first/third run; not certain to beat Gorey Gold this time but he sets the standard
runners.spotlight: Promising debut when fourth at Newbury (5f, good) but he was well below that form at Leicester two weeks later; that was a useful maiden, however, and he was back on track when tongue tied and third at Windsor (6f, good to firm; Gorey Gold 1l behind) last time; narrowly sets the standard.

runners.name: Dark Alley
runners.comment: Already gelded son of Land Force; yard probably holds better prospects with Army Bugler
runners.spotlight: Already gelded son of Land Force; March (second) foal; dam multiple 5.7f winner (RPR 79), closely related to 5f/6f winner Speed Dial Baileys, half-sister to useful 5f-7f winner Rock On Baileys, out of 5f winner; bred to be speedy but yard probably holds better prospects with Army Bugler.

runners.name: Gorey Gold
runners.comment: Good debut fifth (Coyy 1l ahead); has a chance of reversing the placings despite wide draw
runners.spotlight: Really encouraging start when fifth of 12 at Windsor (6f, good to firm; Coyy 1l ahead) 18 days ago; no surprise if he improved past that rival despite a wide stall.

runners.name: The Glory Code
runners.comment: 1,000gns yearling; dam a 6f winner (RPR 74); market check advised
runners.spotlight: 1,000gns yearling; March (first) foal; dam 6f winner (including AW 2yo; RPR 74), half-sister to 6f-1m winner The Bullion Bomber; market check advised on debut.

runners.name: Coinin Caisc
runners.comment: Promising debut here (33-1) but way below that on AW next time; chance on the first run
runners.spotlight: Hampered early then ran green when 33-1 here (5f, good to firm) last month but she rallied to finish a clear third of nine behind the subsequent National Stakes winner; nowhere near that next time over 6f (AW) but that initial run makes her of interest.

runners.name: Going Again
runners.comment: 10-1, beaten just over 5l on debut ten days ago; can likely do better but drawn widest
runners.spotlight: 10-1 and beaten just over 5l at Redcar (6f, good to firm) ten days ago; can likely do better but she's drawn widest.

runners.name: Mayaada
runners.comment: 22,000euros yearling; stable have winning newcomers and she's worth a market check
runners.spotlight: 22,000euros yearling by Phoenix Of Spain; March (fifth) foal; half-sister to winners Specialmente (French/Hong Kong 5f-7f including August 2yo debut/AW; RPR 93) and Lady Maeve (Canadian 7f-8.5f turf/AW); dam unplaced 6f-1m2f (65), half-sister to 7f Group 3 winner Nargys; stable have winning newcomers and she's worth a market check.

5:15.race_name: Netbet Â£10 Free Bet Welcome Handicap (Bath Summer Stayers' Series Qualifier)
5:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Francesco Baracca
runners.comment: Remains 2lb above his last winning mark (AW) and needs to improve on recent efforts
runners.spotlight: Won his maiden (2yo) on good to soft but has been taken out on account of soft and heavy ground before, so it's unlikely he'd want too much rain; otherwise, he remains 2lb above his last winning mark (AW) and needs to improve on recent efforts.

runners.name: Russian Rumour
runners.comment: Three-time course winner who's resumed in good form and will appreciate any rain; player
runners.spotlight: Three-time course winner who's resumed in good form and will appreciate any rain; little room for manoeuvre off this mark but she's adaptable as regards tactics (has often made the running) and enters calculations.

quotes.race: Betway Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Russian Rumour stayed really well. She kept going strongly, handles the surface and the race worked out well - Simon Walker, jockey.

runners.name: Fair Dinkum
runners.comment: In decent form this spring; rain shouldn't be a major issue and he's on a competitive mark
runners.spotlight: Dual Polytrack winner who's 0-14 on turf and lost his way last backend; been in decent form this spring, though, rain shouldn't be a major issue and he remains on a competitive mark.

runners.name: Hidden Pearl
runners.owner: The Sisters Of Mercy & John Berry
runners.comment: Again won on Yarmouth comeback recently (third year on the spin); 5lb rise will test her
runners.spotlight: Won on her comeback at Yarmouth in 2023 and 2024, and did so again at a big price a fortnight ago; boasts a C&D win too but a 5lb rise sees her higher in the weights than for many a year and rain will be more in the favour of others.

runners.name: Grey Owl
runners.comment: Clear comeback second at Salisbury a month ago has been boosted since; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Well suited by a stiff 1m6f and his clear comeback second at Salisbury a month ago has been boosted by the winner going in again since; only 1lb higher and his claims are obvious.

runners.name: Tara Iti
runners.comment: Better treated on the Flat now; this trip should be within range and he's respected
runners.spotlight: Three wins over hurdles for his new yard this spring and is better treated on the Flat now; stamina looked to give out over 2m when well fancied at Nottingham four weeks ago but this trip should be within range.

quotes.race: Veolia Nursery Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Tara Iti is bred to go on this testing ground. He travelled well despite being a little keen early. I took it up early enough, but he kept it up all the way to the line - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

7:30.race_name: Netbet Official Partner Of UFC Handicap (Bath Summer Sprint Series Qualifier)
7:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Asinara
runners.comment: Ultra consistent; can race keenly and shouldn't mind the drop from 6f; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Ultra consistent since handicapping and has run well in two starts back, faring best of those drawn low at Haydock before chasing home a subsequent winner last time; can race keenly and shouldn't mind the drop from 6f; shortlisted.

stable_tour.quote: She's in the 1,000 Guineas but disappointed us on her last start at Southwell. Her work had been really smart leading up to that, but she seems to have gone backward in her coat. It's been a bad spring with the weather, especially for fillies, so we're going to be patient. We like her a lot and she's shown plenty at home - we didn't put her in the Guineas for nothing. 17-04-24

runners.name: Sioux Warrior
runners.comment: Came away with a subsequent winner latest; obvious claims up 4lb for a yard in decent nick
runners.spotlight: Found his level for his current trainer this spring, building on his Nottingham second (well supported) when off the mark off 4lb lower latest; came away with a subsequent winner there and holds obvious claims for a yard in decent nick.

runners.name: Thank The Lord
runners.comment: No great record fresh; entitled to need his first run in well over a year for a new yard
runners.spotlight: Nothing to suggest he's best caught fresh and is entitled to need this first run in well over a year for his new yard; might also want some help from the handicapper, so may be best watched unless there's good support.

runners.name: Not Just Yet
runners.comment: AW regular; quite late in the day to be tackling 5f for the first time
runners.spotlight: Two years since his sole (Irish) win and has had plenty of chances in low-grade AW handicaps in recent times; quite late in the day to be tackling 5f for the first time.

quotes.race: Croom House Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: All Not Just Yet's form was on slow or soft ground so we thought the ground might be too quick. He was slowly away but got a good position. I probably got there too soon, he didn't do a whole pile in front but he is nice and done it well. Hopefully now he can step forward now having proven himself on that ground. - Adam Caffrey, jockey.

runners.name: Sisters In The Sky
runners.comment: Not the most consistent overall but has always liked it here and is fine on any ground
runners.spotlight: Not the most consistent overall but has always liked it here and is fine on any ground; easy to back when turning in one of his lesser efforts here (5.7f) last time and steps back up from 0-55 company.

runners.name: Wedgewood
runners.comment: Just a fair effort off her lower turf mark last time; never run on ground softer than good
runners.spotlight: Best known for her Wolverhampton work but is a C&D winner (firm) too, that coming off 3lb lower last summer; just a fair effort off her lower turf mark last time; never run on ground softer than good.

runners.name: Olympic Quest
runners.comment: Achieved little in a handful of turf starts; hard to fancy from out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Done most racing over a good bit further and has achieved little in a handful of turf starts; hard to fancy from out of the handicap on her first crack at 5f.

8:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Zambezi Magic

prev_owners.owner: D B Clark & A R Bentall

runners.comment: Trip fine but no particular record fresh and market should be helpful after 218 days away
runners.spotlight: All five wins over this trip, four of them at Ffos Las including two last year; couple of respectable efforts here but he can take a few runs to get going after a break; market helpful on this first start for 218 days.

runners.name: Aikhal

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Mary Slack And Mrs J Slack Jell

runners.comment: On the slide for a while but respectable latest; profile unconvincing but a likely player
runners.spotlight: Former Group 3 winner who's been on the slide for a while now; suggested he was about to exploit a much reduced mark when fourth at Wolverhampton (9.4f) last month and he attracted good support when keeping on for third at Brighton (1m2f, good to soft) ten days ago; overall profile far from persuasive but he still warrants consideration.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Aikhal had the pace to get a proper position and he handles a dig. He will need to improve but he probably will - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He went to France last year and wasn't beaten far in a Group 1 race, so we were thinking he might be one to go the St Mark's Basilica route, the Poulains and the Prix du Jockey Club. He has worked very well. We think he's potentially a Classic-standard colt anyway, so the Irish 2,000 Guineas would be a possibility too. The Tetrarch Stakes has gone up to a mile from seven furlongs this year, so that could be a starting-off point for him. 19-04-22

runners.name: Fast Affair
runners.comment: Got tired on recent stable debut; drop in trip and returning cheekpieces are interesting
runners.spotlight: Her two wins for James Fanshawe came around 1m1f in cheekpieces on AW, most recently last June; sold 16,000gns the following month and she got tired on her stable debut at Chepstow (1m4f, good) one week ago; that was her first run for a year, however, and the drop in trip and returning cheekpieces are interesting.

runners.name: City Escape
runners.comment: Consistent mare, including when fourth on AW on Tuesday; thereabouts again
runners.spotlight: Consistent mare despite being a regular slow-starter; running respectably at Wolverhampton over 9.5f this year, winning twice, and it was another solid effort when fourth there on Tuesday; effective here too and likely runs her race again.

runners.name: Sweet Sister
runners.comment: Eight-race maiden who's been poor the last twice; visor tried now but still looks risky
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who's been poor the last twice, latterly in first-time cheekpieces at Windsor (1m) when coming back from a 241-day break; now tried in a visor and has plenty to prove.

runners.name: Tonis Legacy
runners.comment: Much better when fifth here last time; up in trip for this handicap debut; interesting
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in two starts last year (1m4f) but her reappearance fifth of eight here (1m, good to firm) was much more like it; plenty of stamina in the family and now steps up in trip in added cheekpieces for her handicap debut; probable contender.

runners.name: Blue Hero

prev_owners.owner: K Sohi Mrs I Corbani & Partners

runners.comment: All eight wins here, including C&D; couldn't get in a blow last time but still respected
runners.spotlight: All eight of his wins have been at this track, including two at this trip and he was fourth in this race last year; has dropped below last winning mark but he could never get in a blow over 1m3.5f at this track (firm) last time; still respected.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: I was expecting a good performance from Blue Hero, although the trip was a question mark. We thought he'd get it, but he's improved from a three-year-old. He's a little bit tricky in his head, but he's physically improved from last year. He likes it here, but doesn't have to stay here - it's coincidence we run a lot here. I was worried the ground would be on the soft side, but he's handled it well - Adrian Wintle, trainer.

runners.name: Ricardo Phillips
runners.comment: Best effort when last seen (1m4f, AW) 168 days ago; turf query but capable of better
runners.spotlight: Struggled in his first two handicaps (turf) last year but it wasn't a bad effort in a maiden (9.5f) two starts back and he built on that when returned to this sphere, beaten 2l at Southwell (1m4f, also AW) in December; something to prove back on this surface after 168 days away but he's not fully exposed and his yard has already matched last year's tally.

runners.name: Alyara
runners.owner: Lynn Cullimore Pete Ponting Joe Ponting
runners.comment: 3-48 and can race freely; stopped quickly last time (7f); not the percentage call
runners.spotlight: 3-48 and can race freely; narrowly beaten over C&D last July but she stopped quickly in a first-time visor at Lingfield (7f) 74 days ago; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Galactic Glow
runners.comment: Three-time winner and good second (also C&D) last time; big player
runners.spotlight: Won three over C&D in the summer of 2023; third in an amateur riders' race on his return to the Flat one month ago and he built on that when second (also C&D, firm; fourth's won since) a fortnight ago; versatile ground-wise and looks a key player.

8:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Gladiadora
runners.owner: R Coleman, G Glendining, L Glendining
runners.comment: This is more realistic now handicapping at a lowly level and the market will guide
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who ran as well as could have been expected last time; this is more realistic now handicapping at a lowly level, back up from 7f, and the market will guide.

runners.name: King Of Speed
runners.comment: Four decent efforts over C&D; should give his running but little wiggle room off this mark
runners.spotlight: Four decent efforts in defeat to his name over C&D, latterly when a clear second a fortnight ago (firm) off 2lb lower (two of these behind); should give his running once more but there's little wiggle room off this mark.

runners.name: Disclosure
runners.comment: Gave her running on just her second crack at turf last Friday but will need to better that
runners.spotlight: Another to win on her debut for this yard when going in off 6lb lower on Polytrack two months ago; again gave her running on just her second crack at turf last Friday but will need to better that.

runners.name: Reteti
runners.breeder: G Hedley & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Drop to 6f was never likely to help last time and this is more realistic now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Started life in bumpers and has been slowly away all three Flat runs this spring; the drop to 6f was never likely to help last time and this is more realistic now handicapping.

runners.name: Soi Dao
runners.comment: Goes well here, is fairly treated for a yard in good order and returns to her ideal trip
runners.spotlight: Goes well here, is fairly treated for a yard in good order and returns to her preferred distance; won't mind any rain and is one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Fighting Queen
runners.breeder: H H Shaikh Nasser Bin Hamad Al Khalifa
runners.comment: Hung left when behind King Of Speed and Claxton Bay latest; that leaves her a bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Winner on her C&D handicap debut a month ago off a 5lb lower mark; perhaps a third quick run on firm ground was behind her latest effort here (hung left; behind King Of Speed and Claxton Bay) but that leaves her a bit to prove.

runners.name: Union Island
runners.comment: Generally consistent and knows how to win; only been nudged up 1lb for his recent victory
runners.spotlight: Generally consistent and knows how to win; only been nudged up 1lb for his narrow Beverley victory a fortnight ago and holds claims for a yard with a decent record here in recent times.

runners.name: Claxton Bay
runners.comment: Took off in front over C&D last time; that was a solid effort in the circumstances
runners.spotlight: Often makes the running, as when going too hard in front over C&D a fortnight ago; that was a solid effort in the circumstances and he's one to consider back under experienced 5lb claimer Jordan Williams.

runners.name: Tonal
runners.comment: Expensive to follow; achieved little in four runs on turf; watch the market again
runners.spotlight: Expensive to follow last year and was again all the rage, back from eight months off, at Wolverhampton three months ago; finished well held, though, and he's achieved little in four runs on turf; watch the market again.

5:45.race_name: Stream Racing Live At Netbet Classified Stakes
5:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: A Lady Forever
runners.comment: Popped up back from a big absence 99 days ago (6f, AW); can do better; stable debut
runners.spotlight: Poor form in autumn 2022 for Robyn Brisland but she popped up on her return from a mammoth absence when winning a Newcastle classified (6f, AW; 20-1) in February; has since left Roger Fell (same owner) but she's open to further progress.

runners.name: Bonny Power
runners.comment: Eased and beaten 23l on her reappearance over C&D last month; passed over
runners.spotlight: 5f AW winner when trained in Ireland; modest form for this yard last year and her second on her penultimate run was a modest one in Jersey; two starts here have yielded nothing, including when eased and beaten 23l over this trip (firm) on her reappearance last month.

runners.name: Cammy
runners.comment: Unlucky third over C&D last time; blinkers retained and sprinting could be his game
runners.spotlight: 0-21 but caught the eye when third (Fishermans Cottage second) over C&D (firm; first-time blinkers, retained) a fortnight ago having met traffic; that was a big drop in trip and maybe sprinting will be the making of him.

runners.name: Coco Hill

prev_owners.owner: Mrs T Burns And B R Millman

runners.comment: From dipped in a handicap last time; not ruled out back in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f winner (soft/good to soft); two respectable efforts for her new yard on AW in March (both classifieds) but her form dipped in a Chepstow handicap (5f, good) last time; not ruled out back in this sphere.

runners.name: Fishermans Cottage
runners.comment: Has resumed in good form and was second over C&D last time; firmly in the mix
runners.spotlight: Often races freely but has resumed in good form, breaking his duck on comeback (6f, good to firm) then having no luck at 5f before a solid second over C&D (firm, Cammy an unlucky third) a fortnight ago; better off with that rival on this classified debut.

runners.name: Lochaber

prev_owners.owner: D J Mackay & Mrs E Burke

runners.comment: Always behind in a Southwell classified 119 days ago; others hold much stronger claims
runners.spotlight: Mainly disappointing since sole win at Beverley (5f; seller) last May and he was always behind in a Southwell classified (6f) 119 days ago.

runners.name: Redshore City
runners.comment: Good fourth over C&D in September; makes return in first classified race; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Ran well when fourth of 15 over C&D (good; first-time cheekpieces) last September and he's versatile ground-wise; didn't match that in two subsequent runs here but is dropped into his first classified race for this reappearance.

runners.name: The Cola Kid
runners.comment: Behind a couple of these over C&D a fortnight ago; others preferred
runners.spotlight: On the decline since winning twice at Kempton (AW) towards the end of 2023; respectable third to Fishermans Cottage in an amateur riders' race at Salisbury (6f, good to firm) in May but was behind a couple of these over C&D a fortnight ago.

quotes.race: Summer Racing At Naas Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought he would need the run. He was a bit sick after the run the last day (tenth at Fairyhouse at the end of May) and I'd say he's probably better fresh. He stayed at it well. There is a race for him at Fairyhouse next Sunday, a six furlong 0-70 handicap. He's a good fun horse, very honest and stays going. Every time he ran up to now there was a problem with the draw but today everything worked to plan - Michael Brown, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Formerly with Michael Browne, he is another who joined us in September. It took us a while to get his head in front, but he did win at Newcastle (6f) in March and has run very well in defeat in each of his last two runs. I have given him a little break since then, but he is still on a competitive mark. 04-05-22

runners.name: Hardlass
runners.comment: Second on stable debut last time and now makes classified debut; respected
runners.spotlight: One of two 3yos; back to form on her stable debut when second over C&D (firm; led) two weeks ago; classified debut and likely has more to offer.

runners.name: Top Biller
runners.comment: Romped home at Lingfield last time (6f) and will make them all go if in the same form
runners.spotlight: One of two 3yos; won in first-time blinkers at Wolverhampton (6f) in January when trained by Jamie Osborne; hadn't progressed until he ran out a commanding winner at Lingfield (6f, good to firm; made all) when possibly favoured by the stands' rail eight days ago; eventually picked up a 6lb penalty for that but it was a clear personal best.

quotes.race: Mira Showers Rain Supreme Handicap
quotes.quote: We certainly weren't expecting that. We thought Top Biller would run well as it was a weak race but Dylan gave him a fantastic ride in grabbing the rail. I really think the return to grass has helped as he was probably getting a bit bored of the all-weather - Shelley Birkett, joint-trainer.

6:55.race_name: Hampton By Hilton Bath City Handicap
6:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Our Planet
runners.comment: Well-related 220,000euros yearling; open to improvement now handicapping on turf
runners.spotlight: Well-related 220,000euros yearling who didn't see out 7f in one run last autumn before being gelded; couple of costly Wolverhampton 5f defeats this spring, latterly in the hood (retained), but remains open to improvement now handicapping on turf.

runners.name: Far Above Dream
runners.comment: Better with each start in Ireland this spring as he's dropped in trip; market useful
runners.spotlight: Better with each start in Ireland this spring, as he dropped in trip, and his new trainer's record with new recruits alone entitles him to respect back from two months off; interesting to see how he goes in the market.

runners.name: Cressida Wildes
runners.comment: Behind three of these when fifth at Goodwood two weeks ago; others appeal more for the win
runners.spotlight: Looks thoroughly exposed and she finished behind three of these when fifth at Goodwood two weeks ago; others appeal more for the win; declared 6.55 Bath Friday.

runners.name: Khaldiya
runners.comment: Remains open to improvement now handicapping back from nine months off for powerful yard
runners.spotlight: Two solid efforts in defeat last autumn and showed the right attitude when off the mark on Tapeta latterly; remains open to improvement now handicapping back from nine months off.

runners.name: Rock Hunter
runners.owner: D Macauliffe, A Don & Lds Bloodstock

prev_owners.owner: D Macauliffe, A Don & D De Souza

runners.comment: Not beaten far in a two AW handicaps in the spring (excuses each time); won't mind rain
runners.spotlight: Patchy after a debut win (heavy) last spring and been tried in various forms of headgear; not beaten far in a couple of AW handicaps in the spring, when having excuses each time, and won't mind any rain.

runners.name: Star Chorus
runners.comment: Likely this mark is within range when things fall his way but there are risks involved
runners.spotlight: Often pulled hard on the AW, hence the hood, and has blown the start twice since gelded and returned to turf (just behind Cressida Wildes latest); likely this mark is within range when things fall his way but there are risks involved.

runners.name: Iconic Times
runners.comment: 66-1 for his handicap debut, when said to have hung left and finishing a remote last
runners.spotlight: Made all when winning a weak-looking Polytrack novice last November; 66-1 for his handicap debut four weeks ago, when said to have hung left and offering little promise in finishing a remote last.

runners.name: Kodi Fire
runners.comment: Not without hope on his Kempton comeback; needs more again on just his second turf start
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress last backend and was gelded; not without hope on his Kempton comeback three months ago but needs more again on just his second turf start.

runners.name: Ludos Landing
runners.comment: Placed over C&D two starts ago and is now back on last winning mark; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Overall record is 5-38; best turf form on good/firmer; placed in bigger field over C&D two starts ago (reappearance) and is now back on last winning mark; possibilities.

runners.name: Thrilling Dream
runners.comment: Has form figures of 5112 at 1m4f; on career-high mark but may improve further
runners.spotlight: Outstayed over 1m6f when last seen seven months ago; has form figures of 5112 at 1m4f, both wins on good to firm; on career-high mark but may improve further over this trip.

runners.name: Lightening Company
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Cxv & C Barclay

prev_owners.owner: Mpr Cxv, Yorkshire Puddings & C Barclay

runners.comment: Hasn't won on Flat for over two years but ran encouragingly at York last time
runners.spotlight: Overall record (Flat/hurdles) is 4-30; hasn't won under this code for over two years but ran encouragingly in deeper field at York (1m4f) most recently; on an attractive mark.

runners.name: Lone Piper
runners.comment: Low-mileage 4yo; interesting over new trip with Newbury reappearance under his belt
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who ended last season with a success in first-time blinkers (1m2f, good); gives the impression this new trip is worth exploring; interesting with Newbury reappearance under his belt.

runners.name: Kisiyra
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: 0-7 for Johnny Murtagh; sold for 3,000euros since last run; market can guide
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden for Johnny Murtagh; placed twice as a 2yo but looks less solid on last year's form; sold for 3,000euros after final outing; market may prove best guide.

runners.name: Fast Fred
runners.comment: Completed a hat-trick last autumn; largely consistent since; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Completed a Class 6 middle-distance hat-trick (soft/AW) last autumn; largely consistent since and made the frame in this grade at Hamilton (1m5f, good) most recently; solid chance.

1:15.race_name: Thomas Lord Restaurant A View To Dine For Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C/D) (GBB) (Div I)

runners.name: Believe In Lies
runners.comment: Respectable effort on recent belated debut and the step up in trip could be a plus
runners.spotlight: It's possible she was flattered by her proximity when last of four at 18-1 on her recent belated debut at Pontefract (5f, good to firm); however, on face value it was a respectable performance behind rivals who had shown promise previously, and the step up in trip looks a plus on breeding.

runners.name: Noble Testimony
runners.comment: Runner-up on AW on his first three starts and there's every chance he'll be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Vulnerable if bumping into anything useful and he may not be entirely straightforward, but he finished second in February/March on his first three starts (7f/1m, AW) and there's every chance he'll be in the mix.

runners.name: Blunder
runners.comment: 2,000gns yearling; dam unplaced 1m 2yo; doesn't have overly compelling claims on debut
runners.spotlight: 2,000gns yearling; fourth foal; dam unplaced 1m 2yo (RPR 65), closely related to 1m5f Group 3 winner Mr Singh, out of Group-placed 6f/1m 2yo winner; this Oasis Dream newcomer doesn't have overly compelling claims on paper.

runners.name: Brave Guest
runners.comment: Well beaten at 40-1 on debut at Leicester only on Tuesday and he's hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Dam 6f AW winner (RPR 75), half-sister to several winners; well beaten at 40-1 on debut at Leicester (1m, good to firm) only on Tuesday and he's hard to fancy just three days on.

runners.name: Tatanka
runners.comment: A market move would be interesting on debut but this Postponed newcomer may want further
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam 1m/1m2f winner (RPR 82) for yard, from talented family; a market move would be interesting on debut but this Postponed gelding may be of greater interest when tackling further.

runners.name: The Doonan
runners.comment: Â£18,000 2yo breeze-ups; the betting could be informative regarding this newcomer
runners.spotlight: 15,000euros yearling, Â£18,000 2yo breeze-ups; fourth foal; dam unplaced 7f AW (RPR 44), from useful family; stable is among the winners and the betting could be informative regarding this Kuroshio newcomer.

runners.name: Water Tiger
runners.comment: 5,000gns 2yo; check the betting on debut but he may be one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: 5,000gns 2yo; fifth foal; Mayson half-brother to 5f 2yo winner Sagittarius (RPR 77); dam 6f AW 2yo winner (74), closely related to 5.7f-1m winner Cryptonite out of Listed-placed 5f/6f winner; check the betting on debut but he may be one for further down the line.

runners.name: Call Me Betty
runners.comment: There's potential in her pedigree but she needs a sizeable step forward from debut seventh
runners.spotlight: There's potential in her pedigree and she could be sharper for last month's debut seventh at Redcar (6f, good to firm), but a sizeable step forward is needed if she's to make an impact today.

runners.name: Lady Sonata
runners.comment: Her dam was useful but she was well beaten at 50-1 on last month's debut at Newcastle
runners.spotlight: Her dam was useful and it's very early days, but she was well beaten at 50-1 on last month's debut at Newcastle (7f, AW).

runners.name: Fasnelli
runners.comment: Down the field at big odds on both starts and she needs to be a different proposition
runners.spotlight: Down the field at big odds on both starts (7.4f/7f, good/good to firm) and she needs to be a different proposition today.

runners.name: In A Hurry
runners.comment: Runner-up on three of her four starts; a leading form contender in today's line-up
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on first two starts (7f/1m, AW/good) and bounced back from Lingfield flop (1m1f, good to firm; failed to settle) when second in a first-time hood (retained) at Beverley (7.4f, good) nine days ago; she's a leading form contender in today's line-up.

4:55.race_name: Next Meeting 17th June Featuring Royal Ascot Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Two Shoes
runners.comment: Has to prove she's worth her mark but this is weaker than previous handicap assignments
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut at Carlisle last June (5f, good to firm); highly tried on her second start and came up short; neither handicap run has suggested that she was ahead of her mark but this is a marked drop in grade.

quotes.race: Alan Jennings Last Orders Memorial Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B/C/D) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Two Shoes started nicely. She looked a bit green but once she got organised, she's really come home well. She's not fully wound up and will improve, and she'll probably get another furlong - Steve Charlton, husband of Julie Camacho.

runners.name: Maddelina
runners.comment: Game winner of a 5f novice on her return 2 weeks ago; unexposed and return to 6f a plus
runners.spotlight: Confirmed the promise of her sole 2yo run (6f, soft) when winning a 5f fillies' novice at Pontefract on her reappearance two weeks ago; won that race in spite of the drop in trip, rather than because of it, and she moves into handicaps with some potential.

runners.name: Medinilla
runners.comment: Cosy win on handicap debut/reappearance last month (6f, AW); up 5lb but far from exposed
runners.spotlight: Strong at the finish when winning a Ripon maiden last September (6f, soft); returned from a 233-day layoff to win a Wolverhampton handicap in good style 18 days ago; 5lb rise may not have got to the bottom of her.

quotes.race: Theakstons Best EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I liked Medinilla the first time and she's come on a tremendous amount at home. If she handled the track I was fairly confident she'd run well. If you hit one ridge here, you hit all of them. We didn't get into the flow until the last furlong, so you can only be pleased. They've done well to nurture her to this point as next year is when she'll flourish - Jack Channon, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She won very well the other day at Ripon over 6f and we were happy that she managed to score on only her second start. We might look at one more race for her before we wrap her up and she'll be a nice filly next year. 10-10-24

runners.name: Lorna B
runners.comment: Latest run far better than the result suggests; 1-1 over 6f; not fully exposed
runners.spotlight: Down the field in a Doncaster maiden (7f, soft) on her sole 2yo start; returned to action to spring a 28-1 surprise at Newcastle (6f) in March and she was in the process of showing that was no fluke when chopped off against the rail when making her challenge back at Newcastle last month (7f); not fully exposed and she's considered.

runners.name: Haazeez
runners.comment: Faced some smart rivals as a 2yo; cheekpieces enlisted for handicap debut; could revive
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress last season, albeit his Ayr and Yarmouth defeats at short prices look better now than at the time; down the field on his Kempton return in April; cheekpieces fitted for handicap debut and a revival isn't out of the question.

runners.name: Mayberry Moon
runners.comment: Debut win last June (6f, soft) but failed to beat a rival in two starts since; vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Overcame his inexperience to make a winning debut at Carlisle last June (6f, soft); failed to beat a rival in two runs since, last of five on his return last month, and moves into handicaps with a point to prove.

quotes.race: Download The Rhino Bet App Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses in Band D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mayberry Moon had been showing all the right signs at home and our two-year-olds this season are fairly forward to what they normally are. Today he jumped, travelled well and, if you could crab him, he just got a bit lonely in front. He took a fair bit of pulling up and hopefully can build on today - Connor Beasley, jockey, speaking on Racing Tv.

runners.name: Commander Atkinson
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd & Joseph Bell
runners.comment: Claimed for Â£6,000 after latest Beverley third; new yard quick to try 6f; dangerous mark
runners.spotlight: 0-8 for Geoff Oldroyd but placed in his first two handicaps last autumn (5f); disappointing since, including dropped into a seller at Beverley last month (subsequently claimed for Â£6,000 by new connections); worth another crack at 6f and he's on a dangerous mark.

runners.name: Lunar Force
runners.comment: Consistent maiden but she returns to 6f in a competitive race
runners.spotlight: Consistent maiden but latest run wasn't her best and she returns to 6f in a competitive race; others look open to greater progress.

runners.name: Marry The Night
runners.comment: Twice a runner-up last year; can build on his reappearance but he needs to
runners.spotlight: Best form last year when close second at Carlisle (6f, soft) and Chester (7f, good to soft) in September; should build on his reappearance effort but he'll be found easier openings than this.

3:40.race_name: Stirrup Room Delicious Deli-Box Dining Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Annie Edson Taylor
runners.comment: Not beaten far at Carlisle last week but more needed back at 5f with cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Second run for new yard was better than her first and dropping back to 5f can help; due to be 2lb lower from the weekend and the new cheekpieces need to give her a lift.

runners.name: Miss Brazen
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mr A A Byrne
runners.owner: W H & Mrs J A Tinning & Mrs C Wallis

prev_owners.owner: D & R Chapman, W&j Tinning & C Wallis

runners.comment: C&D winner but on a losing run; sharper for last month's return and not ruled out
runners.spotlight: C&D winner but losing run stretches back over two years; dropped a long way in the weights and she should be sharper with last month's reappearance behind her.

runners.name: Larchill Lass
runners.comment: Infrequent winner who was beaten in a seller last month; others stronger for win purposes
runners.spotlight: Just one win to her name from 14 attempts; beaten favourite when dropped to a seller at Beverley last month and dropped away in a 6f handicap at Hamilton last week; return to 5f a plus but others appeal more.

runners.name: Over Spiced
runners.comment: Chasing a hat-trick after front-running wins at Chepstow and Lingfield; rain a query
runners.spotlight: Coaxed back to form by her new yard, winning 5f handicaps at Chepstow and Lingfield on her last two starts; has a penalty to shoulder in her hat-trick bid but she's effectively only 3lb higher than last week; high on the list provided the ground is suitable (unraced on slower than good).

runners.name: Opal Storm
runners.comment: Capable off this mark and she should get a good pace to aim at this time; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Hold-up mare who has more ability than her mark but who does need things to pan out ideally; that happened at Carlisle last month but she couldn't land a blow at Beverley on Monday when sent off favourite; this should be well run and she holds each-way claims.

quotes.race: Rob Burrow Dare To Dream Handicap
quotes.quote: Opal Storm likes the place but she just needs a bit of luck in running - Brian Rothwell, trainer.

runners.name: Genius Mistake
runners.comment: 0-6 but has shown some ability; not obviously thrown in for handicap debut though
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but placed in four of those runs; hard to say she was thrown in for this handicap debut, however, and others appeal more; stable also responsible for Marajito.

runners.name: Marajito
runners.comment: Picked off close home on recent handicap debut (5f, AW); 3lb well in; other pace on show
runners.spotlight: Made a bold bid from the front at Southwell on her handicap debut last Saturday, picked off close home (front two clear); 3lb ahead of the handicapper but there is other pace to contend with in today's field.

runners.name: Jeany May
runners.comment: Good run at Redcar 11 days ago & she's high on the list off the same mark; rain no problem
runners.spotlight: Her win came on soft ground but she seems versatile, running well at Redcar 11 days ago on good to firm; made the running there but doesn't have to lead and she's of interest off the same mark.

runners.name: Doralee
runners.comment: Has shown promise but she needs to raise her game if she's to come out on top here
runners.spotlight: Promise as a 3yo and beaten under 2l on her return to action at Redcar five weeks ago; still has time to do better but such progress is a must.

3:00.race_name: Saddle Room Deliciously Casual Cafe Dining Handicap

runners.name: Canons House
runners.owner: M Mchale, J Munroe, M Guy & D Walshe

prev_owners.owner: M McHale And J Munroe Racing

runners.comment: Bolted up at Carlisle on seasonal return (5f, good to soft); 7lb well in; obvious claims
runners.spotlight: Didn't deliver on early promise in three handicap runs last year; absent for seven months prior to last week's return to action at Carlisle (5f, good to soft) where he delivered an emphatic front-running performance to win by an eased-down 6l; 7lb well in under a penalty and the return to 6f won't be a problem; obvious claims.

quotes.race: Andersons - Quality For The Home Handicap
quotes.quote: Canon's House showed plenty last year but things just didn't work out towards the back end. He's been in good form and this race has been the target. Hopefully he'll pick up another couple - Billy Garritty, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Sugar Baby
runners.owner: Hard Held Partnership And Angus Racing

prev_owners.owner: Angus Racing Club & P D Niven

runners.comment: Multiple 5f winner who went close on his first attempt at 6f last month; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Two 5f wins this year and he made a good fist of it on his first attempt at 6f when beaten under one length at Redcar 18 days ago; another 2lb higher as a result but not discounted.

runners.name: Yazaman

prev_owners.owner: A Rhodes, M Short & E Twibell
A Rhodes, M Short & R Swift
J C G Chua And Partner

runners.comment: Reeled off a 4-timer last summer; not so good in 2025 and he'll be 3lb lower from Saturday
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed a fine time of it in the middle of last year, completing a four-timer over 5f/5.5f on ground ranging from good to firm to soft; not in quite the same form this year and he's due to be 3lb lower from the weekend.

quotes.race: Tattersalls July Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Yazaman ran differently to Ascot in that he jumped and travelled really well over the extra furlong, while he was a bit outpaced at Ascot. I think the winner is pretty good and we were beaten by a better horse. To give our horse some credit I don't think he saw the winner coming as he was a long way from him. He's grown up a lot since his debut and he's a grand horse, but he's an out and out two-year-old so we need to get on with him and make use of him. He didn't mind the ground today - Maureen Haggas, wife of William Haggas, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'd be a lovely person, absolute class, but he's a character, shall we say. He was a really good two-year-old when he was runner-up in the Richmond Stakes for William Haggas, but maybe he overachieved at two as quite a few of them do. He was one of those where we probably bought him at the right time as his rating was down into the 60s. He was running well without doing an awful lot, but when he got down to a mark of 50 he started winning. We put a visor on and it helped a bit, but it wasn't until he got the blinkers on that things started to happen. Even the first day he won at Nottingham, I still maintain that if he hadn't got a bump near the finish, he'd have finished second; he got a bump and seemed to take off and won really well. He then went to Beverley and had a bit of a troubled passage but got to the front and was well on top at the finish. When he went to Wetherby for his third success, the ground was plenty quick enough for him and the race didn't go as smoothly as we'd have liked, but he still won, whiwas fair play to him. He's got his confidence back and remembered how to win. If he wants to win again, he's still a long way ahead of the handicapper. He's entered at Leicester on Thursday but I'd be amazed if he runs as it looks like it's going to be a dry week. 28-06-24

runners.name: Roundhay Park

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mr J D Gordon

runners.comment: Solid effort latest but in a veterans' race; down in class but others are more persuasive
runners.spotlight: On a losing run and his latest third at Catterick came in a veterans' race; drops into a Class 6 but others are preferred for win purposes.

quotes.race: William Hill Silver Trophy Handicap
quotes.quote: I was a bit shocked, but Roundhay Park does turn up every time and tries his heart out. It's lovely getting on such genuine horses. I was doing a rain dance last night as he does like it with a bit of soft in the ground. He's so genuine and kept on finding - Faye McManoman, jockey.

quotes.race: QTS Ayr Bronze Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Roundhay Park was very relaxed today. He sometimes gets wound up but he came up yesterday and he's been very relaxed. He was given a great ride by Faye as there was no panic and no rush - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK Novice Auction Stakes (Div II)
quotes.quote: Roundhay Park was a bit buzzy so I'll give him a bit of a break now - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse and has been a great servant for the yard. He was second in the Shergar Cup Sprint Cup years back under Hayley Turner and was a top-class handicapper in his heyday. He finished last of 11 at York on Friday and hasn't shown it in his last two starts but the handicapper has just got him high enough. He's a little bit older now and we could do with a bit of help from the handicapper. 27-07-22

runners.name: Captain Vallo
runners.comment: Comes here in good form and effective over C&D; slower than good may be an issue
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins over the winter and he has been banging at the door back on turf, including two placed efforts over C&D; ground slower than good would be a worry though.

runners.name: Bulmer Bank
runners.owner: David Scott And Co Ltd & Partner

prev_owners.owner: David Scott and Co (Pattern Makers) Ltd

runners.comment: Yet to fire this year and now drops in trip with a visor fitted; stable run two
