runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden; in good form last summer but he failed to fire at Catterick last August and he hasn't threatened in two 1m handicaps this year; dangerous mark if the drop in trip and fitting of a visor perks him up; stable also run Canon's House.

runners.name: Emerald Army
runners.comment: C&D win on return in April; run well in defeat over 7f since; likely has more to offer
runners.spotlight: Strong at the finish when winning a C&D handicap in April on his return to action (6f, good); two good runs over 7f have followed and a well-run race back at this trip could spark another jolt of progress; perhaps a slight query if the ground worsens significantly but otherwise he looks to have a lot to recommend him.

runners.name: Marks Choice
runners.comment: On a long losing run; dangerous mark but not sure he's primed to capitalise
runners.spotlight: Prolific winner down the years, mainly at Ripon, but he hasn't scored since August 2022; showed he retained some ability with a third on AW in December (7f) but last month's Ripon run didn't suggest he was ready to exploit his lowly mark; down in class at least.

quotes.race: William Hill Silver Trophy Handicap (Consolation Race For The William Hill Great St Wilfrid Stakes)
quotes.quote: Mark's Choice's wind was just bothering him and we looked at it last time and got it tightened up again. He's a lovely horse and when he's right, he runs a very good race. He's entered at Ayr and we'll see what the handicapper does - Sam England, trainer.

runners.name: Stormy Pearl
runners.comment: Effective over C&D and on a good mark; the more rain to fall the better
runners.spotlight: Placed twice over C&D last spring on slow ground; she's back down to a good mark and her reappearance was promising but she didn't match it at Nottingham four weeks ago (5f, good); the more rain to fall the better and she's a possible.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a lot closer than I originally thought, but at least we can call Stormy Pearl a winner again, which is great. I couldn't see anything between them in the photo but if she had kept a little bit straighter she may have been a clear winner, but that's racing and it was great to see her run so well. She's a lovely filly who's usually consistent and seems to really like the place. We'll be back this season we hope, don't you worry about that! - David Thompson, trainer.

runners.name: Tickets
runners.comment: Exploited lower turf mark at Redcar in April; still well weighted if the going is suitable
runners.spotlight: Made it three wins from his last ten runs when exploiting his lower turf mark at Redcar (6f, good to firm) in April; still feasibly weighted up 4lb but he would have more to prove if the going deteriorated.

stable_tour.quote: He is a lovely young horse who runs in the well-known green colours of John Fretwell. He has only raced four times in his life, winning his penultimate start at Kempton. I thought his most recent run, when second in his first handicap was a lovely effort and hopefully we can get him out on the turf before the season ends, but he needs it on the soft side. He will continue through the winter on the all-weather as he is still progressing, and we can up him to 1m when the time is right. He is on a fair mark of 77 and I would be disappointed if he was not a nice bit better than that. 29-08-22

runners.name: Brazen Rascal
runners.comment: Ten-race maiden; hopes appear to rest on the drop to sprinting sparking improvement
runners.spotlight: Ten runs, all over further, and yet to reach the frame; market springer on his reappearance at Doncaster (7f, good to firm) but ended up well beaten; the drop to sprinting needs to spark extra.

runners.name: Thunderstorm Katie
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P & J Hopper, Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: 11-race maiden but she has shown promise and could yet have a bigger run in her
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden but there has been the odd flicker of promise on both turf and AW; could yet have a bigger effort in her.

runners.name: Golden Prosperity
runners.comment: Two 5f wins to his name but yet to catch light this year and 6f stretches him
runners.spotlight: Two 5f wins on his record but yet to find his best form this year and perhaps vulnerable to stronger finishers.

2:25.race_name: Hambleton Room Delicious Dining "A La Carte" Handicap

runners.name: Dandy Fitz
runners.comment: In good form on AW at the end of his 3yo campaign; should be sharper for recent return
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 in good form on AW, including a 5f win at Southwell off an 8lb lower mark; last of six at Catterick on his reappearance 13 days ago but should be sharper with that behind him.

runners.name: Fortunate Star
runners.comment: Three wins last year; comes here in form and a key player if stall 1 proves no hindrance
runners.spotlight: Won three times in 2024 and he has run three creditable races since returned to turf this spring; stall 1 a potential stumbling block with the best pace looking high but he's got good claims if there's no draw bias.

runners.name: Guy Fawkes
runners.comment: Found life tough in handicaps; down in the weights but others look stronger
runners.spotlight: Made a winning racecourse debut in November 2023; he has found life tougher in handicaps, including four runs for new yard in 2025; latest effort was slightly better but others appeal more.

runners.name: Latin Five
runners.comment: AW win in February and he's held his form since; each-way claims once more
runners.spotlight: Returned from wind surgery to win a 5f handicap at Newcastle in February; several solid efforts in defeat since, including a fourth of 15 at Catterick last month, and he's run well over C&D in the past; each-way shout.

quotes.race: Killashee Hotel Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Latin Five is a horse we thought might win his maiden, but this was the first time he really raced professionally. He loved the stiff six and should go the seven at some stage. We'll see what the handicapper does - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

runners.name: Banana

prev_owners.owner: Scott Dixon Racing , M Mahony , L Bond

runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but comes here in peak form; slower than good would be a query
runners.spotlight: Took an age to get off the mark but she has followed her Bath success last month with two near misses at Bath and Nottingham; handles good ground but untried on slower; chance if conditions are suitable.

runners.name: Ninety Nine
runners.comment: Chance on her 2024 best but well held on her return and she's not a solid option
runners.spotlight: Sprung a 28-1 surprise at Catterick last October (5f, soft; cheekpieces first time) when making all; also ran well on AW the following month but her two runs since have resulted in heavy defeats; risky.

runners.name: Better

prev_owners.owner: D Mann, Mrs C Hopper & G Shields

runners.comment: Fair run over 6f here last month but less good at Ripon last week (slowly away)
runners.spotlight: Didn't run badly over 6f here last month but he blew the start and was well beaten at Ripon last week; cheekpieces now given a go.

runners.name: John Kirkup
runners.comment: On a losing run and failed to fire over 6f here last month; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: 10yo who is without a win since October 2023; ran okay twice at Redcar this spring but he wasn't at the same level over 6f here three weeks ago; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Sam Hall Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: John Kirkup was due a win as he's been unlucky all season. He got his ground and he always shows his best - David Thompson, trainer.

quotes.race: Visit goracinginyorkshire.com Handicap
quotes.quote: John Kirkup loves these conditions and it was a good idea to drop him back to five furlongs on this stiff track. He travelled into it well and got the splits at the right time - Connor Beasley, rider.

quotes.race: Tomrods Steel Stockholders Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: John Kirkup could be one for the Two-Year-Old Trophy at Redcar and he's likely to run in another nursery before then. He can go over five or six furlongs but wants give in the ground - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Edmundson Cabletech Carlisle Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: John Kirkup got shuffled back and to finish like he has is a fair effort particularly with his penalty. He won't run without a bit of cut in the ground - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK In HD Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: John Kirkup ran with the choke out first time at Ayr and we've brought him back to a stiff five furlongs and got him behind horses and he's dropped his head. He's quite a nice horse and has done it nicely on ground he has enjoyed - Michael Dods, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Another old warrior with a decent wins to runs ratio and he goes particularly well for Connor Beasley. The thing with John is that you can not have the ground soft enough for him. We took a gamble running him at Ayr last month as the rains were forecast, thankfully it arrived and he won for the eighth time. However, last time out at Thirsk it was good ground which is too quick for him. 10-08-21

runners.name: Fumbleinthejungle
runners.comment: Hard to recommend on this year's efforts after a mammoth absence; new headgear today
runners.spotlight: Hasn't beaten many home in three runs after a mammoth absence; a visor is now reached for.

runners.name: Miss Rainbow
runners.comment: 20-race maiden; not at best last week and connections now reach for a visor
runners.spotlight: 20-race maiden; failed to back up her Redcar reappearance at Ripon last week; a visor is now given a go.

stable_tour.quote: She wants bottomless ground but hasn't really had it since her first run last year at Catterick, where she was third. She's going really well at home and I'm just keeping her ticking over. She was entered at Thirsk last Saturday but the ground wasn't right for her. 21-05-25

1:50.race_name: Thomas Lord Restaurant A View To Dine For Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C/D) (GBB) (Div II)

runners.name: Blackanddeckers
runners.comment: 50-1, green and well beaten on belated debut last week; best watched
runners.spotlight: 50-1, slowly away and badly in need of the experience on last week's belated debut; needs to have learned quickly.

runners.name: Contest
runners.comment: 12,000gns yearling; dam a minor AW winner; likely best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: 12,000gns yearling; first foal of a 1m AW winner (RPR 62); fair standard to aim at on debut and likely best watched.

runners.name: Gonnae No Dae That
runners.comment: 80-1 when tailed off at Doncaster five weeks ago (7f, good to firm); hard to recommend
runners.spotlight: 80-1 when tailed off at Doncaster five weeks ago (7f, good to firm); hard to recommend.

runners.name: Magic Boy
runners.comment: 15,000gns 2yo; dam from a good French middle-distance family; probably best watched
runners.spotlight: 55,000euros yearling, 15,000gns 2yo; by Acclamation; dam unraced half-sister to useful French 1m4f winner Mystic Sunshine; withdrawn ahead of his intended debut last September after getting upset at the stalls.

runners.name: Patricia R
runners.comment: Related to a couple of fair winners; betting to guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; closely related to 7f AW winner Initio (RPR 78), half-sister to 5f winner Joshua R (79); dam 6f AW 2yo winner (82); enough paper appeal to warrant a market check.

runners.name: Velvet Whisper
runners.owner: C Wright, D Kilburn, A Dick And P Snook
runners.comment: Not built on debut effort yet but recent return (6f) was eyecatching; can do better
runners.spotlight: Yet to build on her promising debut (7f, AW) last October but she was an eyecatcher dropped to 6f on her seasonal return 11 days ago, finishing her race with running left in her; solid contender back up in trip.

runners.name: Hallucinate
runners.comment: 4,000gns half-sister to useful Evocative Spark (RPR 97); perhaps a longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: 4,000gns yearling; half-sister to 6f-7.4f winner Evocative Spark (RPR 97); dam placed 7f AW 2yo (75); stable's newcomers often better for a run.

runners.name: Latynina
runners.comment: Favourite for recent Carlisle debut but shaped well amidst inexperience; can do better
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred filly and she made a promising start when keeping on for fourth at Carlisle (7f, good to firm) 18 days ago; well backed there so a big run was expected but she looked green and can take a good step forward; more appealing than most.

runners.name: Our Nicola
runners.comment: 66-1 and always in rear on Redcar debut five weeks ago (6f); major progress required
runners.spotlight: 66-1 and always in rear on her Redcar debut five weeks ago (6f, good to firm); major progress required.

runners.name: Summerstorms Dream
runners.comment: Unable to land a blow on her Ayr debut last month (6f); big step forward required
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a blow on her Ayr debut last month (6f, good to firm); big step forward required.

5:30.race_name: Next Meeting 17th June Featuring Royal Ascot Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Beaujolais Nouveau
runners.comment: Class 3 too hot latest but earlier Ripon third was positive; not fully exposed at 6f
runners.spotlight: 5f maiden win at Beverley last September; went close on seasonal/handicap debut at Ripon last month (6f, good) but couldn't cope with the rise in class at the same track 19 days ago; could rate higher at this trip.

runners.name: Ann Terry
runners.comment: Easy win in 3-runner race on heavy when last seen; more on her plate now handicapping
runners.spotlight: She had shown promise on her first four starts so a wide-margin win in a three-runner heavy-ground fillies' novice at Leicester when last seen wasn't a bolt from the blue; whether she's well treated for her handicap debut remains to be seen.

runners.name: Chuti Manika
runners.comment: Ran well on reappearance but stopped quickly at Doncaster five weeks ago; needs a revival
runners.spotlight: Finished just in front of the reopposing Beaujolais Nouveau at Ripon on her return in April; stopped quickly at Doncaster five weeks ago, however, and needs to bounce back to his best.

quotes.race: Bradford Club Optimists' Corner Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Chuti Manika's first run, he got a bit lonely out in front and got caught close home. He was very professional through the race today - Charlie Johnston, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Miss Hathaway
runners.comment: Stiff task at York last time and better judged on her earlier 6f win at Pontefract
runners.spotlight: 0-9 as a 2yo but had some fair form; made a winning reappearance with her front-running success at Pontefract in April (6f, good); stiff task at York (7f) latest and this should be more manageable.

runners.name: Monetize
runners.comment: Form of latest Ripon second has taken some knocks; more required back in a handicap
runners.spotlight: Tailed off on her reappearance/handicap debut at Beverley (5f, good to firm); better effort when keeping on for second of six at Ripon last month but that form has taken some knocks and she's been raised 2lb to boot.

runners.name: Arabian Cobra
runners.comment: Career best when short-head 2nd at Hamilton last week (first two clear); 5lb well in
runners.spotlight: Now 0-13 but he ran a cracker back on turf at Hamilton nine days ago, pulling clear with the winner and only going down by a short head; turned out before a 5lb rise has time to take effect and he's a strong candidate.

runners.name: Blue Seeker
runners.comment: 7f AW win for former yard; sold 23,000gns last month and given wind surgery; check market
runners.spotlight: Easy win in a 7f nursery at Wolverhampton on Boxing Day; that wasn't the springboard to better things that it promised but he has been placed on his last three runs (7f-8.6f); sold for 23,000gns last month and given a wind op; drop to sprinting could work as he's often raced enthusiastically.

runners.name: Laurens Dream
runners.comment: Two AW wins last November; struggled more recently and others look safer
runners.spotlight: Won twice on AW last November (7f and 6f); now 2lb lower than for the second win but that is a result of some lesser efforts; others look safer in this field.

runners.name: Azuinthejungle
runners.owner: D P Van Der Hoeven & D G Pryde
runners.comment: 0-10; three sound efforts this year but more minor money perhaps his best hope
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden; in the money in three of his four runs this year but perhaps another minor placing will be his best hope.

runners.name: Barrow Ranger
runners.comment: Beaten 16l at Bellewstown; should have improved from that and get closer today
runners.spotlight: Not a lot of promise in two points starts but much better on hurdles debut when beaten 16l at Bellewstown; should have improved from that and get closer today.

runners.name: Beale Street Blues
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in a 1m2f Flat maiden on sole start in UK; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in a 1m2f Flat maiden on sole start in UK; can only be watched on stable/hurdles debut.

runners.name: Jenvoievalserenki
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras D'Enkie
runners.comment: Best run on soft ground at Punchestown in January; needs a return to that form; blinkers
runners.spotlight: The best of four maiden hurdle runs was on soft ground at Punchestown in January; needs a return to that form and blinkers might help.

runners.name: Lucky This Time
runners.comment: Hasn't shown enough in his three previous hurdle runs to be of interest
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown enough in his three previous hurdle runs to be of interest; handicaps will suit better.

runners.name: Maxicourt
runners.comment: Well-bred sort cost 15,000euros as a 3yo; worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: Twelfth foal; half-brother to seven winners inc Kikonga (1m-1m4f inc 2yo; RPR 98) and Light Speed (7f-1m2f inc AW; 93); dam 11.4f winner (84), sister to St Leger winner Milan; well-bred sort cost 15,000euros as a 3yo; worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: Memories Maker
runners.breeder: Genesis Green Stud & Mr P Scott
runners.comment: Just behind Barrow Ranger in a Bellewstown maiden hurdle last time; needs more
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; maiden ran well enough in five Flat starts for Charlie Johnston in 2024; just behind Barrow Ranger in a Bellewstown maiden hurdle last time; needs more.

runners.name: Power Of Words
runners.comment: Chance if back to the form of debut in a Fairyhouse maiden hurdle; poor in a bumper since
runners.spotlight: A fine effort on debut in a Fairyhouse maiden hurdle (solid form) on soft but was disappointing in a Killarney bumper since; has a chance if getting back to that debut level.

runners.name: Synchronize
runners.comment: Fourth in Killarney mdn hdle last month; not so good on the Flat (soft) since; run well
runners.spotlight: A 700,000Gns yearling was later resold for 2,500Gns; modest Flat maiden but ran a solid race on second hurdle start when fourth at Killarney last month; not so good on the Flat (soft) since but can run well as long as the ground stays decent.

runners.name: Tassarolo
runners.comment: Was 3.75l in front of Yosemite Gold at Cork so should confirm that form; cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Looks to be the stable's first-string; modest enough Flat maiden; the best of two maiden hurdle runs at Cork was last time when only beaten 2l; was 3.75l in front of Yosemite Gold that day and should confirm that form; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Temple City
runners.comment: Well behind his stablemate Tassarolo at Cork last time and handicaps look a better option
runners.spotlight: Was well behind his stablemate Tassarolo at Cork last time and handicaps look a better option.

runners.name: Tommy Go Maith
runners.comment: One to watch for future reference unless market support
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam placed 5f/6f (RPR 51), half-sister to 7f/7.4f Group 3 winner Realtra, out of 7f 2yo winning half-sister to numerous winners inc Solid Approach (HK 1m4f Listed); unsold for E7,800 as a 2yo; one to watch for future reference unless market support.

runners.name: Yosemite Gold
runners.comment: Some decent hurdle runs but has 3.75l to make up on Tassarolo from Cork last time
runners.spotlight: Some respectable Flat runs without winning in four starts in UK; the best of his four maiden hurdle runs came on last twice but has 3.75l to make up on Tassarolo from Cork last time.

runners.name: Abel Mabel
runners.comment: Modest Flat maiden can only be watched on hurdles debut after a year away
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden can only be watched on hurdles debut after a year away.

runners.name: Bhean Saibhre
runners.comment: Fourth in a Ballinrobe maiden last time; can be involved if backing that up today
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden but has made a better fist of hurdling, putting in an improved effort when fourth in a Ballinrobe maiden last time; can be involved if backing that up today.

runners.name: East Cork Flyer
runners.comment: Beaten 24l in a C&D mares' maiden hurdle on debut last month and has to make huge progress
runners.spotlight: Beaten 24l in a C&D mares' maiden hurdle on debut last month and has to make huge progress.

runners.name: Guided By You
runners.comment: Ran a solid race on debut; needs a fair bit more in this stronger contest but can go well
runners.spotlight: From the family of high-class mare Like-A-Butterfly; was only the owner's third-string on debut at Tipperary but ran a solid race; needs a fair bit more in this stronger contest but can go well.

runners.name: Maybe Someday
runners.comment: By a decent sire and comes from a fine damline but will likely improve from this
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Annacotty (high-class 2m-3m hurdle/chase), Bob Will (2m4f-3m chase) and Silent Cliche (3m chase); by a decent sire and comes from a fine damline but will likely improve from this.

runners.name: Small Bucks
runners.comment: Third in a mares' maiden over C&D last time; needs more in this stronger race; considered
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden ran her best race over hurdles when third in a mares' maiden over C&D last time; needs more in this stronger contest but considered.

runners.name: Little Dimmy
runners.comment: Tailed-off in a Killarney bumper on debut; can only be watched; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; tailed-off in a Killarney bumper on debut after being fractious at the start; can only be watched.

runners.name: Red Sea Girl
runners.comment: Plenty winners in the damline but likely best watched on debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; third foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Political Theatre (2m4f hurdle) and An Marcach (2m4f chase), out of useful 2m-3m hurdle winner Red Square Lady; plenty winners in the damline but likely best watched on debut.

runners.name: Highland Prince
runners.comment: Cost 20,000euros as a yearling; best watched on debut unless market support; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; fourth foal; half-brother to winners Double Down (1m AW; RPR 68) and Master Luke (Czech/Slovakian/Polish 1m3f-16.4f); dam placed 1m-1m2f (inc AW; 78), half-sister to 1m4f Group 1 winner and top NH sire Doctor Dino; cost 20,000euros as a yearling; best watched on debut unless market support

runners.name: Granpa Ger
runners.comment: Maiden was not so good over fences the last twice but has a shout back hurdling
runners.spotlight: Maiden has run well several times in defeat including at this track; not so good over fences the last twice but has a shout back hurdling.

runners.name: Midnight Eagle
runners.comment: Off the mark over hurdles at Limerick but poor in two chases since; chance back hurdling
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over hurdles at Limerick in April but was poor in two chases since; 7lb higher back over hurdles but has to be respected.

runners.name: Only A Dollar
runners.comment: C&D winner; third at Wexford last time; a chance if squeezing out a bit more
runners.spotlight: Won a C&D maiden hurdle last year; best effort since was when third at Wexford last time; a chance if squeezing out a bit more from the same mark.

runners.name: Ricky Langford
runners.comment: Beaten approx' 3l on last hurdles start at Thurles back in March; go well with a repeat
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner between hurdles and fences; only beaten approx' 3l on last hurdles start at Thurles back in March and a repeat of that will see him competitive.

quotes.race: Daily Jackpots At BoyleSports Vegas Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Ricky Langford wants good ground. He has a similar mark over fences and he could go for a handicap chase before the summer is out - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.name: Shaboozee
runners.comment: Probably didn't stay 2m3f at Kilbeggan last time; one to consider on handicap bow
runners.spotlight: The best of four maiden hurdle runs was when fourth at Bellewstown; probably didn't stay 2m3f at Kilbeggan last time; one to consider on handicap bow.

runners.name: Voice Of Reason
runners.comment: Won a claimer over 2m3f at this track last time; raised 5lb so needs more back in a h'cap
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark over hurdles when winning a claimer over 2m3f at this track last time; raised 5lb so needs more back in a handicap; new yard.

runners.name: Mega Speculator
runners.comment: Well below best over further at this track the last twice; has to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Best hurdle run when fifth in a 2m Thurles maiden in March; well below that level over further at this track twice since; has to bounce back.

runners.name: Smallcraftwarning
runners.comment: Not bad chase runs lately and should be competitive off this mark back hurdling
runners.spotlight: Sole win over hurdles came on soft ground at Thurles last year; not bad chase runs for this yard lately and should be competitive off this mark back hurdling.

runners.name: Onebrightbluerose
runners.comment: An 8lb rise for Wexford win but has been competitive off similar marks in the past
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come at Wexford around this trip, the latest nine days ago when well-backed; has to cope with an 8lb rise but has been competitive off similar marks in the past.

runners.name: Arthurs Victory
runners.comment: Was well beaten on last run in this sphere; needs her best; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner is yet to score over hurdles in 12 starts and was well beaten on last run in this sphere; needs her best; tongue-tie on.

runners.name: Lady Leanora

prev_owners.owner: Ms Noreen Maher/Jason Behan/Tadhg P Behan/James Cafferty

runners.comment: Hasn't shown enough in five hurdle runs to be interested in; hood on
runners.spotlight: Flat winner for Dermot Weld but hasn't shown enough in five hurdle runs to be interested in; hood on for second start for this yard.

quotes.race: Download The BoyleSports App Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Lady Leonora is still a bit green and a big baby and there should be plenty of improvement. There could be another day in her - Jamie Powell, rider

runners.name: Corkbeg
runners.comment: Mixing hurdles and fences since 2023; needs to get back to form back from a lay-off
runners.spotlight: One of his two hurdle wins came over 2m4f at this track in 2022; mixing hurdles and fences since 2023; needs to get back to form back from a lay-off.

quotes.race: Sulzer Wexford Celebrating 50 Years In Business Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Corkbeg has come back a bit better and stronger. He was nice and fresh today but I didn't think the trip would suit him - Denis O'Regan, rider

quotes.race: ClonmelRaces.ie Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: We gave Corkbeg a couple of runs and he was a bit novicey. We were wondering if we would stop or if we would keep going, and that's why we were surprised about the money coming for him - Harry Kelly, trainer.

runners.name: Go Gill Go
runners.comment: Needs to improve plenty from her poor Sligo run last time
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 30 hurdle starts came in a Sligo maiden in 2021; needs to improve plenty from her poor run at the same track last time.

quotes.race: RSS Document Storage Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Go Gill Go ran well at Wexford over too long a trip. She saw it out well today. She will handle better ground and we will try and find a handicap hurdle somewhere - James Grace, trainer.

runners.name: Close Enough
runners.comment: Sole win in 18 hurdle starts came at Limerick over 2m6f in 2023; this trip looks too sharp
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 18 hurdle starts came at Limerick over 2m6f in 2023; this trip looks too sharp.

runners.name: Glaoinn An Airgead
runners.comment: Poor form in points and over hurdles and has to find improvement from somewhere
runners.spotlight: Poor form in points and over hurdles and has to find improvement from somewhere.

runners.name: Midnight Eugene
runners.comment: Best recent run came when beaten 15l at Tramore and needs to do better even down 6lb
runners.spotlight: Best recent run came when beaten 15l at Tramore and needs to do better even down 6lb; poor either side of that.

runners.name: Dontgowithjoe
runners.comment: The best of three maiden hurdle runs was a modest third over C&D; watch  market; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; showed some ability in three Flat maidens without winning; the best of three maiden hurdle runs was a modest third over C&D; watch the market on handicap debut.

runners.name: Guest Star
runners.comment: Ran respectably in a Downpatrick maiden hurdle last time; needs more on h'cap bow; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; AW claimer winner in January ran respectably in a Downpatrick maiden hurdle last time; needs more on handicap bow.

runners.name: Jaadil
runners.comment: Well beaten in three maiden hurdles and has to do more on handicap bow; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; modest Flat sort has been well beaten in three maiden hurdles and has to do more on handicap bow.

runners.name: Jigoro
runners.comment: Smart hurdler ran well in a beginners' chase last time; this looks a good opportunity
runners.spotlight: Smart hurdler was runner-up in a Grade 2 as a novice last year; mixed form since but ran well in a beginners' chase at Limerick last time behind a smart rival; this looks a good opportunity to get back to winning ways reverting to hurdles.

quotes.race: Mervyn Gray Construction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a good performance from Jigoro and we knew he had improved plenty from the first day. Obviously there was a lot of talk about Tom Cooper's horse and I thought it was a good performance. Jack was delighted with him and said he'll stay further. He said a faster gallop would have suited him but he was very happy with the run. He could go for the four-year-old hurdle at Limerick over Christmas - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: His form tailed off a bit in the spring, but he had put up some decent performances before that. He's going novice chasing and could be a dark horse . He's better than you've seen so far. 28-10-24

runners.name: Kaleosun
runners.comment: Lost his form last year and has been poor in two starts for this yard; blinkers tried
runners.spotlight: French bumper and Irish juvenile maiden hurdle winner but lost his form last year for Gordon Elliott and has been poor in two starts for this yard; blinkers tried.

quotes.race: Renvyle House Hotel 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Kaleosun got caught for a bit of speed at Cork. He stays well and I didn't want it to turn into a sprint. He handled the ground very well and stays well - Jack Kennedy, rider

stable_tour.quote: Had a blow coming down to the last at Cork and got tired. He didn't finish out his race but should improve plenty. He could be a Fred Winter horse for down the line. 24-10-23

runners.name: Chinx Of Light
runners.comment: Once useful but has had very little racing in the last three years and is best watched
runners.spotlight: Once useful sort won three times over hurdles in 2021/22 but has had very little racing in the last three years and is best watched.

quotes.race: Support The Irish Injured Jockeys Fund Hurdle
quotes.quote: Chinx Of Light is a pure stayer, he just gallops and needed to stay there. I was delighted to see him tough it out and it was good to see him come through a battle. We might go chasing with him but we'll keep him rolling - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Club Orange Hurdle
quotes.quote: My heart was in my mouth when Chinx Of Light hit the second last. I don't think he ever went as fast to a hurdle in his life. He's a funny sort of a horse, he's very quiet in the stable yard and still has a lot left to develop mentally in his races. He showed a lot of ability there, the way he quickened from the third last to the second last was very impressive - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't taken to chasing the way we wanted - he's a light horse who isn't huge - and we might go back hurdling. He's had a break and could be one for the Pertemps or a big staying handicap hurdle like that. He's got a big engine and gallops all day. 21-11-22

runners.name: Hms Seahorse

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Useful dual-purpose sort but only five runs in last two years; blinkers after an absence
runners.spotlight: Useful dual-purpose sort at his best, winning a Premier Flat handicap and twice over hurdles; however, has had only five runs in last two years; poor when last seen and blinkers go on after an absence.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Ragusa" Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: HMS Seahorse is a right little horse. He was bought for us by Gerry Hogan. He handled the ground well and they can finish spread out like that. He might go for the Galway Hurdle now - James Nolan, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He is an uncomplicated little fellow. He ran very well on his comeback over hurdles when winning at Navan and certainly looks like he is better after being gelded. He will hopefully come on for that run and he has travelled over to Cheltenham before and ran well so we are looking forward to him. He ran very well in the Boodles last year and wasn't beaten far in fourth, and that race has worked out very well with regards to the horses in front of him. He got an extra 4lb on top of his Irish mark which we could have done without, but it is what it is. He is only small but his heart is in the right place so hopefully he will give his owners a good run and day out. 25-02-23

runners.name: Prairie Dancer
runners.comment: Useful sort has been poor over fences the last twice but a shout if getting back to form
runners.spotlight: Useful sort has won nine races in all spheres, including four over hurdles and run well in defeat at this track; however, has been poor over fences the last twice but a shout if getting back to form.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Prairie Dancer pulled himself up a bit in front and I probably got there way too soon. When I really put it to him though he found plenty - Aidan Kelly, rider

quotes.race: Colm White Bookmaker November Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Prairie Dancer loves getting to the front. He was a big outsider, but he was one you could never put a line through. I knew if he put his best foot forward, he had a chance. He had good jumps form in competitive handicaps. I just kept filling him up and he found plenty up the straight. He's really genuine. The last 100 yards they were coming at me strong, but he put his head down and battled - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

quotes.race: Liam Healy Memorial Lartigue Hurdle (Grade B Handicap)
quotes.quote: Prairie Dancer lugged a bit to his right and I didn't want to be fighting him, that forward going rhythm is important to him. He's a hardy horse and once he can get away and you can get a breather into him, he's a hard horse to get past - JJ Slevin, rider.

quotes.race: Sheridan Electric Hurdle
quotes.quote: We thought we'd get the chance to make the running on Prairie Dancer and thankfully it worked out well, he jumped and travelled well and coped well with the ground. He's a grand, straightforward horse - J J Slevin, jockey.

quotes.race: Athlone Handicap
quotes.quote: Prairie Dancer is improving the whole time. This track and front-running suits him, ground doesn't seem to matter and hopefully he can keep going - Shane Crosse, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Lartigue Hurdle at Listowel last season and it was great to see him win the November Handicap at Naas before running well in a Listed race after that. We're going to step him up in distance now over hurdles and go down the staying handicap hurdle route. 27-11-23

runners.name: The Friday Man
runners.comment: Six-time winner well beaten on return at Punchestown but a shout if getting back to form
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; six-time winner including four over hurdles; was well beaten on return at Punchestown in a competitive handicap but has a shout if getting back to form.

quotes.race: Citipost Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Friday Man is only a novice for a little while so we said we'd take our chance. He'll go jumping fences now and he's not a bad horse. He'll be a nice chaser - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilbarry (Ladies Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: The Friday Man really handled the track, he went around those bends immensely. He tried coming up the hill and found plenty - Lisa O'Neill, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a great money-spinner though the summer and has won four times in the space of a few months. He'll go for a Graded novice hurdle at Limerick next. He's progressing with every run. 18-10-22

runners.name: Bower House Boy
runners.comment: Modest form in four points and needs a transformation on rules debut
runners.spotlight: Modest form in four points and needs a transformation on rules debut.

runners.name: Remma
runners.comment: Fell in a point and tailed-off in a bumper; way out of her depth
runners.spotlight: Fell in a point and tailed-off in a bumper; way out of her depth.

7:20.race_name: Clonmel Show Sunday July 6th Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Duke Silver
runners.comment: Went close on his last hurdle start; that was 3m but he's fine over this far
runners.spotlight: Never counted in a Flat race last weekend but had previously gone close in a 3m handicap hurdle at Wexford (good); can cope with this sharper test and slower ground; respected.

runners.name: Ballycashin
runners.comment: Confirmed her liking for this track when staying on for third over 2m here recently
runners.spotlight: Bumper and C&D winner; confirmed her liking for this track when staying on for third over 2m here recently and returning to further is an obvious move.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Ballycashin will go hurdling now even though she isn't the biggest. She is tough - Tony Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Avalo
runners.comment: Well backed to win a Wexford maiden last week but the second was rated only 83
runners.spotlight: Had failed to build on the promise of his bumper debut but was backed for a Wexford maiden last week (2m4f, good) and duly won well; however, the runner-up was rated only 83 so the form is nothing to shout about; handicap debut.

runners.name: Cathryns Ruby
runners.comment: Has run well enough in recent maidens at Cork to merit a close look on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Had two runs for this yard and sufficient promise in those Cork maidens (2m3f; soft/good) to believe she can pay her way in handicaps; considered.

runners.name: Star Official
runners.comment: Only fourth at Tramore but difficult to put a line though him in current vein of form
runners.spotlight: Took form to a new level by winning comfortably at Tramore (2m, yielding) but went up 8lb for that and came up short on last week's return visit; still difficult to put a line though him in current vein of form.

runners.name: Gimme A Buzz
runners.comment: Well-backed winner at Tipperary, making all; may need goodish ground so watch weather
runners.spotlight: Watch the weather as this 5yo seemed to improve for the drier ground (good to yielding) when justifying market confidence off 7lb lower at Tipperary (2m1f; made all); clear claims should conditions remain suitable, especially as he's off the same mark if factoring in jockey's claim.

quotes.race: SIS Supporting Irish Racing Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Gimme A Buzz is out of a very good mare who Willie Mullins trained once upon a time. He'll keep going for the summer because he loves the quick ground. I'm delighted with that and it was a lovely ride from Mark. He's a summer horse and will jump a fence in time - Enda Bolger, trainer.

runners.name: Lynchy Boy
runners.comment: 0-8; had no excuses from the front when beaten just under 5l at Kilbeggan three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Is 0-8; had no excuses from the front when beaten just under 5l at Kilbeggan three weeks ago (2m, good); may improve for this longer trip (placed behind Mr Dibbs in a 2m4f maiden) and the tongue-tie is new.

runners.name: Mr Dibbs
runners.comment: Won a Kilbeggan maiden 12 months ago but then twice tailed off in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Won a Kilbeggan maiden 12 months ago but then twice tailed off in handicaps, over 3m1f and 2m3f; needs to leave those efforts behind and has been absent since July.

runners.name: General Clermont
runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage De Clermont
runners.comment: Runner-up in his last three handicap chases and rated lower as a hurdler
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in his last three handicap chases and no reason why he shouldn't continue the good work back over hurdles off a lower mark in this discipline, provided the ground doesn't turn too soft.

runners.name: Kells Priory
runners.comment: Essentially disappointing since last summer's win; likely flattered a couple of runs back
runners.spotlight: Only real effort of note since last July's Killarney win (2m4f, good; same mark) was the third at Plumpton in April and yet they went no pace in that race; others preferred.

runners.name: Onefortheditch
runners.comment: Capable mare but hasn't looked that sharp in two comprehensive defeats after a break
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back handicaps last summer but hasn't looked that sharp in two comprehensive defeats after a break.

runners.name: Pirate Island

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late M J Daly

runners.comment: Not a bad effort on good to yielding last time when tried in blinkers; rain welcomed
runners.spotlight: Is 0-13 over hurdles; best form on testing ground so rain would be welcomed; not a bad effort on good to yielding last time when tried in blinkers; each-way claims.

runners.name: Grace Faraday
runners.comment: Needed to run better last time at Kilbeggan to make the shortlist for this
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over further at Limerick just over a year ago; needed to run better last time at Kilbeggan to make the shortlist for this.

runners.name: Kerlogue
runners.comment: First run in maidens was mildly encouraging but hasn't progressed; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer; first run in maidens was mildly encouraging but hasn't progressed; handicap debut.

runners.name: Adaliz
runners.comment: Just got up over C&D 22 days ago; only 4lb higher and entitled to improve some more
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced mare who was in first-time cheekpieces when getting up in the nick of time over C&D last month (good); only 4lb higher and entitled to improve some more.

runners.name: Angelsworknovrtime
runners.comment: Successful last summer but opposable on balance of form and lacks a recent run
runners.spotlight: Last summer's Kilbeggan win off 5lb lower remains her sole win in 26 starts; opposable on balance of form and lacks a recent run.

runners.name: Ar Nos Na Gaoithe

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Kathy Kenna

runners.comment: Reserve; first and third in successive handicaps and latest effort can be upgraded
runners.spotlight: First reserve; C&D winner in February (soft) and then went close off just 3lb lower at Down Royal; latest effort can be upgraded; possibilities if getting a run.

quotes.race: Kilmolash (Q.R.) Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Ar Nos Na Gaoithe is just a small, summery mare and one that will give her owners tremendous fun. I told them we will keep trying and we will have our day - Philip Rothwell, trainer

runners.name: Cramers Valley
runners.comment: Reserve; below par at Cork the last time but runner-up in his two previous handicaps
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; below par at Cork the last time but runner-up in his two previous handicaps; inconsistent but capable.

runners.name: Red Striker
runners.comment: Reserve; tailed off in a handicap hurdle before unseating back over fences last week
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; has won all sorts during his career but was tailed off in a handicap hurdle before unseating back over fences last week.

quotes.race: Dar Golf Construction Handicap
quotes.quote: Today was genuinely only a fact-finding day. He's done a few pieces of work but we're only learning about him like everyone else. Colin said they went no gallop, which, in hindsight, wouldn't have suited him but he liked the ground, which is a positive. We thought at home that a mile and two furlongs is no problem to him, I'd say in time when we step him up into a higher grade of a race and they go a good honest gallop, that might suit him. He was honest today and we'll take the positives out of it. Fitness-wise he'll improve - we definitely haven't cooked him - and it was a good day out for him - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer of Red Striker

runners.name: Fils Doudairies
runners.comment: Doesn't seem as good as he was; off level weights when just ahead of My Gaffer last time
runners.spotlight: Has plenty of back-class and didn't run at all badly in the County Hurdle at Cheltenham; however, it was off level weights when just ahead of My Gaffer last time and will need to run better to win this, even with Finn Brickley taking off 7lb.

quotes.race: Kevin McManus Bookmaker Grimes Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: He just beat Cash Back at Ballinrobe so Fils D'oudairies has come forward from that, hopefully he'll keep going. I was waiting for Sharjah the whole way up the straight but to be fair he galloped all the way to the line. He jumps and travels so I'd say he would be entitled to take his chance at Galway - Jack Kennedy, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Fils D'Oudairies gave a nice performance there and got a beautiful ride from Donagh. He was too keen last time and took a tired fall, Joseph was keen for to drop him in here and it worked well. He loves that ground and is a horse with a big future if everything goes right - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's won plenty of races and he's got plenty of options too. He looks a lot better handicapped over fences than he is over hurdles, given he has a chase mark of 137, so that might be an avenue we'll try to explore at some stage. 28-10-24

runners.name: Popova
runners.comment: Solid second from well off the pace after a break at Killarney and firmly in the mix
runners.spotlight: Has only won on goodish ground but seems effective on softer (rain forecast); solid second to My Gaffer from well off the pace after a break at Killarney and now better off at the weights with that rival; firmly in the mix.

quotes.race: Kerry Group Irish EBF Mares Hurdle
quotes.quote: Popova is a nice mare and stepped forward from the last day. She battled well to the line. She travelled much better today and stuck at it well - Rachael Blackmore, rider

runners.name: My Gaffer
runners.comment: Recently beat Popova and he faced a tough task at the weights last time at Ballinrobe
runners.spotlight: Back hurdling to beat Popova in a handicap at Killarney, making all (second ridden colder); now 10lb higher but ran as well as he was entitled to in the face of a tough task at Ballinrobe (Fils d'Oudairies just ahead of him off level weights); chance.

quotes.race: Killarney Oaks Hotel Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: On a track like this over 2m4f, we hoped it would suit My Gaffer. You'd imagine he would be able to pick up another hurdle, some of the summer tracks will suit him for picking up another chase - Danny Mullins, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Monksgrange Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: My Gaffer promised a lot. We ran in in some big handicap hurdles and he was too small, he got crowded out. He's a brilliant little jumper and I would say some of those summer Nationals around the likes of Ballinrobe will be the races for him. He's a nice little horse - John Ryan, trainer

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: He was gutsy and tenacious and even when the horse came to him My Gaffer kind of picked up a bit - Walter O'Connor, representing the owner.

runners.name: Colleen Danu
runners.comment: Improving for this yard and drew clear for a 5l success over C&D 22 days ago; 2lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Is 2lb out of the weights but improving for this yard and drew clear for a 5l success over C&D 22 days ago (good; first-time tongue-tie); there's rain forecast but she has soft-ground form.

runners.name: Oh So Charming
runners.comment: 5l away at Listowel four days ago (2m, good) and may appreciate this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Only his second run in a handicap hurdle when under 5l away at Listowel four days ago (2m, good) and may appreciate this longer trip; 2lb out of the weights.

runners.name: Eco Pete
runners.comment: Chased home the market principals in a 2m3f maiden last time; not dismissed
runners.spotlight: Struggled over fences but returned to hurdles with a respectable third in maiden company behind the market principals (2m3f, good); not dismissed despite being 4lb wrong.

quotes.race: Molson Coors Beverage Company INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Eco Pete was quite good. He stayed well and he's fit. We might put him away and bring him back in the spring - John McConnell, trainer.

runners.name: Takarengo
runners.breeder: Jas Linnane, J Moore & B Gardiner
runners.comment: Stayed on well for second here recently but hard to win with and 5lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well for second here recently but he's hard to win with and 5lb out of the weights on this occasion; rain wouldn't harm his chances.

quotes.race: corkracecourse.ie Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Takarengo is a very good jumper but he can lose lengths at times and I'm not sure if hurdling is for him. If the owner wants to run him at Punchestown or somewhere like that then maybe we can look at that but I think the main target is the Cesarewitch, which he was third in last year. There's a few nice pots between now and then and he needs a bit of nice ground, he's not a good-to-firm ground horse. He was in real good order and today was his day to win a race over hurdles - Tom Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: idealgraphix.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Today was all about getting him right for either next weekend or the weekend after. There's a 50 grand handicap here next weekend and there's a 100 grand one in Naas the following week. He'll get a nice little slap from the handicapper now, I suppose he's entitled to, and it'll give him a decent weight in either handicap. Then we'll think about hurdling or something. he could do anything. He could even be an Ebor horse for next year and he could go further - Tom Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Roscommon Apprentice Maiden
quotes.quote: We were fancying him coming here. A mile and a half or two miles would be no problem to him. I thought the ground would be worse than it was, they say it's heavy but I don't think it is. When the two horses ran off the bend it wasn't a help, making his own running is the last thing this lad wants. We'll try to sneak into a good handicap over a mile and six or two miles. He's too low for the Cesarewitch but the front two today came away from the rest - Ben [Coen] said they came to him twice and he pulled out more for him twice. More than likely he'll go hurdling in time, he's a big raw horse - Tom Mullins, trainer of Takarengo

runners.name: Carrigg Island
runners.comment: Shock debut winner; did plenty wrong when last next time and he's now hooded
runners.spotlight: A 66-1 winner of a Limerick maiden (2m5f, good) but still went off at 20s at Killarney (2m4f, yielding) and trailed in last after doing plenty wrong; now hooded.

quotes.race: D & J Glazing (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I didn't think it was an overly strong race on paper. I thought Carrigg Island would be in the first three but I did think [Mashalla Habibi] Pat Foley's off a rating of 116, with experience, might outdo us. He will probably go into novice company next. He'll definitely stay and he could jump a fence before the end of the summer - Eoin McCarthy, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Grimaud

prev_owners.owner: Riviera Equine Sarl, Haras D'Etreham Et Al

runners.comment: Contested a rated hurdle last week; has strong form claims in this easier race
runners.spotlight: Flat winner in France and added a soft-ground maiden hurdle at Gowran in March, after which he finished eighth of 17 in a handicap at Aintree's Grand National meeting; it was a useful rated hurdle in which he was beaten just under 10l last week at Wexford and the good ground was perhaps livelier than he prefers; unraced over this trip but stays 2m4f; major player.

quotes.race: Golf Classics At Gowran Park Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Grimaud had the form and would have wanted to be winning that so it's nice for him to get off the mark. He wouldn't mind the ground a bit better. It's very testing and he did well to get through it - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a few times in France, winning at La Teste De Buch, and looks nice a nice recruit. 28-10-24

runners.name: Trasna Na Pairce

prev_owners.owner: Mrs D P Magnier & Mrs Veronica Sherwood

runners.comment: Made all in a 2m3f maiden here recently; the clear second ran quite well last weekend
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer and second in a bumper for previous yard; only his third start for current one when making all over 2m3f here three weeks ago (on good) and the runner-up, who was a distance clear of rest, was third to a Mullins hotpot last weekend.

runners.name: Huntsgrove
runners.comment: As was the case when tailed off at Kilbeggan, these terms are not easy
runners.spotlight: Narrow winner of a 2m4f maiden at Sligo (good) but was a tailed-off last of three in a Kilbeggan novice last weekend; as was the case there, these terms aren't easy.

runners.name: Cooladdi
runners.comment: Looked a danger to all when falling in a point at Fairyhouse in late April
runners.spotlight: Looked a danger to all when falling in a point at Fairyhouse in late April; that form has yet to be tested.

runners.name: Flip Away
runners.comment: Made his debut here in April and dropped away to be tailed off in the end (9-1)
runners.spotlight: Made his debut here in April and dropped away to be tailed off in the end; didn't appear unfancied at 9-1 and cheekpieces are now on.

runners.name: Groucho Max
runners.comment: Insufficient promise in his recent point outing to warrant a second look on bumper debut
runners.spotlight: Insufficient promise in his recent point outing to warrant a second look on bumper debut.

runners.name: Kalgoorlie Gold
runners.comment: No worthwhile form in two points and three starts under rules, including two maidens
runners.spotlight: No worthwhile form in two points and three starts under rules, including two maiden hurdles.

runners.name: Kidam Roque
runners.comment: Weakened to be beaten about 17l at Tipperary just over a year ago; went off at just 12s
runners.spotlight: Weakened to be beaten about 17l at Tipperary just over a year ago (good to yielding); did go off at only 12-1 so perhaps better was expected of him.

runners.name: Watch Hill
runners.comment: Pulled up in his only point but the ground was very testing
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in his only point but the ground was very testing; perhaps best to not read a great deal into that but still only of interest here if backed.

runners.name: Shabra Diya
runners.comment: Has shown definite ability in five bumpers but he's now looking a shade exposed
runners.spotlight: Has shown definite ability in five bumpers but he's now looking a shade exposed and looks vulnerable once more.

runners.name: Stede Bonnet
runners.comment: Positively ridden at Kilbeggan and only conceding late on to an Emmet Mullins inmate
runners.spotlight: A 75,000euros buy and well related; only 5-2 at Kilbeggan three weeks ago (2m3f, good) and gave it a good go from the front, only conceding late on to an Emmet Mullins inmate who ran well the time before; obvious claims.

runners.name: Forty Kay
runners.breeder: Mickley Stud, F Ellis & Mr & Mrs Dawson
runners.comment: Â£11,000 3yo; ninth foal; half-sister to a Flat winner in Cyprus; dam 1m4f winner
runners.spotlight: An Â£11,000 3yo; ninth foal; half-sister to a Flat winner in Cyprus; dam 1m4f winner (RPR 89), closely related to Racing Post Trophy/Dante winner Dilshaan; obvious contender for her powerhouse yard.

runners.name: Mary Mammon
runners.comment: Highly tried in a Listed bumper first time out at Limerick but trailed in last at 50-1
runners.spotlight: Highly tried in a Listed bumper first time out at Limerick but trailed in last at 50-1.

runners.name: Bobby Mcgee
runners.breeder: Genesis Green Stud & Lady Juliet Tadgell
runners.comment: Behind Extravagant and Frescobaldi on debut at the Curragh; tough ask to reverse form
runners.spotlight: Behind Extravagant and Frescobaldi on debut at the Curragh, beaten roughly 7l; should improve but so will the aforementioned rivals so turning the form around may be tough.

runners.name: Clarity Of Thought
runners.comment: 160,000gns yearling; distant 5th on debut; didn't really shape like he wanted 7f
runners.spotlight: 160,000gns yearling who was slowly away before finishing a distant fifth of 12 in a Navan maiden; didn't really shape like he wanted this extra furlong and others hold stronger claims.

runners.name: Dream Legend
runners.comment: Didn't show anything when eighth of nine in a Naas barrier trial over this trip last month
runners.spotlight: Didn't show anything when eighth of nine in a Naas barrier trial over this trip last month; dam unraced half-sister to 7f 2yo winner Word Play, out of 7f 2yo winning sister to 6f Listed winner Repartee, is granddaughter of unraced half-sister to top-class miler Kingman; likely to need more time.

runners.name: Equilux
runners.comment: St Mark's Basilica colt who ran well for a long way in a barrier trial last month
runners.spotlight: St Mark's Basilica colt; half-brother to winners Hogmanay (4.5f/7f including AW 2yo/US dirt) and Clock Tower (Italian 1m); dam 5f-7f winner (including 2yo/Group 3; RPR 108), sister to Italian 5f-6f winner Questi Amori; had a wide trip and did well to finish third in a Naas barrier trial last month; bred to be a forward 2yo and has to be high on the shortlist with that barrier experience under his belt.

runners.name: Extravagant
runners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg
runners.comment: Wootton Bassett colt; green when 2nd at the Curragh on debut; significant form boost since
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett colt who looked green when finishing 3l runner-up on his Curragh debut over 6f and the winner from that race has hit the crossbar in a Group 3 since; had re-opposing stablemate Frescobaldi in behind that day, as well as Bobby McGee; has the best form on offer and pedigree suggests he's going to improve for this extra furlong.

runners.name: Frescobaldi

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: 2l behind stablemate Extravagant at the Curragh; tough to turn that form around
runners.spotlight: Roughly 2l behind stablemate Extravagant on debut at the Curragh; suspicion he'll struggle to turn that form around but may prove best of the rest with improvement likely.

runners.name: Green Soul
runners.comment: Beaten a neck on debut but was turned over by 80-1 shot; rivals' Curragh form is stronger
runners.spotlight: Only beaten a neck in a Roscommon maiden last month but was turned over by an 80-1 shot and suspicion the Curragh formline that involves three of today's rivals is much stronger.

runners.name: Piazza San Marco
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Dam 1m 2yo/1m2f Listed winner; well bred but stablemates have experience over him
runners.spotlight: St Mark's Basilica colt; dam 1m 2yo/1m2f Listed winner (RPR 104), half-sister to winners September (7f 2yo Listed), Sir John Hawkins (Group-placed 6f 2yo) and Wisconsin (useful 12.5f), out of Irish Oaks/Yorkshire Oaks winner; beautifully bred newcomer but his stablemates have racecourse experience over him this time.

runners.name: Second Line
runners.comment: Yard do well with juveniles but this maiden looks a tough one for a newcomer
runners.spotlight: Night Of Thunder colt; dam 1m-1m2f winner (including Listed; RPR 102), half-sister to winners Nails Murphy (7f including 2yo) and Scorpion Black (7f/1m), out of 1m4f winner, is granddaughter of US 1m1f Grade 1 winner Dress To Thrill; yard do well with juveniles but this maiden looks a tough one for a newcomer.

runners.name: Andosky
runners.comment: Nando Parrado filly; half-sister to Qatari 5.5f-7f winner; dam 6f winner; tough ask
runners.spotlight: Nando Parrado filly; half-sister to Qatari 5.5f-7f winner Tomorrownevercomes; dam 6f winner (including AW 2yo; RPR 78), half-sister to useful 5f/6f winner Kool Henry, out of half-sister to 1m Group 2 winner Hurricane Al; speed in pedigree but up against it on debut.

runners.name: Gemical
runners.owner: G C Gale & Stuart Brown & Diane Stewart
runners.comment: Dam unraced half-sister to winners over 1m6f (Listed) and 1m2f (Listed); may need further
runners.spotlight: Magna Grecia filly; dam unraced half-sister to winners Sun Of Gold (French 1m6f Listed) and Salve Venezia (German 1m2f Listed), out of German 10.5f winner, is granddaughter of German Oaks winner; may want a bit further.

runners.name: Germanese
runners.comment: Minor signs of ability on debut last August; best watched on return from 301 days off
runners.spotlight: Minor signs of ability on debut last August; best watched on return from 301 days off provided market support doesn't arrive.

runners.name: My Vonnie

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Mrs S M Rice

runners.comment: Promising debut but hasn't kicked on and will get better chances than this in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Promising debut but hasn't kicked on and will get better chances than this in handicaps.

runners.name: Hostility
runners.owner: Qatar Bstock Ltd/D Howden/China Horse Club/Ballylinch Stud
runners.comment: 4th to Delacroix on debut and in the frame in 4 subsequent runs; 7f on soft is ideal
runners.spotlight: Fourth behind Delacroix on debut and has hit the frame in each of his four subsequent outings; beaten favourite both starts this term but a gelding procedure and/or first-time cheekpieces could do the trick and his best effort came over this trip on soft ground.

runners.name: Immortal Jock
runners.comment: Minor progress from first run to second but needs sizeable step forward and drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Minor progress from first run to second when beaten roughly 7l at the Curragh a fortnight ago; needs sizeable step forward now and drawn wide.

runners.name: Knockmark
runners.comment: Left debut behind with 2 4ths this term; more required and may get better chance in h'caps
runners.spotlight: Left his debut behind with a 3l defeat at Dundalk on April's return; similar level of form back on turf at Leopardstown last month; needs more to figure in this and handicaps may represent better opportunities.

runners.name: No Such Thing
runners.comment: Went close in Curragh maiden on debut; some good runs since; spurned good chance latest
runners.spotlight: Went close in 21-runner Curragh maiden on debut and several good efforts in defeat since but spurned a good opportunity in a maiden claimer at Roscommon last time when 8-15fav; hard to recommend on the back of that.

runners.name: Poweracclaim
runners.comment: Caught the eye having met trouble on debut and similar form at Curragh since; respected
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye having met some trouble in running on debut at Gowran and wasn't beaten far (roughly 2l) when fourth in a Curragh maiden since; return to slower ground looks fine and while others have achieved a bit more, he's unexposed; ought to be in the mix from stall two.

runners.name: Royal Belief
runners.comment: Well held 66-1 shot on debut three weeks ago and hard to see him getting involved here
runners.spotlight: Well held 66-1 shot on debut three weeks ago and hard to see him getting involved here.

runners.name: Scarlet Raider
runners.breeder: Machmer Hall, Carrie Brogden & Craig Brogden
runners.comment: Beaten 6l over 7f at Leopardstown last month; should build on that if handling this ground
runners.spotlight: Beaten roughly 6l over this trip in a Leopardstown maiden last month; should build on that if he handles the likely slower conditions.

runners.name: Virgil Tibbs
runners.comment: Son of Circus Maximus; half-brother to 5f AW winner Phil's Dream; gelded; best watched
runners.spotlight: Son of Circus Maximus; half-brother to 5f AW winner Phil's Dream (RPR 66) and a winner in Greece; dam unplaced 7.6f-1m2f (47), half-sister to French Listed-placed 7f winner Lonesome Me, out of unraced sister to two US Grade 2 winners; already gelded and probably best watched.

runners.name: Eastern Peace
runners.owner: Martin W Walsh & Joanne Lavery & Tony Carey & Brian Murray
runners.comment: Not disgraced when 4th of 5 in Gr 2 Debutante when last seen; bit to find; may need this
runners.spotlight: Stayed on okay on debut and wasn't disgraced when fourth of five in the Group 2 Debutante Stakes when last seen; bit to find and may need this after 286 days off but she's one to keep an eye on, particularly if the market speaks in her favour.

runners.name: Grown Ups
runners.comment: Prince Of Lir filly; half-sister to 6f/7f winner Dandyville (RPR 104); dam 7f winner
runners.spotlight: Prince Of Lir filly; half-sister to 6f/7f winner Dandyville (including AW; RPR 104); dam 7f 2yo winner (69), half-sister to useful 6f winner Arnhem, out of half-sister to prolific 6f-1m4f winner Dharkan; suitable trip for debut but this is probably a tough ask for a newcomer.

runners.name: Sandi O Mali
runners.comment: Sands Of Mali filly; half-sister to Italian 6.7f/7.5f winner; best watched making debut
runners.spotlight: Sands Of Mali filly; half-sister to Italian 6.7f 2yo/7.5f winner Il Grigio; dam unplaced 5f-7f 2yo (RPR 47), closely related to 5f 2yo Listed winner Warsaw, half-sister to Japanese 6f 2yo Grade 3 winner Meiner Eternel; speed in pedigree; probably best watched making her debut.

runners.name: Senior Situation
runners.comment: Hasn't beaten a rival in two efforts at triple figure odds so far
runners.spotlight: Hasn't beaten a rival in two efforts at triple figure odds so far.

runners.name: Shes A Gift
runners.comment: Iffraaj filly; 2,400gns 2yo; related to winners at this trip but tough ask for newcomer
runners.spotlight: Iffraaj filly; cost 7,500gns as a yearling and 2,400gns as a 2yo; half-sister to 6f/7f winner Hydration (AW; RPR 101); dam 7f AW winner (73), half-sister to Listed winners Toi Et Moi (1m2f/1m4f) and Moi Meme (10.5f), out of 1m1f/1m2f Group 3 winner; tough ask for a newcomer.

runners.name: Sindria
runners.comment: Shaped with minor promise on debut; too keen on Naas return; 7f drop may help her settle
runners.spotlight: Shaped with minor promise when making up some ground in a 7f Curragh maiden on debut; too keen on return at Naas over 1m; return to 7f may help her settle but has a bit to find.

runners.name: Wegotogether
runners.comment: Better run latest but probably one for handicaps at this stage and she has a wide draw
runners.spotlight: Left her first two runs behind when 5l third of six at Cork last month; steps back up in trip; probably one for handicaps at this stage and she has a wide draw.

runners.name: Winters Breath
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: 9th of 16 in Tipperary maiden last week; only 6s that day but stall 17 won't be easy here
runners.spotlight: Well held ninth of 16 in a Tipperary maiden last week; was only 6-1 that day so better expected here but stall 17 won't be easy to overcome.

runners.name: Va Va Vroom
runners.comment: Highly tried at Pattern level after maiden win; didn't make impact; well held on h'cap bow
runners.spotlight: Highly tried at Pattern level after her maiden win last season but couldn't make an impact and similar story on handicap debut on return; now tried with tongue-tie.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Va Va Vroom ran really well at Gowran ajnd it was good to see her put it all together there. She was still a bit green but she did it well. She's in the Debutante and we will have a look at that - Jessica Harrington, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She disappointed us in France when she ran in a Group 2 at Deauville last August. They got a lot of rain the night before the race and the ground changed, so that didn't suit her - she likes to hear her hooves rattle. She finished off her season in a Listed race at Dundalk, but she got no run at all and came home strong. Her work at home is just starting to come together now and a bit of warm weather will help her. 23-04-25

runners.name: Roosevelt
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier/Michael Tabor/Derrick Smith/Peter M Brant
runners.comment: 1m4f winner latest, leaving debut behind but has to be a chance 7f is sharp on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Last of 10 on debut at Leopardstown (1m2f) but left that behind when making all over 1m4f back at Leopardstown last month; fascinating contender on handicap debut but has to be a chance that 7f is too sharp.

quotes.race: Captain Dara Fitzpatrick Memorial Maiden
quotes.quote: Wayne [Lordan] gave Roosevelt a lovely ride. He ran here the last day and Declan [McDonagh, jockey] spoke highly of him, just he's a big, burly coat and he's still carrying plenty of condition. He's stepped forward and Wayne said he had two big blows before the line so it's a good sign. He stays very well and could back here for something like the Nijinsky. He could end up in an Irish Derby or be a Queen's Vase horse - Chris Armstrong, trainer's representative.

runners.name: Orchidaceae

prev_owners.owner: Team Valor International LLC & A Oliver

runners.comment: Won 2 of 3 as a juvenile and Group 3 return was promising; beaten fav in h'cap latest
runners.spotlight: Won two of her three starts as a juvenile and returned with a respectable 6l defeat in Group 3 company; beaten favourite in Curragh handicap since but that is worth forgiving and can resume progress here.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Orchidaceae won well at the Curragh so we were quite hopeful coming here. Everything went to plan and it was very straightforward. She loves that ground and we will have to look at stepping her up in grade - Andy Oliver, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Orchidaceae is one that Andy liked and he thought if I got a bit of cover today she might come home well. I would have no problem going another furlong - Andy Slattery, rider

runners.name: Glyndwr
runners.comment: Dundalk maiden winner in October but he's shown very little in two runs this term
runners.spotlight: Dundalk maiden winner in October but he's shown very little in two runs this term, including back at this trip 13 days ago.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: He is a horse who doesn't do anything quick, really Glyndwr would like to go 1m. Seven was our only negative today but he broke well and got to the line well. He'll be a 1m2f horse next year - Colin Keane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Just Before
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Leopardstown maiden win last term; shaped like 7f may suit latest and slow ground may help
runners.spotlight: Leopardstown maiden (7f, soft) winner as a juvenile; not at the same level in four runs this term but stayed on okay over 6f last time and slower ground might help too.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: I was shocked when the handicapper gave Just Before a mark of 74 and disappointed. I thought she was better than that and she obviously is - Willie Browne, trainer

runners.name: Powerful Lady
runners.comment: Fillies' maiden winner on AW in January; not competitive back on turf recently in h'caps
runners.spotlight: Fillies' maiden winner on AW in January but hasn't managed to get competitive since, including in two seven furlong handicaps back on turf last month; now tried with tongue-tie.

runners.name: Spycraft
runners.breeder: S A R L De Chambure Haras D'Etreham,Gestut Zur Kuste Ag,S A
runners.comment: Won AW maiden in December but hasn't beaten many home since inc' h'cap bow latest
runners.spotlight: Won a Dundalk maiden on December debut but hasn't beaten many home in three starts since including on handicap debut last time out.

runners.name: Kilmood Susan
runners.comment: 0-7; consistent sort but vulnerable to improvers
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden but she's a consistent sort who gave it a good go from the front on Sunday's handicap debut; vulnerable to improvers though.

runners.name: Sir Jeremy
runners.comment: Winner on handicap debut in September but hasn't kicked on since
runners.spotlight: Winner on handicap debut in September but hasn't kicked on since and no signs of a revival at Naas last month.

runners.name: Boyne Valley
runners.comment: Showed ability in maidens as 2yo but entitled to need this after 339 days off; 2lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in maidens as a juvenile but entitled to need this after 339 days off and she's 2lb wrong.

5:50.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Race

runners.name: King Cuan
runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Rated 96, smart from in valuable races at Naas in 2023, should improve for latest, player
runners.spotlight: Rated 96; smart form in 2023 included back to back wins in valuable sales' races at Naas at 6f on good to yielding and 7f on soft; missed all of 2024 so was entitled to need his comeback in Listed company at Cork; could improve plenty for that and he's a major player.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Race Final (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I knew I was probably on the best horse in the race. King Cuan cruised there and picked up to win well. He was just getting a bit lonely in front and on that ground you are never going to be ultra impressive. He gets seven well which opens up options for next year. He's a game little horse - Billy Lee, rider.

quotes.race: Goffs Sportsman's Challenge
quotes.quote: King Cuan is a grand horse. Things did not go smoothly but he was able to overcome it with his ability. I was keen that he ran at Cork last week before coming here. That might be it for this year, he has a lot of talent - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: King Cuan was given plenty of time to mature and fill his frame after the Curragh and he confirmed here what he showed there. He is a quick horse - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

runners.name: Tango Flare
runners.comment: Rated 97, has won the last two renewals of this, nice prep run at the Curragh, big chance
runners.spotlight: Rated 97 on turf; has won this race for the last two years running; shaped very nicely on his seasonal return in a Curragh handicap last month; that should have left him spot on and may be able to complete the hat-trick.

runners.name: Jorge Alvares
runners.comment: Rated 88, gets weight from top two, go well if turned out quickly after good Curragh run
runners.spotlight: AW winner is rated 88 on turf; has gone close in handicaps at Cork (5f) and Naas (6f) on his last two starts; gets weight from his older rivals and should run well if taking his chance after a good effort in a 5f premier handicap at the Curragh on Wednesday.

runners.name: Rowdy Yeats
runners.comment: 3yo won 7f maiden on testing ground, beaten over 1m latest, down in trip, rain would help
runners.spotlight: Consistent 3yo rated 91 after four starts; won a Naas maiden on seasonal return (7f, sft-hvy); beaten favourite on latest at Cork (1m, soft); drops back in trip and not discounted, especially if there is significant rain.

quotes.race: Space Traveller At Compas Stallions (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: We fancied Rowdy Yeats when he went to the Curragh last year but he was beaten by a very good horse [Arizona Blaze] and they were a long way clear of the third. I found it hard to get him back and I don't think he was 100 per cent when he came here at the end of the season. He has been training well. There's no reason why he can't win good races and I'd be hopeful he can be a stakes horse. Jamie said he might get further. He said he travelled really smoothly but parked a bit in front. Colin Keane rides him in all his work and always liked him a lot - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: I Bid You Ajou
runners.comment: Won C&D claimer last week; revised mark demands more; 10lb claimer takes over
runners.spotlight: Won a C&D claimer last week but revised mark will demand more back in handicap company; has soft ground form so rain won't be an issue; 10lb claimer takes over.

runners.name: Alex Belardo
runners.comment: 7f soft ground winner in September; drops to 6f on return and has stall 20 to overcome
runners.spotlight: Got the better of I Bid You Ajou in 7f soft ground handicap at Down Royal in September before signing off the campaign with a lesser run at Gowran; drop back to 6f for this return perhaps not ideal and has stall 20 to overcome; off 228 days.

quotes.race: Molson Coors Beverage Company Handicap
quotes.quote: We deserved it as much as Alex Belardo did, as he's a bit tricky. He put his best foot forward today and put his head down when needed so it was great to get the win, there may be more for him next year. He's in at Bellewstown (Thursday) so we'll see if he goes there - John McConnell, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Circles
runners.comment: All 4 wins on AW over 7f and well held at Ayr (1m) latest; has to prove herself on soft
runners.spotlight: All four wins on AW over 7f and well held at Ayr last month over 1m; has to prove herself on soft ground and others preferred.

quotes.race: Book Online @ DundalkStadium.com Handicap
