quotes.quote: Circles had been running well without winning but she is probably a bit stronger now. We left it late but I didn't want to get there early and get caught - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

runners.name: Shelbourne Flyer
runners.comment: 0-7; didn't kick on in h'caps over winter; best run at 7f and has been off 114 days
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who didn't kick on in handicaps at Dundalk over the winter; best run came on turf but that was over 7f and may need this after 114 days off; wears first-time tongue-tie.

runners.name: Distillate
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel Ohare & Philip Smith

prev_owners.owner: N O'Hare/G Devlin/J McCrory/Kabin Racing Syndicate
Nigel O'Hare/Gary Devlin/Joseph McCrory/Kabin Racing Synd

runners.comment: Hasn't been threatening this term but minor signs of a revival on Sunday and on fair mark
runners.spotlight: Hasn't been threatening this term but minor signs of a revival when only beaten 4l at Listowel on Sunday and didn't get the clearest of runs; slower ground and 6f both fine and she's down to a workable handicap mark.

quotes.race: Starman At Tally-Ho Handicap
quotes.quote: Distillate has improved all the time. Hopefully the handicapper won't be too hard on her and she should be a good fun filly. We'll probably go back to Dundalk for the winter - Ado McGuinness, trainer

runners.name: Marks One
runners.comment: Regressive towards end of last term; may need further and has been off 287 days
runners.spotlight: Regressive towards the back end of last season; may need further than this and entitled to need the run after 287 days off.

runners.name: Abiding Star
runners.comment: 0-13; shown little in 2 runs over this trip this season inc' C&D last week; eye-shield on
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden and shown very little in two runs over this trip this season including over C&D last week; eye-shield now tried as well as hood worn last week; has questions to answer at present.

runners.name: Carrigans Grove
runners.comment: Returned with 5f AW win and good run in defeat at Cork; has to prove herself on soft
runners.spotlight: Returned with 5f Dundalk win in April and big run in defeat back on turf at Cork last month; shaped like step up to 6f would suit but needs to prove herself in softer conditions.

runners.name: Lismacbryan Hill
runners.comment: 0-11; several good runs in defeat this term but they have been on good; below form latest
runners.spotlight: 0-11 but several good runs in defeat so far this season; a bit below form when last seen at Navan 20 days ago and all her better form has come on good so may not want the rain to arrive.

runners.name: Step Back In Time
runners.comment: Both wins at Navan, latest over 6f in April; respectable runs twice since; 6f/soft fine
runners.spotlight: Both wins at Navan, the latest over 6f in April and respectable efforts in defeat back at that track twice since; handles slower ground and return to 6f is fine; one for the shortlist.

quotes.race: Simonstown Handicap
quotes.quote: Step Back In Time got away with it today over the stiff five, she probably wants six. She ground it out really well. She has not been running badly and came out of the Cork race very well - Chris Timmons, trainer.

runners.name: Hastily
runners.comment: Went close on AW (5f) in March; struggled on turf since; best form on quicker ground
runners.spotlight: Went close over 5f at Dundalk in March but has really struggled since returning to turf and her better form has come on quicker ground.

quotes.race: Silver Shine Turf Services Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: I was lucky to pick up Hastily for 1,000gns, but she's a very big girl. It's a similar story with Coffeemeanscoffee, I suppose ? I picked her up for just 800gns. You need to be patient with these big-framed horses ? some of the bigger yards aren't - Tom McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Feature This
runners.comment: Some promising runs end of last term; poor form this season though; best form on AW
runners.spotlight: Some promising efforts towards the end of last term shortly after joining this yard but poor form so far this season; best form on AW and best turf effort came on good.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Feature This likes it up here. I was trying to get her to stay further but that's probably her trip. There was not much pace which probably suited her. She battled well and will probably keep going up here for the winter - Paul Flynn, trainer

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Feature This got a grand ride from Robert, he did everything I asked. I thought she was a bit lairy so we stuck the cheekpieces on her but she did it well - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Hezahunk

prev_owners.owner: Nigel O'Hare & Philip Smith & Mark Devlin

runners.comment: Dual 6f winner on AW; form dipped latest and stall 19 won't help
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f winner at Dundalk; 0-6 on turf but has shown ability; went close at Sligo on penultimate run but form dipped at Navan 20 days ago; hard to put a line through but stall 19 doesn't help.

runners.name: Leni Mo
runners.comment: Poor form in maidens and hasn't progressed in h'caps; cheekpieces need to have big effect
runners.spotlight: Poor form in maidens and hasn't progressed since handicapping; cheekpieces need to have dramatic effect.

runners.name: Livingston Range
runners.breeder: Newtown Stud And T J Pabst
runners.comment: Losing run goes back 2 years but well treated and only beaten a head over C&D last week
runners.spotlight: Losing run goes back nearly two years but has come a long way down the weights and it was his best run for some time when beaten a head over C&D last week; slower ground is fine and ought to go well again.

quotes.race: Foran Equine Irish EBF Auction Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Livingston Range came on for his run and his first run worked out very well. He's an improving horse and still quite green, so there's a lot of improvement in him. We've taken our time with him. He doesn't really want that heavy ground and he will step up in trip - Tracey Collins, trainer.

runners.name: American In Paris
runners.comment: Only beaten half length by Livingston Range last week; record on soft isn't encouraging
runners.spotlight: Only half a length behind Livingston Range last week but her record on slower ground isn't encouraging; may struggle to reverse form.

stable_tour.quote: She was extraordinarily green on her debut at Bath when running one of the most eyecatching races of the season. She was slowly away and last at halfway before really picking up in the last quarter-mile. To my eye she made up fully 12 lengths to go down by a short head. If ever the clichÃ© âa winner without a penaltyâ applied to a horse, it's her. You should watch the video and you won't believe the ground she made up. If she learned anything at Bath her turn will come very soon. 06-07-22

runners.name: Rattletheonionbag
runners.comment: 0-23 and struggling back on turf lately; slower ground may help but others more convincing
runners.spotlight: 23-race maiden and struggling back on turf lately; better turf runs have come with some cut and therefore, slower ground may help but others look more convincing.

runners.name: Magna Beauty
runners.comment: 0-6 and poor form in h'caps so far; tough draw returning from 130 days off; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden and poor form in handicaps so far; tough draw on return from 130 days off; wears first-time tongue-tie.

runners.name: Eruption
runners.comment: All 3 wins over 5/6f on good; not disgraced on yard debut last week; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; all three wins over sprint trips on good ground; not disgraced on yard debut last week; may come on for that.

runners.name: Amanirenas
runners.comment: Improved C&D run in claimer last week; shown little on soft and has widest draw; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; improved effort in a C&D claimer last week but shown very little on slower ground and has the widest draw.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Members Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Amanirenas showed she was coming back to herself at Fairyhouse. She is finding her way back and is well handicapped on last year's win. She enjoys it when she is not overcrowded - Michael Grassick, trainer

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Events & Recycling Handicap
quotes.quote: Amanirenas is a filly we liked in the spring. She tweaked something in her knee last day and has had a few easy weeks, so I thought she might need the run today. She will come forward and we will try and find a nice fillies handicap - Michael Grassick, trainer

runners.name: Jackie Brown
runners.comment: C&D winner who hasn't been disgraced in 2 recent runs; probably wants it quicker; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; C&D winner who hasn't been disgraced in two recent runs but probably wants it quicker.

runners.name: Blue Moon Boy
runners.comment: Gustav Klimt gelding, related to 6f-7f winners, likely best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Gustav Klimt gelding is an eighth foal; half-brother to winners Roman Times (6f; RPR 61) and Zain Dream (Macau 6.7f/1m); dam 6f AW winner (74), sister to useful 6f/6.5f winner Brave Prospector, half-sister to 7f Group 2 winner Welsh Emperor; likely best watched on debut.

runners.name: Diamond Cross
runners.comment: 200-1 and never figured in maidens at Navan and Gowran, unlikely to be the answer here
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 200-1 and never figured in maidens at Navan and Gowran; unlikely to be the answer here.

runners.name: Dun An Oir
runners.comment: Nicely-bred but well beaten on debut at Naas, Foley prefers his stablemate Iron Fist
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; well-bred Lope De Vega colt was beaten 23l on Naas debut in March; respected source but Foley prefers stablemate Iron Fist.

runners.name: Elman
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Well bred Lope De Vega colt, well-related dam a 1m winner, check the market on debut
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; son of Lope De Vega is a first foal; dam 1m winner (RPR 90), half-sister to winners Edelmira (1m4f Group 3) and Elishpour (useful 10.5f-2m), out of once-raced half-sister to Group 1 winners Ebadiyla (Irish Oaks/French Leger), Enzeli, Estimate (both Gold Cup) and Edabiya (7f 2yo); attractive page and worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: Happy Pharoah
runners.comment: Improved effort on second start, regally bred, should be more to come; place chance
runners.spotlight: Improved effort on second start at Navan (1m2f good) when beaten 5.5l into fifth of ten, not quite getting home; regally bred and should be more improvement to come; place chance.

runners.name: Iron Fist
runners.comment: 0-5, rated 80, best form has come on easy surfaces, place chance if the ground softens
runners.spotlight: 0-5 and rated 80; didn't get the clearest of runs at Gowran latest when beaten 5l on heavy ground; best effort last year over 1m on easy ground at the Curragh; place claims if the ground softens.

runners.name: Local Lad
runners.comment: Rated 92, ran well in Gr 3 last year on debut, worth a go at this trip, leading chance
runners.spotlight: 92 rated gelding ran a cracker on debut in a Curragh Group 3 last May over 6f (good); went close behind Galveston in a 1m Naas maiden in October, staying on well; may have needed comeback run in strong race at Kempton (1m) and pedigree suggests this trip may suit; leading chance.

runners.name: Mo Chroi
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Gratte Panche & M Michel Dardenne
runners.comment: Caught the eye on debut on AW, up in trip, lacks a run, worth market check on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye running on late for third on debut at Dundalk in November; off since and steps up in trip; Galiway colt is worth a market check on seasonal return and turf debut for in-form yard.

runners.name: Rizal
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Beaten similar distances in maidens at 1m-1m2f, well-bred but may need more time
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; beaten similar distances in 1m and 1m2f maidens at Gowran and the Curragh in first two starts; bred to do better at some stage but may need a bit more time.

runners.name: Simurgh
runners.comment: Not a bad effort on debut at the Curragh, should stay on pedigree, lacks a run, watch
runners.spotlight: Offered something to work with when an 8.5l fourth of 14 at the Curragh (1m, yld-sft) on debut last October; well-related dam won at this trip; may need this run but is worth watching with a view to the future.

runners.name: Truth Be Told
runners.comment: Rated 78, 0-3 on turf, gelded after below par run at Dundalk in March, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Five race maiden is 0-3 on turf and rated 78; gelded after below par effort at Dundalk in March; place chance on best form but has to prove he stays this far; others make more appeal.

runners.name: Eutropia
runners.comment: Promise over 7f on AW on debut, not as good at 1m next time, may be one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Ran a pleasing race on debut at Dundalk in December over 7f; didn't build on that upped to 1m the following month and off the track since; steps up in trip again but will probably do better when tackling handicaps.

runners.name: Matrice
runners.comment: Has improved for all three runs, close second on testing ground latest, chance if it rains
runners.spotlight: Has improved for each of her three runs; close third on second start at Dundalk (1m) and beaten just 0.75l on seasonal reappearance at Limerick in April (1m4f, sft-hvy); cheekpieces go on and she drops in trip; may need rain (non-runner on account of good ground twice).

7:35.race_name: Racing Again Next Friday Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Topomania
runners.comment: Promise in 2022, no show on stable debut after mammoth layoff, cheekpieces on, watch
runners.spotlight: Runner up in two of three starts in Britain in 2022; didn't show enough on stable debut after mammoth layoff in first-time blinkers which are now replaced by cheekpieces; watch.

runners.name: Roman Harry
runners.comment: Sound effort in Tipperary claimer latest after slow start, could go well back in h'cap
runners.spotlight: Sole win came on the beach at Laytown; sound effort in 1m1f Tipperary claimer (yld-sft) ten days ago, beaten 5l into second of 14 after missing the break; won't mind a drop of rain and could go well back in a handicap.

runners.name: Stormy Jenn
runners.comment: No win since 2022, unseated over hurdles latest, well-drawn but others preferred
runners.spotlight: Dual-puprose mare; last won in 2022; out of form in both codes since finishing second off 4lb higher at Naas last April; unseated when beaten over hurdles on seasonal return; well-drawn but others preferred.

runners.name: Jawhary
runners.comment: No win since 2021, decent effort on penultimate, could run into a place if in the mood
runners.spotlight: 1-30, the win coming in 2021 for former yard; not a bad effort on penultimate but well-beaten latest at Tipperary (12.5f, yld-sft); handicapper giving him a chance and could run into a place if in the mood.

runners.name: Asisaid
runners.owner: J Leigh & J Orourke & Teresa Leigh & Jenny Curley
runners.comment: 10lb below last win, beaten favourite latest at Gowran, this trip might suit, needs soft
runners.spotlight: Without a win since July 2023; beaten 6l when favourite on latest at Gowran (7f, heavy); is now 10lb below last win and shaped like this trip might suit last October at Gowran but he prefers soft ground; watch the weather.

quotes.race: O'Neill & Co. Apprentice Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Asisaid got his ground today and the blinkers helped. When he goes and does it he has plenty of ability. With the ground as it is we might go to Galway - Pat Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: ITBA Next Generation Handicap
quotes.quote: Asisaid was a bit backward physically and mentally. We're delighted with that, we knew he'd do a job but we just didn't think he do it as quickly. He came to hand very quick this year - Pat Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Master Garvey
runners.owner: Patrick M Obrien/Larry Murray/Richard W Walsh/Derek Cummins
runners.comment: 1-24 on turf, won an AW in March, poor on turf latest, drop in trip a plus, not discounted
runners.spotlight: 1-24 on turf; won at Dundalk (1m) in March and went close again there on penultimate over 10.5f; poor effort upped to 1m4f at Limerick latest; drop back in trip a plus and won't mind if it rains; Chris Hayes was on board for last win; not discounted.

runners.name: Dont Look Now
runners.comment: Placed on AW for former yard, lacks a run, watch on stable debut unless money comes
runners.spotlight: Seven race maiden is 0-1 on turf but went close a couple of times on AW for former yard; lacks a run and best watched on stable debut unless the market speaks.

runners.name: Our Lucky Lady
runners.comment: Not beaten far on h'cap debut on AW, can do better but wide draw not ideal on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in three maidens at Dundalk but not beaten that far on handicap debut there in March (10.5f); still early days and can do better but wide draw far from ideal on turf debut.

runners.name: Onemorestar
runners.comment: H'cap debut, long odds and well beaten in 6f-7f maidens, bred for this trip, check market
runners.spotlight: Rare Flat runner for yard; long odds and well-beaten in qualifying runs at 6f-7f on easy ground; this trip should suit on breeding and worth a market check on handicap debut.

runners.name: Blondina
runners.comment: Not disgraced on h'cap bow at this trip, poor at 7f latest, down in grade, 3yo may go well
runners.spotlight: Has shown glimmers of ability; not a bad run on seasonal return and handicap debut at Navan (1m2f, good); never involved dropped back to 7f at Roscommon latest; could do better back up in trip and down in grade.

runners.name: Felicity Smoak
runners.owner: E Dillon & B Power & J J Whelan & K R Waplington
runners.comment: Long odds and well beaten all five starts, down in grade and upped in trip, 3yo needs more
runners.spotlight: 3yo sent off at long odds and no impact in three maidens and two handicaps; eased 5lb for 9l defeat on seasonal return; drops in grade and steps up in trip but much more needed.

runners.name: Dolce Far Niente
runners.comment: 0-13, placed off 9lb higher last June, may have needed comeback, not dismissed
runners.spotlight: 0-13; yard amongst winners and this filly went close at Ballinrobe (9.5f, good) last June off 9lb higher; may have needed comeback and has a decent draw here; not dismissed.

runners.name: Together Aclaim
runners.comment: First turf win at Cork latest, form boosted by Deuteronomy, up 3lb, can't be discounted
runners.spotlight: Gained first turf win at Cork (10.5f, good) on latest off 41 when a 25-1 shot; form franked by the third Deuteronomy; not guaranteed to back that up given his overall profile but not discounted off 3lb higher.

runners.name: Kartayaz
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Four-time winner, good effort at Sligo for current yard latest, down 2lb, place shout
runners.spotlight: Won four for John McConnell at 10.5f; sole turf win came on yielding to soft at Down Royal in September 2022; good effort at Sligo on second start for this yard last month; down 2lb but draw not ideal; each way chance.

runners.name: Shahada Ace
runners.comment: 3yo, no impact in maidens or on h'cap debut, down 2lb and up in trip, needs more time
runners.spotlight: 3yo didn't show a lot in maidens and weakened over 7.5f on handicap debut at Roscommon last month; dropped 2lb and upped in trip but may need more time.

runners.name: Sassy Sox
runners.comment: 3yo has shown modest form in maidens, claimers and a handicap, hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: 3yo showed modest form in maidens and sole handicap start; similar story on seasonal return in a Gowran claimer last month, her first run for this yard; hard to make a case for.

runners.name: So Messi
runners.comment: 0-13 but has run well in defeat, beaten 3.5l latest, chance if builds on that, drawn wide
runners.spotlight: 0-13 but has shown winning potential; beaten 0.75l at Cork (1m2f, yielding) last May off 49; best run since a 3.5l seventh of 14 at Gowran (1m, good) on latest; chance if builds on that but draw hasn't been kind.

runners.name: Chriselli
runners.comment: Improved for handicaps, shaped like this trip might suit latest, down 3lb but drawn wide
runners.spotlight: 3yo improved on handicap debut at Dundalk (7f) in March when beaten 1.75l into fourth off 54; shaped like in need of further over 1m at Bellewstown latest; 3lb lower now and steps up in trip but has a wide draw to overcome.

runners.name: La Tulipe Noire

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Magette Meagher & Thomas P Meagher

runners.comment: Dual-purpose, out of form in both codes this year, 8.5l fourth in claimer latest; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; dual-purpose; sole win came on AW; out of form in both codes this year and beaten 8.5l when fourth in a Tipperary claimer latest (held by Roman Harry); others preferred.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (Fillies) Maiden
quotes.quote: La Tulipe Noire jumped okay, there wasn't much pace on and I was able to dictate. The blinkers helped her. She was tough and always doing enough, Declan McDonogh, rider.

runners.name: Forlio
runners.breeder: A C Coombs & Mr J William Rowley
runners.comment: Won off 60 last year; improved over C&D latest, wide draw, needs more, blinkers; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; won on debut for this yard off 60 at Limerick last year; improved on recent form when sixth of 17 from wide draw over C&D latest but still beaten 11l; similar draw here and blinkers go on; needs more.

quotes.race: AOS Security Handicap
quotes.quote: Forlio has done some amount of work but I did think he would need the run. Colin said he didn't really love the ground as it was sticky for him so normal soft would be better for him - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Deuteronomy
runners.comment: Won over 1m four days ago, 7lb penalty, well drawn, go well again if gets in; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; built on promise of 1l third behind Together Aclaim to win at Gowran (1m, good) four days ago; carries a 7lb penalty for that; this longer trip fine and he has a nice draw; go well again if getting a run.

quotes.race: KCLR 96FM Apprentice Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Deuteronomy was a little unlucky at Leopardstown as he got his gap and then it closed again. I thought if there was a little horse who deserved a win, it was him. I thought a mile on the drying ground would be on the sharp side but Shane Foley told me one day to put some headgear on him to help him concentrate so thanks to him as the visor helped - Robbie Burns, trainer.

8:10.race_name: Racing Again Next Friday Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Si Senior
runners.comment: Runner up over C&D latest from wide draw, same again here and 6lb higher, not discounted
runners.spotlight: Runner up in two of last three starts, including over this C&D latest when a bit short of room from wide draw; drawn even wider here and 6lb higher but not discounted if gets more luck in running.

runners.name: Theres No Limit
runners.comment: Ballinrobe claimer winner last June, in poor form when last seen, may need this run
runners.spotlight: Won a 9.5f Ballinrobe claimer last June; finished the year in poor form and may need this run on return.

runners.name: Barretstown
runners.comment: 1-28 on turf, tailed off on return from break at Navan, may need respite from handicapper
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner is 1-28 on turf; tailed off on return from break at Navan in April (1m2f, soft); remains 7lb above last win and may need more respite from the handicapper.

quotes.race: Racing Again June 14th Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: He jumped out well, travelled well and never got hassled for the lead. Barretstown was doing an even enough gallop, took breathers when he could and kept responding. It's good when you have a willing partner like that - Billy Lee, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Carvalhal
runners.comment: Back to form at Gowran (1m) latest, 7lb lower here with rider's claim, chance if stays
runners.spotlight: Best effort since joining this yard at Gowran earlier this week when a 1.75l third of 11 (1m, good) in first-time visor (retained); effectively 7lb lower here with rider's claim; chance if seeing out the longer trip.

stable_tour.quote: He's basically what you see. He won at Hamilton off 53 in early August over 1m1f and then went back over 1m2f at Ayr. He ran okay but I'm tempted to pull him back a furlong or two now and see how he copes. He's rated 60 and is capable off his current mark. 28-08-24

runners.name: Chopsticks
runners.comment: 0-17, beaten fav' last three starts, a shade unlucky latest, down in trip, go well again
runners.spotlight: 0-17 overall and 0-5 on turf; has been beaten favourite on last three starts off this mark; arguably a shade unlucky at Leopardstown latest (1m4f, good); drops in trip but should go well again.

runners.name: Cleopatras Needle
runners.comment: 1m5f may have been too far on return to Flat on latest, mark sliding, not discounted
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 1-21 on turf on the Flat; in good form over timber in April; 1m5f may have stretched her on return to this sphere at Navan last month; this trip more suitable and handicapper giving her a chance; not discounted.

quotes.race: Frank Lynch & Co Chartered Certified Accountants Supporting Louth GAA Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was Cleopatra's Needle's first run in a handicap and Sean was very good on her. He put her to sleep and was the last one to get into it. She's not a bad filly and she likes jumping. She showed a bit early on on the Flat and she was unlucky not to win three in a row. Then things just went wrong with her, she's a hard mare to keep right - Harry Rogers, trainer.

quotes.race: Book Your Navan Summer BBQ Packages Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Cleopatra's Needle worked very well last week but she always did work well and is a well-bred mare. She loves top of the ground and she's going jumping as she has schooled over hurdles. Robbie Power had her for a while, schooling her, and said she had plenty of scope - Harry Rogers, trainer.

runners.name: Picpoul

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Mrs S M Rice

runners.comment: Three-time AW winner, 0-5 on turf, held by Chopsticks on latest run, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner is yet to trouble the judge in five starts on turf; held by Chopsticks on Leopardstown run latest; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Happy Christmas From All At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's great to get Picpoul back on track, hopefully she'll now go on from this, next week there is another one for her. During the summer she had physio for a back problem but we have her back and I'm delighted with that. We wanted to try hurdling but she won't jump a pole! - Michael Rice, trainer, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: DundalkStadium.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Picpoul is the first Flat horse that I've trained so I might be looking at getting a few more in! She's a decent filly. We might step her up in trip. There is a two mile race here on Friday week so we'll have a look at that - Michael Rice, trainer.

runners.name: Gregorina
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Philip Smith & Nigel Ohare

prev_owners.owner: Miss E Nolan And Paul Hancock

runners.comment: Won twice last year off this sort of mark, capable but might need this after 114 days off
runners.spotlight: Won twice last summer, at Ballinrobe off 49 and Hamilton off 52; going through the motions at Dundalk earlier this year; capable off this mark on return to turf but drawn wide and might need this after a 114-day break.

runners.name: Jurality

prev_owners.owner: Straight To Victory Syndicate/Geoffrey Thorpe/Brian Bunyan
Straight To Victory Syndicate, Geoffrey Thorpe & Brian Bunya

runners.comment: Maiden has run well last twice, shaped like this trip may suit latest but drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Maiden has shaped nicely on his last two starts at Gowran and Killarney, both over 1m on good; shaped like this trip would suit last time but drawn wide and wouldn't want to see too much rain.

runners.name: Mr Mills
runners.owner: J A Magill & M G Quinn
runners.comment: Last won off 4lb higher, weakened quickly over 1m4f latest, needs to improve back in trip
runners.spotlight: 1-17 on turf, the win coming in July 2023 at Navan (1m2f, soft) for former yard; is 4lb lower now but weakened quickly on debut for this yard at Limerick (1m4f, sft-hvy) in April; may do better back in trip but others appeal more.

runners.name: Amavasya
runners.comment: 3yo made late gains over 1m latest, down in grade, bred for this trip, don't discount
runners.spotlight: 3yo filly ran respectably on first try at 1m at Leopardstown, held up and denied a clear run 2f out before staying on; worth a try at this longer trip on breeding, drops in grade and not discounted.

runners.name: Ill Be Handy
runners.comment: 3yo showed promise last year but beaten long distances this season, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: 3yo gelding showed promise in third maiden start at the Curragh but has been beaten long distances in all four starts this season at a variety of trips; hard to fancy right now.

runners.name: Vervain
runners.owner: T Egan & Crampscastle Bloodstock Ltd & J C Fleming
runners.comment: 3yo filly, finished last of 8 on handicap debut latest, cheekpieces need to transform
runners.spotlight: 3yo filly didn't show a lot in maidens and was last of eight on handicap debut at Killarney over 1m3f; yard in form and cheekpieces go on but she is hard to make a solid case for.

runners.name: Cuckaloo Hill
runners.comment: 3yo handicap debutante, modest form in maidens, best watched unless market speaks
runners.spotlight: 3yo filly makes handicap debut after three modest efforts in maidens at 7f-8.5f; best watched up in trip unless the market speaks.

runners.name: Lady Delila
runners.comment: 0-6 on turf, showed potential when fourth off 8lb higher at Cork last year, outrun odds
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on turf; best run a fast finishing 3.5l fourth of 14 behind Barretstown at Cork (1m2f, yielding) last May; 8lb lower now and may have needed comeback at Naas (1m, yielding); could outrun odds stepped back up in trip.

runners.name: Fervent
runners.owner: Gary Devlin & Kevin Osborne & Joseph Mccrory
runners.comment: 3yo, h'cap debutant, no impact in maidens, related to winners, may improve, check market
runners.spotlight: 3yo handicap debutant showed very little in maidens last year at 7f-1m on the AW and on soft ground; related to winners so should be capable of better at some point; lacks a run but check the market.

runners.name: Prom Queen
runners.comment: Slightly better effort on h'cap debut latest, down 4lb and back up in trip, more needed
runners.spotlight: Poor form in maidens but offered something to build on when midfield at Naas on handicap debut; dropped 4lb but needs a lot more stepped back up in trip.

runners.name: The Man Above
runners.comment: 0-5 on turf, yet to make inroads in h'caps, mark falling but needs to find improvement
runners.spotlight: Eight race maiden is 0-5 on turf; hasn't cut much ice since tackling handicaps; beaten around 7l last two starts; handicapper giving him a chance but needs to find improvement.

runners.name: Noble Andy
runners.comment: Ran well at Bellewstown last year in cheekpieces, poor this year, needs to revive; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; good second at Bellewstown (1m4f, yielding) last October off 55; hasn't matched that in two runs this term; blinkers worn last time replaced by cheekpieces (wore them at Bellewstown); needs a revival.

runners.name: Barrys Rock
runners.comment: Maiden, lost form after good run here last June, well beaten over C&D latest; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; long standing maiden is 0-20 on turf; went close over 1m4f here last June off 50 but has lost form since; beaten 29l on seasonal return over C&D last month; others more likely.

runners.name: El Bello
runners.comment: AW winner, has shaped like this trip is worth a go recently, not discounted; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; five-time AW winner at 7f is 0-15 on turf but not beaten far in three of last four starts at 7f on good ground; worth a go at this trip and not discounted if getting a run.

quotes.race: Bet On The Best Night Out At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: El Bello was tough all the way to the line. Two horses came alongside him and he battled well. You'd like to think he could get an extra furlong - Dan King, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A lightly raced gelding, things are really starting to click with him now. He won back-to-back races at Wolverhampton and Newcastle, both over 7f. He went up a fair bit to 80 from an opening mark of 71 - the handicapper actually hiked him 8lb for his last win at Gosforth Park. He relished the stiff 7f there and although he won at Wolverhampton I was not sure the track suited him, and my fears were proved correct last week when he was never happy and although he ran on well at the end it is not his course. We will keep him to stiffer venues in the future and he can win again. 25-05-22

9:28.race_name: Ogden Phipps Stakes presented by Ford (Grade 1) (4yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Main Track) (Dirt)

prev_owners.owner: Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners & B Flay Thoroughbreds

10:46.race_name: DK Horse Acorn Stakes (Grade 1) (3yo Fillies) (Main Track) (Dirt)

runners.name: Scottish Lassie
runners.owner: Sportsmen Stable, Parkland Thoroughbreds Et Al

runners.name: Shred The Gnar
runners.breeder: Camas Park Stud & Lynch Bages Ltd

runners.name: Bless The Broken
runners.owner: Cypress Creek Equine Llc & Madaket Stables Llc

runners.name: Look Forward
runners.breeder: Woods Edge Farm Llc & Ballyfair Bloodstock

runners.name: Quickick
runners.breeder: Gainesway Thoroughbreds Ltd & Whisper Hill Farm

11:25.race_name: New York Stakes presented by Rivers Casino (Grade 1) (4yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Mellon Course) (Turf)

12:04.race_name: Just A Game Stakes presented by Resolute Racing (Grade 1) (4yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Inner Turf)

runners.name: Kehoe Beach
runners.breeder: John Bates, Ron Kirk & Michael Riordan

runners.name: Do Gooder
runners.breeder: Suzanne S Masters & Michael W Masters

quotes.race: Tattersalls Falmouth Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: A Lilac Rolla has run another good race and we'll give her a break now with a view to something like the Matron Stakes at Leopardstown or the Prix de la Foret at Longchamp - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballylinch Stud "Priory Belle" Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: I think A Lilac Rolla is a good filly and I hoped she would do something like that. I was looking forward to coming here today although the heavy ground was a concern as her form was on good ground. She's uncomplicated and she's tough. She had every chance to curl up if she wanted to, but she didn't - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

quotes.race: ARC American Racing Channel Irish EBF Fillies Juvenile Race
quotes.quote: A Lilac Rolla learned a lot from the first day. I was a bit worried about the trip, being a Harry Angel. The plan had been the sales race on Champions Weekend and I figured that more experience might not have done her any harm for that. Those plans might be upgraded now - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: A Lilac Rolla is a nice filly and I thought she was ready to run. She went through the gears nicely. She will probably go for the sales race at the Curragh on Champions Weekend - Paddy Towmey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She won a Guineas trial, was second in the Irish Guineas and third in the Falmouth, so she definitely deserves to take her chance in the Matron Stakes at Leopardstown on Saturday week. She's versatile and she's consistent. She's yet to finish out of the first three. She's a smashing filly. 11-09-24

quotes.race: Prix de Psyche Sky Sports Racing (Group 3) (3yo Fillies) (Round Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I hope she can be a Group 1 filly. We'll give her a break and then look at the Prix de l'Opera - Mauricio Delcher Sanchez, trainer.

quotes.race: Balanchine Presented By DP World (Group 2) (Fillies & Mares) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Today there was much more pace early on. I was happy to sit in just behind the leaders. When we hit the straight, I asked Choisya to pick up and she did so very well. It's always a huge advantage for jockeys when horses can be in different positions and today she won because she's very versatile - Mickael Barzalona, jockey.

quotes.race: Cape Verdi Stakes (Sponsored by Al Tayer Motors) (Group 2) (Fillies & Mares) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I got an easy lead in front; it felt like a French race. When I asked Choisya to pick up she did it very well. It would have been better to have a lead but all of the others had the instructions to take back; sometimes it is lucky to have horses who are versatile like she is - Mickael Barzalona, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Dick Hern Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Choisya did a lovely piece of work the other day and she's brought that here. She went through the gears really well and she travelled great. The good gallop in the early part of the race definitely helped her out, she relaxed well. I was delighted with her performance - Harry Davies, jockey.

quotes.race: Coral Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Lovely run, drawn wide so switched tactics up a little bit today and dropped her in a bit, which seemed to work really nicely. We went an even gallop. There was a bit of scrimmaging in front of me and I managed to stay clear of that. Choisya got there quite easily. She's an improving filly, she's tough. We weren't sure about the ground, but she clearly went on it - Jack Mitchell, jockey.

quotes.race: Betting Better With Sky Bet Sankey Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a bit difficult as Choisya was hanging into the other horse. She didn't handle Goodwood last time and the return to a flat, galloping track worked a treat - Harry Burns, rider.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Atalanta Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Heredia was drawn ten of ten, which made things a lot more difficult. I don't think they went overly quick and she had to come a bit wide. I thought she'd run well after her last run. She's clearly in the form of her life and has never been moving better. She was a bit of a madam at the stalls. We were talking earlier on about some of the big races, perhaps in America, and she's probably fully justified to take on one or two of those opportunities. I thought we'd be lucky to win a Listed race early on in the year but she's thrived. She looks great. She was a very fast two-year-old and has got better with age - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Dick Hern Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Heredia has been a little bit disappointing but not through her own fault. Being back at this trip was a definite plus and the track has suited her. She's not straightforward as regards where you can place her in a race. On a track like this you can sit and ride her patiently and she's able to win like that. It opened up lovely for her and she has brilliant tactical speed. She likes to follow a fast pace and she does stay the mile quite well - Sean Levey, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Her Sandringham win last season was a highlight and the aim is to get her some black type wherever we can. She had a hard race at Royal Ascot and we never really got her back, but she seems in much better form now and is working very well. I think she'll go to the Guineas meeting. 02-05-23

runners.name: Sacred Wish
